title: Entry-Level or Associate Aerodynamics Engineer
description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that‚Äôs welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your... future with us.

Boeing Commercial Airplanes is seeking an Entry-Level or Associate Aerodynamics Engineer to support our 737 and 777 development programs in Everett, Washington.

Position Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Assists with the design and analysis of aerodynamic/aerothermodynamic flight vehicles to ensure that requirements are met
‚Ä¢ Assists with certification and qualification processes of the aerodynamic/aerothermal characteristics of flight vehicles
‚Ä¢ Works under close supervision
‚Ä¢ Supports 737-10 and 777-9 development teams

This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.

title: Senior Radio Systems Engineer
description:
At Sonos we want to create the ultimate listening experience for our customers and know that it starts by listening to each other. As part of the Sonos team, you‚Äôll collaborate with people of all styles, skill sets, and backgrounds to realize our vision while fostering a community where everyone feels included and empowered to do the best work of their lives.

Radio and seamless wireless... streaming are pillars of our promise to deliver the ultimate home music experience. This role is critical in driving high quality, new radio designs that empower all cross-functional teams to achieve the product experience targets.

As a Senior Radio Systems Engineer, you will lead a small team to develop, validate, and transition new Radio System designs to volume production. You will work with multi-disciplinary teams to drive innovation and meet challenging delivery schedules in a creative and fast paced environment. Design, simulate, and analyze multi-band (2-8GHz) Radio Systems using circuit and system level.

What You'll Do:
‚Ä¢ Be responsible for the system architecture and chipset selection.
‚Ä¢ Create schematics for the radio system and drive PCB layout design.
‚Ä¢ Perform system bring up, debugging, optimization, and performance verification.
‚Ä¢ Characterize full system (receiver and transmitter) performance as well as peripheral devices such as: RFIC transceivers, LNA‚Äôs, PA‚Äôs etc. Characterization includes measuring essential parametrics such as sensitivity, power, EVM, linearity, etc.
‚Ä¢ Work with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative radio solutions which meet a challenging Product Function Spec.
‚Ä¢ Oversee the transition from initial development to high volume manufacturing.
‚Ä¢ Support wireless related production problems and be able to contribute in a constructive way.
‚Ä¢ Provide support to our compliance team for regulatory certifications (FCC/IC/ETSI etc.).
‚Ä¢ Support SW, Digital EE, and platform teams.
‚Ä¢ Deliver high-level technical presentations to a broad cross-functional audience.
‚Ä¢ Mentor and develop junior level engineers.

Skills You'll Need:

Basic Qualifications
‚Ä¢ 8+ years of experience developing RF hardware and/or radio subsystems. Which includes intimate understanding of RF board and system level design.
‚Ä¢ Experience in the commercial wireless field of RF, RFIC, RF systems, or (digital) radio communication applications.
‚Ä¢ Background in analyzing RF systems and understanding high level performance tradeoffs within the RF design.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of RF circuits such as PAs, LNAs, Mixers, PLLs, etc.
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience with board level integration, RF troubleshooting, matching networks and working understanding of antenna systems.
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of RF test and verification equipment such as signal generators, spectrum analyzers, network analyzers, oscilloscopes, frequency/function generators.
‚Ä¢ Willing to travel up to 20% of the time.
‚Ä¢ Display the courage to innovate, admit faults and to keep moving forward.

We consider a wide range of factors when determining compensation, which may cause compensation to vary depending on your skills, experience and qualifications. This job is also eligible for discretionary bonuses as well as an opportunity to become a Sonos shareholder because all full time employees are eligible for stock grants. The minimum base pay may be modified in the future based on changing market conditions. The starting minimum base pay for this role is:

$137,000

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including open time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and other benefits subject to eligibility requirements.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company‚Äôs sole discretion, consistent with the law.

Your profile will be reviewed and you'll hear from us once we have an update. At Sonos we take the time to hire right and appreciate your patience.

Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information

title: Sr. Process Improvement Engineer
description:
Description
Job Location
USA, Louisville, KY...

Job Posting Title
Sr. Process Improvement Engineer

The Challenge
As the Senior Process Improvement Engineer, you will manage equipment and process effectiveness within a Stamping Metal Fabrication area. You will troubleshoot process issues and drive operational improvements, through effective problem solving and corrective action implementation, to continuously improve safety, quality, delivery, cost & morale.

What you will Do

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

EQUIPMENT:
‚Ä¢ Own all equipment and tooling in the production area, from Advanced Mfg Engineer (AME) sign-off and forward.
‚Ä¢ Serve as the primary troubleshooting resource for the process in the plant. Consult with maintenance staff on equipment repair.
‚Ä¢ Monitor and work to improve Overall Equipment Efficiency (OEE) in the area.
‚Ä¢ Recommend equipment and tooling for existing process; consult and sign-off on new purchases when applicable.
‚Ä¢ Consult with Maintenance Business Leader on the maintenance action item list and/or priorities for the area.
‚Ä¢ Monitor and ensure the calibration of all equipment.
‚Ä¢ Provide feedback on equipment specifications (Gray Book content) based upon best practices and lessons learned.
‚Ä¢ Partner with plant TPM and AME teams to implement and maintain a robust TPM plan for all equipment.

CONTROLS ENGINEERING:
‚Ä¢ Improve and direct Preventive Maintenance plan for assigned area.
‚Ä¢ Root cause based troubleshooting, schematic reading, PLC's and ladder logic programming, Siemens Step 7, Allen Bradley, GE Proficy, Wintriss, variable frequency drives, Ethernet communications, Vision Systems and safety procedures such as Lock Out -Tag Out.
‚Ä¢ Support all plant priorities in the areas of EHS, Schedule Attainment, Spoilage & Yield, Labor & Overtime, Productivity, Spare Parts cost controls and Lean Manufacturing.
‚Ä¢ Execute routine equipment purchases, to include presenting justification for capital expenses or process improvements, design and specification of equipment and standardization of equipment within manufacturing methods and safety requirements.
‚Ä¢ Provide training and aid in trouble-shooting and downtime response in specified area of expertise.
‚Ä¢ Steer up-time and equipment reliability improvements through simplification activities.
‚Ä¢ Develop and guide cross functional projects with other departments and suppliers to make entire supply chain more robust, driving OEE.

CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT:
‚Ä¢ Engage in and lead problem-solving for production area. Lead root cause identification of problems, implement appropriate countermeasures, and share across as best practice (yokoten).
‚Ä¢ Partner with Plant Operations personnel to promote and support a team that reacts aggressively to factory inefficiencies.
‚Ä¢ Work cross-functionally with Team Leaders, Kaizen Promotion Officers, Business Leaders and Lean resources on short term and long term improvement initiatives.
‚Ä¢ Implement related countermeasures on manufacturing line(s) (kaizen activities).
‚Ä¢ Implement Poka-Yoke work methods, and develop workstation aids to assist in operator job performance.
‚Ä¢ Support the Team and Business Leaders in the planning and execution of work area rebalancing utilizing Yamazumi charts.

SAFETY:
‚Ä¢ Support Business Leader by identifying and implementing safety-related corrective actions and improvements for the area.
‚Ä¢ Assist with action item completion for the area's safety action item list, including corrective actions from near misses, accident reports & ergo assessments.

NPI LAUNCHES:
‚Ä¢ Coordinate with AME on equipment purchases & qualification.
‚Ä¢ Provide the "voice of the plant", giving feedback on lessons learned and plant preferences.
‚Ä¢ Review product prototypes and concepts for manufacturability.
‚Ä¢ Provide feedback to the NPI team on capacity, impact on operator and process stability/sustainability.
‚Ä¢ Interface with vendors and OEM suppliers, along with Facilities Engineer, to learn maintenance requirements and equipment troubleshooting. Distribute information and knowledge.
‚Ä¢ Update manufacturing control documents, floor & workstation layouts. Work with Team Leaders on Standard Work and Job Instruction creation.

What you need to Succeed

Minimum Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Minimum of Bachelor‚Äôs Degree with technical degree required (or equivalent experience.)
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 5 years‚Äô relevant work experience
‚Ä¢ Leadership experience in manufacturing operations, preferably unionized operations.

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Appliances manufacturing processes.
‚Ä¢ Experience in Controls, PMs, mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatics and welding techniques.
‚Ä¢ Experience and training in lean manufacturing practices.
‚Ä¢ Six Sigma Black Belt certification.
‚Ä¢ Quality Leadership experience.
‚Ä¢ Program Management skills.

Position Requirements
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience in troubleshooting high volume Stamping presses and metal fabrication equipment.
‚Ä¢ Efficient in PLC troubleshooting and ladder logic.
‚Ä¢ Strong project management and analytical/problem solving skills with demonstrated ability to scope and analyze cross-functional problems to generate/implement solutions.
‚Ä¢ Ability to adapt to and juggle changing and competing priorities.
‚Ä¢ Early and/or late hours often required to work around the manufacturing schedule / timing.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment with both hourly and salary personnel to meet the needs of operators, the program and the business.

Working Conditions:
‚Ä¢ Working conditions are normal for both an office and manufacturing environment.
‚Ä¢ Work may involve lifting of materials and product up to 25 pounds.
‚Ä¢ Working in the manufacturing environment requires the use of safety equipment to include but not limited to: safety glasses, hearing protection, gloves, work shoes/boots.
‚Ä¢ Work may require occasional weekend and/or evening work.
‚Ä¢ Travel may be required for domestic and/or international travel to other sites/plants, etc.
‚Ä¢ *GE Appliances does not offer sponsorship now or in the future for this position.

GE Appliances is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law

title: Team Leader-Systems Engineer
description:
This role is with the MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) team which is a part of Global Engineering & Technology. MST is a team of multi-disciplinary engineers who help solve complex engineering and design problems by leveraging and developing state-of-the-art models, simulations, and digital design tools. Our team provides detailed engineering simulation, design engineering, and... analysis services worldwide for Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI), Park Operations Line of Business, Global Engineering & Technology partners, Transportation, Engineering Services, and Entertainment. MST builds Ride and Show Engineering to optimize design and architecture and identify solutions for new attractions and existing assets. The team covers a considerable breadth of modeling, simulation, and analysis work, including dynamic mechanical systems, FEA (Finite Element Analysis, RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis, system simulations, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, digital twins, engineering software tools and process development.

This Team Leader-Systems Engineer role will lead MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) Dynamic Modeling and Analysis team, and support technical development while meeting key business objectives. This leadership role typically requires 25%-50% of the time performing team management duties. Additional duties include providing technical project support and appropriate Subject Matter Expertise on relevant projects.

This role reports to the Manager of MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools)

Position Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Manage and support a team of high functioning multi-disciplinary engineers by helping them meet career goals while maintaining key business objectives such as scope, schedule, and budget.
‚Ä¢ Establish strong relationships with each direct report; listen, give guidance, advocate, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ Foster a culture of growth, innovation, and management through change.
‚Ä¢ Track and monitor technical and project performance by facilitating code, analysis, or design reviews.
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain good relationships with partners throughout the Disney Company, such as Walt Disney Imagineering, Walt Disney World & Disneyland Ride & Show Studios, GE&T Mechanical, and Sustaining Engineering Teams, Scientific Systems, Entertainment, Character Programs & Development, Reedy Creek Improvement District (RCID), Operations, Disney Cruise Lines, and Transportation Systems.
‚Ä¢ Develop and understand macro-level business opportunities, including roadmaps to integrate new technologies into park operation and new product development.
‚Ä¢ Develop new business opportunities that align with MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) mission and technical advancement. Foster the growth of these new businesses by organizing and communicating.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with customers to set realistic expectations, staffing plans, and schedules.
‚Ä¢ Communicate with peer leads and management to understand resource levels and project priorities across the team.
‚Ä¢ Forecast resource needs by communicating with partners and planning for future scope, tracking budgets and spending, verifying planning assumptions, and gathering support from leadership.
‚Ä¢ Resolve resource priority conflicts between project teams and customers.
‚Ä¢ Manage conflict resolution within the team and with customers or key partners.
‚Ä¢ Manage external vendor scopes of work, including mechanical, systems, or software work.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ 7 or more years of relevant engineering experience
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead complex systems-level efforts while
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead and motivate team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to mentor and guide less experienced team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to manage resources & budgets for department portfolio.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbally, to build lasting relationships with team members, customers, and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to manage priorities and time allocation for oneself
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to resolve challenges and demonstrate professionalism
‚Ä¢ Ability to confidently employ the Agile methodology
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Disney engineering software design and requirements standards & practices

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Experience with analytical tools such as MathWorks or ANSYS
‚Ä¢ Experience with all facets of simulation involvement in the design of Ride and Show Mechanical and Controls Systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with simulation involvement in the Creative Design Process
‚Ä¢ Experience with the new attraction project cycles and critical milestones for modeling, simulation, or analysis involvement
‚Ä¢ Experience with fieldwork, including authoring test procedures, installation, testing, and communication strategy
‚Ä¢ Experience with solving mathematical models of electro-mechanical and control systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with CAD and Modeling experience
‚Ä¢ Experience with FEA (Finite Element Analysis), RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis
‚Ä¢ Experience with collaboration tools, including Confluence, Slack, JIRA, Microsoft Teams
‚Ä¢ Experience with defining engineering requirements and using system architecture tools
‚Ä¢ Experience with version control repository managers, such as Gitlab, SVN, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with coding or scripting using C++, C#, JavaScript, Python, or Matlab
‚Ä¢ Experience with software development environments, including MS Visual studio

Required Education
‚Ä¢ ABET-accredited Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Systems Engineering or equivalent

title: Sr. Mechanical Engineer
description:
Company Description
Job Description
...
Primary Function of Position:

Design and construct pioneering manufacturing equipment used to produce minimally invasive medical devices. This manufacturing equipment will range in complexity from custom manual fixtures to semi-automated electro-mechanical systems, integrating workholding, sensing, motion, and vision control. This position will play a critical role in developing cutting edge manufacturing capabilities to enable the future of minimally invasive surgery.

The successful candidate will conceptualize, develop, and support the mechanical design of novel surgical robot systems, taking individual responsibility for the successful design of specific system components. The candidate will demonstrate creativity and sound engineering in the design of kinematics, robotic actuation, and sensing solutions along with the selection of engineering materials. The candidate must be able to coordinate their efforts within a team design effort and be able to report progress and milestones relative to the overall development project. He or she must excel in a high-energy team environment and be capable of making sound decisions when faced with the time pressures and incomplete information typical of new product development.

Roles & Responsibilities:

¬∑ Independently applies expertise across broad range of design activities and scope to generate designs exhibiting best practices.
¬∑ Assist in the investigation of optimal methods and equipment architecture to perform critical manufacturing operations.
¬∑ Design and build in-house proprietary manufacturing equipment from concept to full solution.
¬∑ Develop metrics, protocols, and test fixtures for qualifying robot system designs
¬∑ Guide projects through the design control process (design specification, design review, risk analysis, etc.)
¬∑ Determine troubleshooting, maintenance, and calibration procedures for equipment.
¬∑ Improve product quality and reliability using Cpk, Gauge R&R, and similar quality tools.
¬∑ Provide equipment-related technical support to on-going production operation and expansion.
Qualifications

Skills, Experience, Education, & Training:

¬∑ Minimum of a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent industry experience.
¬∑ Minimum 8 years‚Äô experience developing manufacturing equipment.
¬∑ Self-motivated, willing/able to take initiative, works well with others in a team environment.
¬∑ 3D CAD proficiency, SolidWorks preferred.
¬∑ Ability to integrate mechatronics components such as sensors, motors, pneumatics, and motion and vision control components.
¬∑ Strong understanding of tolerance analysis and statistical methods.
¬∑ Excellent written and oral communications skills.
¬∑ Familiarity with regulated Quality Systems, especially medical device regulations, is a plus.
¬∑ Experience in an ISO 13485, ISO 9001, or medical device manufacturing environment is a plus.
¬∑ The position is on site at the Intuitive Blacksburg, VA facility.
¬∑ Able to travel periodically (10%).
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Shift : Day

title: Software Engineer ‚Äî Core
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Software Engineer to help us build for the financial back office for therapists. This role will focus primarily on the Heard Core platform.

Position Type: Full-Time...
Location: San Francisco, CA / Remote (USA)
Salary: $150,000+

üåè About Heard
Heard's (https://joinheard.com/) mission is to help therapists with their businesses.

By helping them take care of all their business needs ‚Äî accounting, taxes, bookkeeping & more, we create a world where therapists can focus on the thing they know best: helping their clients.

Unlike most small businesses, mental health providers lack the tools and systems needed to understand the ins and outs of their business. They're forced to work with a disparate array of expensive services or contractors to manage their finances, their taxes, their payroll, their savings and more. Not only is this outside their area of expertise ‚Äî every hour spent wrangling finances or filling out forms is one less hour spent providing care.

Heard offers therapists bookkeeping, accounting, taxes, and payroll all in one easy-to-use platform.

Heard is growing incredibly fast. We launched in Jan 2021, and most recently raised our Series A in Feb of 2022. We have a clear, well-funded pathway to becoming an industry leading software services provider for independent mental health practitioners

title: Defects and Mineralogy Engineer
description:
Requisition Number: 56686

Corning is one of the world‚Äôs leading innovators in materials science. For more than 160 years, Corning has applied its unparalleled expertise in specialty glass, ceramics, and optical physics to develop products that have created new industries and transformed people‚Äôs lives.

At Corning, our growth is fueled by a commitment to innovation. We succeed through sustained investment in research & development, a unique combination of material and process innovation, and close collaboration with customers to solve tough technology challenges. We are a four-time National Medal of Technology winner thanks to our technology leadership and R&D environment, which attract and enable the best scientific minds in the world. This pipeline of talent has brought life-changing innovation to your fingertips for more than 160 years.

Internal Corning Employees are provided the opportunity to review global job openings for potential interest. However, they are encouraged to do... so with the understanding that whether or not they will be considered a candidate for positions located outside their geographic area (city, country, region) will depend on a number of factors such as the availability of local subject matter expertise or qualified talent, the need to obtain and availability of work authorization, costs associated with internal transfer, etc. It will be the decision of the hiring organization whether to permit employees applying outside the local area where the opening exists to be considered a candidate for that opening. It is recommended employees wishing to apply for job openings at Corning make their supervisor aware of their interest before formally applying.

Scope of position: applying knowledge of glass and ceramics composition/properties, mineralogy and crystallography to effectively analyze, identify, and describe the crystallization and defect propensity of Corning Inc products. This corporate engineering role serves all businesses. Team members support projects ranging from initial research through stage 5 manufacturing. The organization serves a flexible base of resources and knowledge which facilitates rapid solution development and emphasizes strong technical competence. A team of microscopy and mineralogy experts, they investigate process and product interactions in glass & ceramic research, development, and manufacturing.

Day to Day Responsibilities: ‚Ä¢ Understand microscopic defects and material properties and their impact on Corning‚Äôs products and processes ‚Ä¢ Drive root cause understanding to improve yield, extend asset life, reduce costs, improve product attributes and enable new products ‚Ä¢ Develop laboratory testing regimen and process simulations to extend knowledge base and prove/disprove hypotheses ‚Ä¢ Manage workload to ensure optimal turnaround and experimental efficiency ‚Ä¢ Protect Corning‚Äôs intellectual property by filing invention disclosures for patent application in timely fashion as applicable ‚Ä¢ Document all results in internal, structured reports ‚Ä¢ Maintain high quality engineering principles, including the use of statistics, structured problem solving methods and regimented analytical protocols ‚Ä¢ Measure and communicate performance against objectives In addition to the managerial function, this position includes working as a technical contributor on projects, as well as a member of the Materials/Melting/Mineralogy, Materials Engineering, Metallurgy, and Thermal Process Engineering staffs, and of the Thermal & Materials Engineering extended staff.

Travel Requirements: 10-15%, project based, some international Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time: Flex time; typical 8:00 ‚Äì 5:00; Monday ‚Äì Friday. Some projects may require additional hours.

Required Skills: ‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills to enable collaboration with scientists, engineers, and technicians ‚Ä¢ Ability to assimilate quickly and produce valuable results ‚Ä¢ Demonstrated strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with customers, suppliers, and co-workers ‚Ä¢ Problem solving skills. Some experience in lab testing design. ‚Ä¢ Some experience in the fields of crystallization, glass research, development or manufacturing. ‚Ä¢ Familiar with Engineering Excellence tool and comfortable engaging with project work Desired Skills: ‚Ä¢ Functional management experience ‚Ä¢ Glass, ceramics, process engineering basics ‚Ä¢ Hands on experience (SEM, EDX, optical microscopy , etc.) and knowledge of microscopic lab tools (microprobe, SIMS, ICPMS, FTIR, etc. ‚Ä¢ Desire to work in a lab environment ‚Ä¢ Statistics, data analysis, design of experiments ‚Ä¢ Innovative and creative ‚Ä¢ Strong multi-tasker ‚Ä¢ Business savvy and competence Soft Skills: ‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills, able to work across boundaries at all levels of the organization ‚Ä¢ Ability to influence, guide, and mentor ‚Ä¢ Able to foster a diverse and inclusive environment built on credibility, transparency, openness, and trust ‚Ä¢ Flexible and adaptable ‚Ä¢ Strong networking skills ‚Ä¢ Able to work independently as well as be part of a team or lead a team ‚Ä¢ Sense of urgency ‚Ä¢ Results oriented ‚Ä¢ Positive attitude Education and Experience: ‚Ä¢ Technical degree(BS, MS or PhD) ‚Äì materials, glass, or ceramic engineering, geology or similar. ‚Ä¢ 2+ years experience in materials or process engineering or related fields; high degree of technical competence.

This role does not support immigration sponsorship.

title: Data Engineer Mid-Level (Hybrid)
description:
Purpose of Job
We are seeking dedicated Data Engineers. USAA's Enterprise Data and Analytics Office (EDAO) is at the center of driving innovation and industry leadership across Data Management, Advanced Analytics, and Data Governance. Through a highly collaborative work environment, our teams are able to meet business demands for both internal and external clients. Our structure consists of a... spoke and hub model, in which our team serves as the hub for our organization. This model provides a fast-paced work environment, high executive visibility as well as supportive career development opportunities.

Our Data Engineers deliver quality reporting and data intelligence solutions to the organization and assist client teams with drawing insights to make advised, data driven decisions. Data Engineers are engaged in all phases of the data management lifecycle; gather and analyze requirements, collect, process, store and secure, use, share and communicate, archive, reuse and repurpose data.

Job Requirements

About USAA

USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.

About USAA IT

Our most meaningful qualification isn't technical, it's human. Here, we don't just sit in front of a screen. We stand behind our 13 million members who rely on us every day.

We're proud of USAA's strong history -- and we're even more passionate about our future. That's why we have a team of supportive and collaborative hardworking technology professionals focused on doing more for our members. And why we're continuing to add innovative problem solvers to our team. With us, you'll find exciting challenges that inspire you to continue learning and growing.

USAA values a work culture that is highly collaborative, and we have found that a hybrid work type helps employees gain the best of both worlds ‚Äì collaborating in-person in the office and working from home when needed to achieve focused deliverables. The actual days onsite are settled between each employee and the employee‚Äôs manager. We have multiple positions available. Candidates are expected to live a commutable distance from of one of our offices in San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX, and Phoenix, AZ.

Primary Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
‚Ä¢ Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.
‚Ä¢ Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.
‚Ä¢ Independently conducts work on the full life cycle of data engineering to include analysis, solution design, data pipeline engineering, testing, deployment, scheduling, and production support.
‚Ä¢ Design and implement complex technical solutions.
‚Ä¢ Design, build, handle and optimize data pipelines for data structures encompassing data transformation, data models, schemas, metadata, data quality, and workload management.
‚Ä¢ Identifies and solves significant technical problems and architecture deficiencies to include design, security, and performance.
‚Ä¢ Collaborates on design reviews by providing feedback on trends and makes recommendations for solutions.
‚Ä¢ Breaks down business features and into technical stories and approaches. Influences team members in technical adoption for the best solutions.
‚Ä¢ Creates proof of concepts and prototypes that drive the vision and the outcome for sophisticated initiatives to be delivered.
‚Ä¢ Collaborates with the team and other engineers on new technologies and alternatives to plan and implement complex assignments and tasks.
‚Ä¢ Helps on-board mid level engineers. May begin mentoring junior engineers.
‚Ä¢ Acquires data from multiple data sources and maintains resulting databases, data warehouses, and/or data lakes.
‚Ä¢ Assists to develop, maintain, and implement the company‚Äôs data development tools and standards. Conducts code reviews on a periodic basis to improve quality and ensure compliance.

Minimum Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree; OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree; OR Approved certification from CodeUp, Galvenize, VetFIT (Veterans for IT) or eFIT (Employees for IT)
‚Ä¢ 4 years of data engineering, data analysis or software development experience implementing data solutions with at least 1 year of data engineering or data management experience.
‚Ä¢ Extensive knowledge and working experience in SQL and Relational Databases.
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Experience:
‚Ä¢ 4+ years‚Äô experience developing, deploying and supporting high-quality, fault-tolerant data pipelines (leveraging distributed, data movement technologies and approaches, including but not limited to ETL and streaming ingestion and processing)
‚Ä¢ 2 or more years‚Äô experience utilizing Linux scripting (Python, Shell, etc.)
‚Ä¢ 3 or more years‚Äô experience in SQL development and/or NoSQL databases
‚Ä¢ 1 or more years‚Äô experience with cloud-based data offerings (Amazon AWS, Redshift, Snowflake, Google GCP, Microsoft Azure)
‚Ä¢ Experience with ETL Tools (Informatica, DataStage, Data Build Tool, etc.)
‚Ä¢ 1 or more years of experience working with Agile Development Methodologies

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

Compensation:

USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market position. The salary range for this position is: $88,200 ‚Äì $158,900

Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance or at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.
‚Ä¢ Geographical Differential: Geographic pay differential is additional pay provided to eligible employees working in locations where market pay levels are above the national average.

Shift premium: will be addressed on an individual-basis for applicable roles that are consistently scheduled for non-core hours.

Benefits:

At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

Please click on the link below for more details.

USAA Total Rewards

Relocation assistance is not available for this position

title: Team Leader-Systems Engineer
description:
This role is with the MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) team which is a part of Global Engineering & Technology. MST is a team of multi-disciplinary engineers who help solve complex engineering and design problems by leveraging and developing state-of-the-art models, simulations, and digital design tools. Our team provides detailed engineering simulation, design engineering, and... analysis services worldwide for Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI), Park Operations Line of Business, Global Engineering & Technology partners, Transportation, Engineering Services, and Entertainment. MST builds Ride and Show Engineering to optimize design and architecture and identify solutions for new attractions and existing assets. The team covers a considerable breadth of modeling, simulation, and analysis work, including dynamic mechanical systems, FEA (Finite Element Analysis, RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis, system simulations, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, digital twins, engineering software tools and process development.

This Team Leader-Systems Engineer role will lead MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) Dynamic Modeling and Analysis team, and support technical development while meeting key business objectives. This leadership role typically requires 25%-50% of the time performing team management duties. Additional duties include providing technical project support and appropriate Subject Matter Expertise on relevant projects.

This role reports to the Manager of MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools)

Position Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Manage and support a team of high functioning multi-disciplinary engineers by helping them meet career goals while maintaining key business objectives such as scope, schedule, and budget.
‚Ä¢ Establish strong relationships with each direct report; listen, give guidance, advocate, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ Foster a culture of growth, innovation, and management through change.
‚Ä¢ Track and monitor technical and project performance by facilitating code, analysis, or design reviews.
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain good relationships with partners throughout the Disney Company, such as Walt Disney Imagineering, Walt Disney World & Disneyland Ride & Show Studios, GE&T Mechanical, and Sustaining Engineering Teams, Scientific Systems, Entertainment, Character Programs & Development, Reedy Creek Improvement District (RCID), Operations, Disney Cruise Lines, and Transportation Systems.
‚Ä¢ Develop and understand macro-level business opportunities, including roadmaps to integrate new technologies into park operation and new product development.
‚Ä¢ Develop new business opportunities that align with MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) mission and technical advancement. Foster the growth of these new businesses by organizing and communicating.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with customers to set realistic expectations, staffing plans, and schedules.
‚Ä¢ Communicate with peer leads and management to understand resource levels and project priorities across the team.
‚Ä¢ Forecast resource needs by communicating with partners and planning for future scope, tracking budgets and spending, verifying planning assumptions, and gathering support from leadership.
‚Ä¢ Resolve resource priority conflicts between project teams and customers.
‚Ä¢ Manage conflict resolution within the team and with customers or key partners.
‚Ä¢ Manage external vendor scopes of work, including mechanical, systems, or software work.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ 7 or more years of relevant engineering experience
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead complex systems-level efforts while
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead and motivate team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to mentor and guide less experienced team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to manage resources & budgets for department portfolio.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbally, to build lasting relationships with team members, customers, and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to manage priorities and time allocation for oneself
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to resolve challenges and demonstrate professionalism
‚Ä¢ Ability to confidently employ the Agile methodology
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Disney engineering software design and requirements standards & practices

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Experience with analytical tools such as MathWorks or ANSYS
‚Ä¢ Experience with all facets of simulation involvement in the design of Ride and Show Mechanical and Controls Systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with simulation involvement in the Creative Design Process
‚Ä¢ Experience with the new attraction project cycles and critical milestones for modeling, simulation, or analysis involvement
‚Ä¢ Experience with fieldwork, including authoring test procedures, installation, testing, and communication strategy
‚Ä¢ Experience with solving mathematical models of electro-mechanical and control systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with CAD and Modeling experience
‚Ä¢ Experience with FEA (Finite Element Analysis), RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis
‚Ä¢ Experience with collaboration tools, including Confluence, Slack, JIRA, Microsoft Teams
‚Ä¢ Experience with defining engineering requirements and using system architecture tools
‚Ä¢ Experience with version control repository managers, such as Gitlab, SVN, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with coding or scripting using C++, C#, JavaScript, Python, or Matlab
‚Ä¢ Experience with software development environments, including MS Visual studio

Required Education
‚Ä¢ ABET-accredited Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Systems Engineering or equivalent

title: Principal Civil Engineer
via: via APWA WorkZone - American Public Works Association
description:
DEFINITION OF THE POSITION:
Under direction, to supervise and direct the activities of an engineering section and to do related work as required.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:
Plans, supervises and coordinates public works/utility field and office civil engineering activities, including inspection, surveying, plan checking, mapping and record maintenance; coordinates the preparation of designs, plans, maps, specifications, and cost estimates for construction and long- range planning of public works/utility projects; confers on interdepartmental projects, governmental agencies, and private organizations on engineering matters; conducts negotiations for contracts and agreements with other agencies; directs the preparation of work schedules; directs the issuance of street utility and grading permits; reviews construction costs; directs research and prepares a variety of studies and reports; recommends amendments and additions to the Municipal Code; assists in budget preparation... and expenditure control; confers with superiors on policies, strategies and programs; acts for supervisor in his/her absence; supervises, trains, and evaluates employees; makes effective recommendations regarding hiring, promotions, and transfers; effectively recommends disciplinary action as needed up to and including termination; administers major contracts with consultants/contractors for studies, design or construction projects; secures grants/loans with outside agencies to finance City projects; drives on City business.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE POSITION:
EDUCATION/TRAINING: Any combination of education and/or experience that has provided the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary for acceptable job performance as determined by the City. Example combination includes, but is not limited to a B.S. degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in civil engineering and seven years of professional engineering experience, including two years at the level of a Senior Civil Engineer in California.

LICENSE & CERTIFICATES: A valid California Class ‚ÄúC‚Äù driver‚Äôs license or equivalent at time of appointment; registration as a Civil Engineer in the State of California is required.

EMPLOYMENT STANDARDS: Knowledge of the principles and practices of civil and structural engineering related to municipal surveys, plans, and public works/utility designs; field engineering methods including surveying, inspection, and construction practices; principles and practices of sound personnel management and supervision. Skill to apply the knowledge required for the position; design, estimate and draw plans for public works/utility improvement projects. Ability to effectively work with others; communicate effectively, both orally and in writing; prepare contract documents; establish and maintain effective working relationships with supervisors, fellow employees, and the public

title: Controls Design Engineer - SPG
description:
Summary
Posted: Mar 20, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40...
Role Number:200171369

Apple's Special Projects Group (SPG) is seeking a full-time engineer to join our Controls Engineering group. Candidate will be responsible for development of control and estimation algorithms for complex electromechanical systems.

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of systems theory and control systems design.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of classical and modern control methodologies: PID, optimal control (LQR, LQG), model-predictive control, etc.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of state estimation techniques: state observers, Kalman filter, nonlinear state estimation.
‚Ä¢ Experience with linear parameter-varying (LPV) systems, optimization, moving horizon estimation, system identification, and adaptive control preferred.
‚Ä¢ Experience creating detailed mathematical models for electromechanical systems.
‚Ä¢ Experience implementing control systems on embedded microcontroller platforms.
‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in MATLAB/Simulink is a must.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in C a must. C++ and Python preferred.
‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in modern software development workflows and practices, including version control, build and test systems, and peer review.

Description

Description
We are seeking a highly motivated controls design engineer to lead the development of control and estimation algorithms for complex dynamical systems.
Collaborate in highly cross-functional environment and work closely with sensor and actuator design engineers, software engineers, and other control design engineers.
Lead control projects from algorithm architecture to design, implementation, tuning, and validation.
Define specifications and test suites to tune parameters and compare performance of different algorithms.
Work with software team to ensure robust control system implementation on embedded microcontrollers.
Work with modeling team to integrate models and algorithms into simulation environment for rapid development and validation.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience
MS or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or Mechatronics Engineering, with an emphasis in controls or robotics.

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements

title: Simulation Engineer
description:
Welcome to Maxis, home to tinkerers, craftspeople, & storytellers. Our drive is to inspire everyone to make a better world through creative play. As the developer of the Sims, we create games and experiences for millions of people around the world and are always looking for new ways to inspire our players. Maxis is a place where you can do what you love and help others grow while doing it; a place where your unique voice can be heard and seen. We put creativity and inclusivity at the core of our work and don‚Äôt settle for seeing the world only as it is, but strive to build a world as it could be. Read on to see how you can join our team and dream big.

Job Summary

Maxis is looking for a talented engineer that can help us bring the next wave of simulation features to life. This engineer will work with an experienced team that has collectively built almost all Maxis games in the past two decades. You will actively work with multiple designers and simulation engineers prototyping and... shipping various features that expand the gameplay possibilities of Sims games. Most of the work is expected to be done in Unreal Engine, both in C++ and blueprints.

As a Simulation Engineer for a game at Maxis, you will
‚Ä¢ Work with designers, producers, artists, and other core and backend engineers to build a framework that brings designs to life.
‚Ä¢ Implement a data driven simulation system to author player facing behaviors in C++.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate excellent technical problem-solving skills under iteratively changing requirements during game development.
‚Ä¢ Build creative aspects of real life within a simulation game (e.g. socialization, careers, weather, unique characters).
‚Ä¢ Author technical design documents detailing software requirements.
‚Ä¢ Build unique content for a game that supports a large demographic of simulation player patterns.

Qualifications

Please note that you do not need to qualify for all requirements to be considered. We encourage you to apply if you can meet most of the requirements and are comfortable opening a dialog to be considered.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor/Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field.
‚Ä¢ 5+ year experience in a hands-on development role.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate technical abilities with large projects implemented in C++.
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience building and shipping AAA games in Unreal engine.
‚Ä¢ Previous engineering experience owning major systems in code bases.
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience and willingness to create multiple short-lived prototypes.
‚Ä¢ Experience developing for large-scale live products. Products that constantly update to provide higher quality, and feature set to expand the possibilities in the game.
‚Ä¢ Experience building features and tools for games (or applications) that support a collaborative User Generated Content community.
‚Ä¢ Experience working in highly collaborative environments with multidisciplinary roles beyond engineering like design, production, art and product management.
‚Ä¢ Experience optimizing performance and memory of real time applications (like games).
‚Ä¢ Experience with Windows platform and development tools.

Pluses
‚Ä¢ Experience developing for both PC and Mobile platform games.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate experience working in large data-driven games or applications.
‚Ä¢ Experience mentoring or leading engineers in different projects.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Machine Learning techniques applied in the games domain.
‚Ä¢ Experience with shipping games built in Unity engine.
‚Ä¢ Experience using static and performance analysis tools, automated testing, unit testing, and configuration management processes

title: Field Engineer FEP - Controls
description:
Job Summary:

A Field Engineer FEP is an entry level position. You will start by being enrolled in FieldCore's Field Engineering Program (FEP). While in the FEP, you will develop in-depth technical expertise, lean thinking and leadership skills and will have a unique opportunity to go through...
‚Ä¢ In-person and Online training Curriculum
‚Ä¢ On-the-job trainings
‚Ä¢ Learning from experienced Field Engineers (FE's) Technical Field Advisors (TFA‚Äôs)

You will gain experience and grow your career while traveling and helping provide power to communities. Upon successful graduation from the FEP program, you will be eligible for a FE Controls position.

The FE Controls manages controls activities on site during the Installation and Commissioning and Maintenance of heavy-duty turbines/equipment (generator or mechanical drive); Responsible for reviewing plant engineering documents and P&ID‚Äôs, troubleshooting of plant systems and equipment, planning, organizing, integrating and direction of resources such as labor, tools and materials as required to complete the work scope according to contractual requirements.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Maintain strong safety mindset to assure the executed work reflects the technical requirements within GE safety standards
‚Ä¢ Extensive travel to and from projects and various field assignments will be required
‚Ä¢ Ability and willingness to work holidays, weekends and overtime as required by field assignments
‚Ä¢ Actively manage controls activities on site during Installation, Commissioning and Maintenance of heavy-duty equipment, PLCs and other GE provided controls systems (MKVIe, MKVI, MKV, ..etc.)
‚Ä¢ Read and interpret piping and instrument diagrams (P&ID)
‚Ä¢ Provide timely and accurate internal and external reports
‚Ä¢ Provide expert consultation on complex projects
‚Ä¢ Provide customers with technical direction and support on Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) packaged products
‚Ä¢ May be assigned other duties to help proactively drive our FieldCore vision and align with our organization‚Äôs core values.

Required Qualifications & Experience:
‚Ä¢ Engineering degree or equivalent.
‚Ä¢ Strong technical competence in reading and interpreting electrical/mechanical flow and instrument diagrams.
‚Ä¢ Extensive travel to and from projects and various field assignments will be required.
‚Ä¢ Understand PLC ladder logic, including basic understanding of how to navigate through ladder rungs while troubleshooting
‚Ä¢ Have basic networking and programming knowledge
‚Ä¢ English proficiency required

Desired Characteristics:
‚Ä¢ Experience in Field Services or Power Generation.
‚Ä¢ Positive can-do attitude with the ability to communicate with internal and external customers.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Gas Turbine Driver Control Systems and Auxiliary Systems
‚Ä¢ Experience on Mark VI, Mark Vie, Mark V controls systems, preferable
‚Ä¢ Ability to understand and implement controls software
‚Ä¢ Wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected
‚Ä¢ Strong analytic, organizational, and problem-solving skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent customer, communication, and interpersonal skills
‚Ä¢ Strong computer skills
‚Ä¢ Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently
‚Ä¢ Willingness to learn and problem solve
‚Ä¢ Strong ownership and work ethic

Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Competitive Salary and Benefits
‚Ä¢ Extensive training opportunities and mentorship
‚Ä¢ Classroom and virtual trainings
‚Ä¢ Regional and Global exposure
‚Ä¢ Working on multimillion dollar equipment
‚Ä¢ Wide range of career path opportunities
‚Ä¢ LEAN training
‚Ä¢ Learning and developing communication skills

About FieldCore:

FieldCore, a GE company, is an independent, industrial field services organization focused on World-Class Execution across the power generation sector. Our team includes more than 10,000 of the foremost experts in field services all focused on one thing; delivering excellent outcomes for our customers. Our Core Values of Safety, Integrity, Quality and Inclusion are the foundation of everything we do to empower the people who power the world. For more information visit our website www.fieldcore.com.

title: Full-Stack Software Engineer - Remote Optional
description:
Signup on Hired to find your dream job (remote work available) as a Full Stack Software Engineer at one of 10,000+ companies looking for jobseekers just like you.

Companies on Hired apply to you! You'll receive salary and compensation details up front - before the interview. By crafting a profile on Hired, we're confident that you'll find a job you'll love...

We see Full-Stack Engineers continue to be one of the most exciting and in-demand developer jobs. These types of engineers combine the work traditionally done by Backend and Front-end Engineers to code a website or application on the server and the client-facing side. It is a role that fuses both creative and practical concerns, as these engineers are responsible for everything the website user encounters, including scrolling functions and graphics, as well as builds the logic, database interactions and server configuration on the application's Backend.

In addition to programming the various features of server-side and user-side applications, Full-Stack Engineers are encouraged to upgrade and maintain both the back-end and front-end as needed. As new technologies emerge and platforms are expanded, the role of a Full-Stack Engineer will likely transform to suit these changes.

We need Full-Stack Software Engineering jobseekers on Hired who are results-oriented, multifaceted and can work independently or in a team environment, to get the job done.

Common Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ The development and maintenance of client-side and server-side applications.

‚Ä¢ Full-Stack Engineer who can adapt and help stay on top of growing technologies and engineering trends.

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability with Backend web development.

‚Ä¢ Code with languages like JavaScript, Core MVC, and .
‚Ä¢ Experienced or accomplished in any of the following:

SQL, Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Java for Front-End and Backend programming, Go Language, Swift, Docker, Azure, AngularJS and Angular 2.

‚Ä¢ Knowledgeable with some of the following: HTTP protocols, developer tools, SSL certificates and web application architecture.
‚Ä¢ Able to track changes made to code with Git version control systems.

These Would Also Be Nice

‚Ä¢ Results orientated.

title: Data Engineer
description:
The Role

At adMarketplace, we create best of breed consumer search technology using cutting-edge architectures with millisecond response time and crunch through terabytes of data every day. The ideal candidate is motivated to design for massive scale and push the boundaries of using ingested data in automated decisions. Our team uses a modern tech stack including Kafka, Spark, Java/ Scala... Python, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Azkaban/ Airflow and modern Data Warehouses.

What You Will Do:
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain ad-tech related data systems and system components using Python/Java/Scala and other software technologies
‚Ä¢ ETL/ELT Pipelines
‚Ä¢ Data-driven applications
‚Ä¢ Clients integration automation components (Google, Amazon, LiveRamp)
‚Ä¢ Work with team for technical implementation of Data Engineering projects

title: SOI/RFIC Design Engineer
description:
If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful... contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates.

Requisition ID: 67259

Position Summary

You will work on cutting edge technology as part of a highly supportive team developing products that will be in millions of devices used worldwide. You will design new architectures, review existing designs with experienced engineers, make suggestions for modifications, and have a direct impact on product design and performance. You will have an active role in design & development of new products as well as optimizing existing products.

Job Description

The Front End Module Design group in Mobile Solutions Division is seeking an experienced SOI Design Engineer to support new SOI IC designs and product developments for RF Cellular and Wi-Fi applications. The SOI design engineer will be responsible for designing low to high power RF front-end RFIC circuits (including LNAs, RF switches, RF couplers, RF filters, high-power switches for antenna tuner, passive components, control interfaces, etc.) and their module integration. The design engineer will work as part of a product development team from concept to design and evaluation, and release to production. Product development experience required. Knowledge in cellular/Wi-Fi system, analog IC design, and packaging for RF products is a plus.
‚Ä¢ MSEE or PhD with 5+ years of industrial and/or product design experience
‚Ä¢ Strong experience with design simulation tools such as Cadence, ADS, and EM simulations tools (HFSS, Sonnet, Momentum, EMX, Ansys).
‚Ä¢ Experienced with Product Realization Process (PRP) from definition to production.
‚Ä¢ Strong RFIC or MMIC design experience (simulation, CAD layout, laboratory engineering evaluation) in Silicon or SOI process, experience in RFIC design for RF switches and LNA modules is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of wireless and cellular system architecture, and design architecture for switch/LNA/filter RFIC
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of RF sub-component and system design parameters and their evaluation using oscilloscope, VNA, spectrum analyzer, RF sources, hands-on experience in RF testing.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of device or product characterization.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of analog/digital circuit design for controlling of RF sub-components.
‚Ä¢ Background in package designing and simulation for RF product is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Must possess good communication and presentation skills and the desire to be part of a dynamic team #LI-DB1

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Holy Grail developed a direct air carbon capture technology that uses electrons to capture CO2 from the atmosphere. We are looking for proactive candidates who are ready to take ownership and are passionate about creating a sustainable solution to removing excess CO2 from the atmosphere. The ultimate goal of Holy Grail is to contribute to the long-term sustainability of life on Earth.

We are... looking for mechanical engineers to join our team and help bring our modular CO2 scrubbers to market.

This role will be located in Mountain View, CA.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Detail-oriented with a creative approach to science and engineering
‚Ä¢ A high degree of autonomy and independence
‚Ä¢ Intrinsic motivation with a fundamental love of science
‚Ä¢ Ability to learn and adapt quickly
‚Ä¢ Experience with 3D modeling (Solidworks or CATIA)
‚Ä¢ Experience with fast prototyping and manufacturing (laser cutting, 3D printing, CNC machining, and general fabrication)
‚Ä¢ Experience working with metals, polymers, and elastomers
‚Ä¢ Experience in Design for manufacturing from prototype to production
‚Ä¢ Experience in converting 3D models in 2D technical drawings

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Design hardware components and testing rigs for carbon capture systems
‚Ä¢ Design and build scrubber prototypes using laser cutting, water jet, stamping, and 3D printing
‚Ä¢ Design and build automated manufacturing systems for casting
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with a team of chemists and electrical engineers to optimize technical specifications
‚Ä¢ Build prototypes from scratch to test hypotheses
‚Ä¢ Work with suppliers to source materials and services
‚Ä¢ Own the full manufacturing cycle from zero to design to final product

Nice to have:
‚Ä¢ Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, or Robotics
‚Ä¢ Experience with seals in airtight systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with data engineering in sensing systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with Computational Fluid Dynamics

What we offer:
You will join a team that is passionate about having an impact on climate change. We care about the optimal way to solve a problem and nurture a culture of creativity and collaboration. We care about quick iterations, minimizing assumptions, and we use emojis to label our chemicals. We work on interesting technical problems and provide support and resources to tackle them.

Impact: your contribution will directly impact our technical milestones and you will have full ownership of your projects. We don‚Äôt micromanage
No politics: we give you the resources to test all your wildest ideas in hours or days, not months. If there is a chance that something will advance our progress we will test it as soon as possible
Ownership: not only you will own your projects you will also own part of the company
Autonomy: we welcome your independent perspective and encourage you to set and manage your time to achieve our shared goals
Flexibility: we cultivate an informal environment that is more fun and less rigid compared to academia and larger companies

title: LabVIEW Electrical Instrumentation & Controls (EI&C) Engineer
via: via ORNL Jobs - Oak Ridge National Laboratory
description:
Requisition Id 8519

Overview...

The Testing Science and Cascade Engineering Section within the Enrichment Science and Engineering Division

(ESED) is seeking a Technical Professional - LabVIEW EI&C Engineer for the Electrical, Instrumentation, and

Controls Engineering Group.

In this group, we are focused on the development of testbeds and enrichment systems by human machine

interface research and system logic development and this position will have with an emphasis in the areas of

instrumentation hardware and software to make a significant contribution to projects involving isotope enrichment,

nuclear nonproliferation, and instrumentation of mission-critical systems.

We develop and implement advanced control system architectures for enrichment technology test beds.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ The LabVIEW EI&C Engineer is responsible for design and deployment of measurement and instrumentation systems for a wide variety of projects
‚Ä¢ Applies best practices in interfacing sensors to signal conditioning, data collection, and control systems
‚Ä¢ Establishes capabilities that enable programs to excel at the forefront of science and technology
‚Ä¢ Performs R&D to advance the field of knowledge and/or technology in one‚Äôs respective specialty;
‚Ä¢ Shepherds, implements, and models standards for performance of work consistent with Environment, Safety, Security, Health, and Quality (ESH&Q) requirements and business rules
‚Ä¢ Works collaboratively with co-workers and management as well as independently, to fully document work performed in the forms of technical reports and presentations, and to participate in the development of research proposal
‚Ä¢ Interfaces with principal investigators, management, engineers, fabricators, modelers and test campaign personnel
‚Ä¢ Ensures compliance with Environment, Safety and Health (ES&H) and QA requirements
‚Ä¢ As a member of the ORNL scientific community, you will be expected to commit to ORNL's Research Code of Conduct. Our full code of conduct, and a statement by the Lab Director's office can be found here: https://www.ornl.gov/content/research-integrity

Basic Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Requires a M.S. with a minimum of 2 years experience, or a B.S. with 3 years experience in Electrical Engineering or related field of study.
‚Ä¢ Proficient in National Instruments LabVIEW software
‚Ä¢ Experience with 1 or more National Instruments hardware platforms
‚Ä¢ User Interface Design
‚Ä¢ Electrical sensor interfacing and signal conditioning
‚Ä¢ Electronic system design and development
‚Ä¢ Ability to learn new software (with web-based training if necessary)
‚Ä¢ Electronics laboratory skills (soldering, wiring, instruments, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Ability to assist with assembly of prototype and/or production devices
‚Ä¢ The ability to clearly communicate, both verbally and in writing, to sponsoring agencies, other engineers and researchers, technicians, and craftsmen
‚Ä¢ The successful candidate must also have the ability to work with minimal supervision and will be expected to provide input and influence project direction through interaction with project team leadership.
‚Ä¢ Ability to hold and maintain a DOE Q security clearance is required
‚Ä¢ The ability to work flexible hours and travel when required.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to function well in a fast-paced research environment, set priorities to accomplish multiple tasks within deadlines, and adapt to ever changing needs.

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Active DOE Q clearance
‚Ä¢ Certified LabVIEW Developer
‚Ä¢ Experience with PXI, CompactRIO, or CompactDAQ hardware platforms
‚Ä¢ Experience with Real Time Operating Systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with distributed control systems
‚Ä¢ Analog design
‚Ä¢ Equipment layout and packaging
‚Ä¢ Data analysis methods
‚Ä¢ Experience with an industry standard SCADA
‚Ä¢ Ability to develop, document, and communicate measurement and control system designs
‚Ä¢ Experience with programmable logic controllers
‚Ä¢ Variable speed motor drives (VSDs)
‚Ä¢ Familiar with NI LabVIEW Datalogging and Supervisory Control Module (Shared Variable Engine + Citadel Database) for distributed monitoring and control systems.

Special Requirements:

This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a DOE Q clearance from the Department of Energy. As such, this position is a Workplace Substance Abuse (WSAP) testing designated position. WSAP positions require passing a pre-placement drug test and participation in an ongoing random drug testing program.

About the Isotope Science and Engineering Directorate (ISED):

Established in 2020, the Isotope Science and Engineering Directorate is strengthening Oak Ridge National Laboratory's leadership in isotope production and enrichment technology innovation. ISED is guiding the Lab's pursuit of the fundamental science and technology that broadens the application of isotopes for energy, environmental, medical, and national security purposes. These efforts are made possible through the High Flux Isotope Reactor, the Radiochemical Engineering Development Center, ORNL's other nuclear facilities, and an assemblage of world-leading scientists and engineers. Please visit https://www.ornl.gov/directorate/isotopes for more information about ISED.

About ESED:

The Enrichment Science and Engineering Division serves the nation in two critical areas: advancing enrichment technologies and exploring stable isotope production and applications. The division leverages an elite staff of scientists and engineers with the world-leading capabilities of Oak Ridge National Laboratory to deliver groundbreaking advancements with a variety of applications, from national security to life-saving medical treatments. ESED is the national steward for the research, development, and demonstration of centrifuge technology. The successful candidate will provide research and development (R&D) leadership within the group that strategically advances science and technology focused on gas testing of prototype enrichment devices for processing uraniumbearing and stable isotope compounds. LINK: https://www.ornl.gov/division/enrichment-science

Benefits at ORNL:

UT-Battelle offers a quality benefits package, including a matching 401(k), contributory pension plan, paid vacation, and medical/dental plan options. Onsite amenities include a credit union, medical clinic, cafeteria, and fitness facilities.

Relocation:

Moving can be overwhelming and expensive. UT-Battelle offers a generous relocation package to ease the transition process. Domestic and international relocation assistance is available for certain positions. If invited to interview, be sure to ask your Recruiter (Talent Acquisition Partner) for details.

For more information about our benefits, working here, and living here, visit the ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù tab at https://jobs.ornl.gov.

#LI-DC1

This position will remain open for a minimum of 5 days after which it will close when a qualified candidate is identified and/or hired.

We accept Word (.doc, .docx), Adobe (unsecured .pdf), Rich Text Format (.rtf), and HTML (.htm, .html) up to 5MB in size. Resumes from third party vendors will not be accepted; these resumes will be deleted and the candidates submitted will not be considered for employment.

If you have trouble applying for a position, please email ORNLRecruiting@ornl.gov.

ORNL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans, are encouraged to apply. UT-Battelle is an E-Verify employer

title: Quality Engineer II
description:
Working Location: MINNESOTA, BROOKLYN PARK

Are you looking for a company that cares about people‚Äôs lives and health, including yours? At Olympus, we help make people‚Äôs lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling, every day...

Let‚Äôs inspire healthier lives, together.

Job Description

The Product Quality Engineer is responsible for contributing to the design, development and management of projects for legacy products and support of new products under development. The Product Quality Engineer provides organizational support with a focus on Design Quality activities. Works with internal/external manufacturers providing finished products, services, components, and sub-assemblies to ensure compliance with company policies and procedures and medical device regulations. The Product Quality Engineer will partner with Operations, R&D, Supply Chain and other departments to continuously improve products and processes that meet all internal and external requirements and regulations.

Job Duties
‚Ä¢ Assist in the design & execution of Production Release Process project for components & finished devices.
‚Ä¢ Lead and implement complex projects including quality improvement initiatives.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate basic project management skills and interact with cross-functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Lead Process/Design Risk Analysis.
‚Ä¢ Provide leadership in understanding of the quality regulations to other disciplines.
‚Ä¢ Support and lead multiple product Design Control activities for new product development efforts.
‚Ä¢ Support Process/Design Validation/Verification activities and approach including software validation.
‚Ä¢ Lead implementing limited cost of quality concepts, including cost of quality, data collection, & reporting.
‚Ä¢ Support Manufacturing Engineering in the creation of DMR, DHR, routes, and bills of material, print changes, and specifications for in-house / external manufacturing.
‚Ä¢ Know and follow all laws and policies that apply to one's job, and maintain the highest levels of professionalism, ethics and compliance at all times.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering required.
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 2-4 years of experience in Quality Engineering within an FDA regulated medical device manufacturing environment.
‚Ä¢ Up to 10% domestic travel.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
‚Ä¢ Proficient with Six Sigma type tools to analyze, drive root cause, and solve problems.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of statistics, sampling strategies, and design of experiments, including statistical software tools such as Minitab.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Risk Management practices, Corrective and Preventative Actions, and regulatory requirements such as FDA QSR's, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, & ISO 11135.
‚Ä¢ Must be proficient and have practical knowledge in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to work well within a team and independently at times with limited guidance

‚Ä¢ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and deadline-driven environment.
‚Ä¢ Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize/execute multiple concurrent tasks.
‚Ä¢ Skilled in presentation development and public speaking.
‚Ä¢ General curiosity and a desire to learn new material.

#LI-LR1

We realize work isn‚Äôt just a job to you.

It‚Äôs a big part of your life, but not the only part. That‚Äôs why we offer competitive salaries, a robust 401(k) program, annual bonus program and comprehensive medical benefits, as well as tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules, parental and adoption leave, on-site services and Colleague Affinity Networks ‚Äî so you can be ready for where life can take you.

Olympus requires all new hires to be ‚Äúfully vaccinated‚Äù against COVID-19, as defined by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), on or before their first day of work. Olympus is passionate about the solutions it creates for the medical, life sciences, and industrial equipment industries, as well as cameras and audio products. Olympus‚Äô Medical business uses innovative capabilities in medical technology, therapeutic intervention, and precision manufacturing to help healthcare professionals deliver diagnostic, therapeutic, and minimally invasive procedures to improve clinical outcomes, reduce overall costs, and enhance the quality of life for patients. Olympus‚Äô Medical portfolio includes endoscopes, laparoscopes, and video imaging systems, as well as surgical energy devices, system integration solutions, medical services, and a wide range of endotherapy instruments for endoscopic and therapeutic applications. For more information, visit www.olympus-global.com.

Olympus‚Ä¶True To You. True To Society. True To LIFE.

It is the policy of Olympus to extend equal employment and advancement opportunity to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, national origin (including language use restrictions), citizenship status, religious creed (including dress and grooming practices), age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth and/or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, marital status, disability (physical or mental) and/or a medical condition, genetic information, ancestry, veteran status or service in the uniformed services, and any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.
