title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
About Us

Twitch is the world‚Äôs biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It‚Äôs where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment...

We‚Äôre about community, inside and out. You‚Äôll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We‚Äôre on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we‚Äôre up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we‚Äôre solving on our Blog.

About the Role

Twitch's Mobile Engineering team develops applications for the Android and iOS platforms. These platforms represent an ever-growing share of Twitch viewership and providing functional and delightful experiences on them is necessary to user engagement. As a Senior iOS Engineer on our Mobile Core Team, you will build and ship the iOS app which is a portal to Twitch's incomparable community of viewers and streamers. You will work with driven mobile engineers on a native app, used by millions of users each day, with modern technologies like Swift, SwiftUI, and GraphQL. You will report to the iOS Senior Engineering Manager on the Mobile Core team and work remotely or from either our San Francisco, Seattle, Los Angeles, Austin, or our New York City offices.

You Will:
‚Ä¢ Develop and deliver new features and frameworks for our iOS application (Video Player Integration, Identity, Dependency Management and other fundamental features)
‚Ä¢ Manage and improve our iOS Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery systems
‚Ä¢ Research new technologies and tooling for build and release
‚Ä¢ Improve engineering tools to increase team effectiveness

You Have:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of software development experience
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with Swift or Objective-C, and the iOS development ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Experience establishing build pipelines
‚Ä¢ Proficient technical writing of complicated technical problems to both technical and business audiences

Bonus Points
‚Ä¢ Experience with iOS Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery systems using fastlane, teamcity, jenkins or equivalent technologies
‚Ä¢ Experience with AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK), CloudFormation, Terraform or equivalent technologies

Perks
‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
‚Ä¢ 401(k), Maternity & Parental Leave
‚Ä¢ Flexible PTO
‚Ä¢ Commuter Benefits
‚Ä¢ Amazon Employee Discount
‚Ä¢ Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages),
‚Ä¢ Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Served Daily
‚Ä¢ Free Snacks & Beverages

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

The base pay range for this position in Colorado, Connecticut, Washington and New Jersey is $168,100 - $227,400 yr and in New York City is $184,900 - $250,200 yr. Pay is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on payment and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Twitch values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

title: Senior Digital Hardware Design Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
Do you have a vision to provide electronic design solutions that consistently exceed technical, schedule, and budgetary expectations?

Are you an expert in digital circuit design and analysis...

Would you thrive in a world class engineering organization that emphasizes providing exciting work opportunities and career development for our employees?

If you‚Äôve answered, ‚Äúyes,‚Äù our team at Raytheon Missiles and Defense wants to learn more about you! We are looking for Electrical Engineers with expertise in digital circuit design and analysis.

About Us:

At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, by combining our vast resources and investments, we are able to dedicate ourselves to solving mission-level vs. product-level customer challenges ‚Äì together we can anticipate more, move faster and make a bigger impact on the big picture.

Job Summary:

The Electrical Product Team (EPT) provides engineering design, integration and production to missile, core radar, sonar, torpedo, and combat system competencies including power systems, torpedo and sonar electronics, receivers and exciters, antennas, control actuation system and microwave sub-assemblies.

The Advanced Electrical Products Department (AEP) within the Electrical Product Team (EPT) is responsible for design engineering including the following areas:

‚Ä¢ Hardware Design Engineering
‚Ä¢ Digital Subsystems Integration and Test
‚Ä¢ Component, ECAD, Proto Development
‚Ä¢ FPGA/ASIC Design
‚Ä¢ Guidance FPGA Products
‚Ä¢ System Power and Analog Controls

Job Summary:

The Digital Hardware Design Engineer works as a member of a cross-functional project team with system, mechanical, and software engineers.

The Digital Hardware Design Engineer must be experienced in all aspects of circuit card design from concept through delivery to higher level assemblies as evidenced by multiple successful design completions (including hardware designs with processors, FPGAs, memory, and industry standard interfaces). The Digital Hardware Design Engineer will be familiar with latest technology trends in the area of microprocessor, memory, FPGA and interface protocols. Digital design encompasses the design, development, evaluation, and test of digital circuit card assemblies, subsystems and associated system level support.

We value diverse skills and experience, so don't hold back. Your qualifications could add tremendous value to our team. Our customers come from all different backgrounds, and so do our employees. If you're passionate about what you could accomplish here, we'd love to hear from you.

Responsibilities to Anticipate:
‚Ä¢ Developing unit and module level requirements derived from system level requirements
‚Ä¢ Circuit card design including hardware designs with processors, FPGAs, memory, and industry interfaces, such as PCIe, Ethernet, I2C, SPI, and UART.
‚Ä¢ Performing analysis and testing of the FPGA, circuit card, module, and/or unit in a laboratory setting
‚Ä¢ Guiding Electronic Computer-Aided Design (ECAD) personnel through PWB layout and technical drawing creation.
‚Ä¢ Performing design work within the bounds of a given schedule, and sometimes defining the schedule.
‚Ä¢ Presenting reviews of technical data to program leadership and technical staff and guiding junior engineers in honing this skill.
‚Ä¢ Design, analysis, simulation, test, and integration of digital electronic modules and/or CCAs for Missile applications.
‚Ä¢ Generate Printed Wiring Board (PWB) layout constraint guidelines, oversee the layout and fabrication of the design.

Qualifications You Must Have:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM)
‚Ä¢ 5+ years‚Äô applicable experience in digital circuit design, analysis, test & integration
‚Ä¢ Experience with board level design and debugging board level hardware

description:
Company Description

Block is one company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment. The blocks that form our foundational teams ‚Äî People, Finance, Counsel, Hardware, Information Security, Platform Infrastructure Engineering, and more ‚Äî provide support and guidance at the corporate level. They work across business groups and around the globe, spanning time... zones and disciplines to develop inclusive People policies, forecast finances, give legal counsel, safeguard systems, nurture new initiatives, and more. Every challenge creates possibilities, and we need different perspectives to see them all. Bring yours to Block.

Job Description

Block‚Äôs Security culture is focused on enabling our engineering teams to build and ship secure products. We achieve this by designing, building, and operating state of the art security alongside our product and infrastructure teams. The Block Security team works with other teams at Block to build world-class products for both customers and employees. Our ultimate goal is to ensure that every single experience with Block is simple, secure, and safe.

We are looking for an engineer to shape the way we automate and maintain security services across the organization. We are looking for an innovative automation champion who can solve complex security problems and develop a security automation framework.

Qualifications

You have:

Technologies we use and teach:

‚Ä¢ SPIFFE
‚Ä¢ Service Mesh, Envoy
‚Ä¢ AWS Lambda, Kubernetes, Docker

Additional Information

We‚Äôre working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we‚Äôre doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.

Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

Perks

We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:
‚Ä¢ Healthcare coverage
‚Ä¢ Retirement Plans
‚Ä¢ Employee Stock Purchase Program
‚Ä¢ Wellness perks
‚Ä¢ Paid parental leave
‚Ä¢ Paid time off
‚Ä¢ Learning and Development resources

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
Tremendous helps organizations pay people around the world.

There's a long list of use cases that payroll providers aren't equipped to handle‚Äìsurvey incentives, user research incentives, bug bounties, referral promotions, etc. Recipients are all over the world and want to get paid out instantly according to their own preferences...

The Tremendous platform and API lets organizations handle these one-off payments. We already work with 3000+ organizations, including Google, Stripe, Atlassian, Pinterest, and process $100M+ / year in volume.

Tremendous is 45 people, highly profitable, and going through a scaling period. We're fully remote, with outstanding benefits and above-market compensation.

Tremendous is looking for an Engineering Manager to lead a high performing team of engineers. You'll help build Tremendous' engineering culture, guiding product development and defining team process. You'll also work with product and design leaders to prioritize features and initiatives that continue to make Tremendous a delightful experience for our users.

More specifically, you will:
‚Ä¢ Build and lead an outstanding (and fully distributed) team of engineers, identifying needs and resources for the team to grow as Tremendous scales
‚Ä¢ Manage and create processes to help the team continue to perform at a high level
‚Ä¢ Ensure technical quality is improving through code reviews, technical briefs, and architecture decisions
‚Ä¢ Develop plans around onboarding new engineers, conducting 1:1s, and delivering thoughtful feedback

You have:
‚Ä¢ 2+ years experience leading a team of engineers, as a manager or a Tech Lead.
‚Ä¢ 3+ years experience as a senior or staff software engineer.
‚Ä¢ Great technical judgment. You are consistently right on technical approaches, with well-reasoned arguments for why.
‚Ä¢ Experience in Ruby / React. Tech stack knowledge is strongly preferred, but not required.
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills. You can write technical briefs and also respond to technical inquiries from our clients.
‚Ä¢ Solid product intuition. You generally have a good sense of what to build and can articulate product initiatives to engineers on the team.
‚Ä¢ High empathy. You care about your teammates and our users. You can put yourself in their shoes.
‚Ä¢ A magnet for talent. Other engineers and teammates enjoy working with you.

Tremendous focuses on Payments, Incentives, and Fin Tech. Their company has offices in New York City, San Francisco, and Remote. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.tremendous.com or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

title: Design Engineer
description:
Help us build the DNA of tech.

Vishay manufactures one of the world's largest portfolios of discrete semiconductors and passive electronic components that are essential to innovative designs in the automotive, industrial, computing, consumer, telecommunications, military, aerospace, and medical markets. We help the world's most in-demand technologies come to life. Every day our products touch... your life and the lives of people across the world, though you likely do not know it. Come join us and help us build The DNA of tech.‚Ñ¢

Where You'll Work & The Scope:

Vishay HiRel Systems in Dover, NH is currently seeking a full-time Design Engineer responsible for magnetics design primarily focused on custom transformers, inductors and coils for use in the military, medical, aerospace, industrial and test and measurement applications.

How You'll Help Us Build the DNA of Tech:
‚Ä¢ Develop magnetics designs (custom transformers, inductors, and coils) primarily for use in switch-mode power supplies.
‚Ä¢ Engineering collaboration with leaders in the medical, aerospace, military, industrial and automotive industries to design and develop custom magnetic components.

Experience You'll Need:

‚Ä¢ Work or school experience in the area of transformer and inductor design and/or switch-mode power supply design preferred
‚Ä¢ Experience using electrical test equipment (impedance analyzers, multimeters, oscilloscopes, function generators, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Experience with finite element analysis software (Ansys or others) a plus

‚Ä¢ Paid Time Off
‚Ä¢ Employee Assistance Programs
‚Ä¢ Tuition Reimbursement

This position requires access to information subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations and/or the Export Administration Regulations. As such, this position is open only to applicants who qualify as ‚ÄúU.S. Persons‚Äù according to U.S. federal law.

Vishay offers a comprehensive suite of benefit programs including health care coverage, financial support programs and other resources designed to help you achieve your personal and professional goals. title: Design Engineer - Chassis
description:
Tesla is now hiring Design Engineer - Chassis in Austin, TX. View job listing details and apply now.

THE MISSION...

Tesla is accelerating the world‚Äôs transition to sustainable energy. The Chassis Design Engineering team plays a critical part in that mission, helping to deliver a safe, efficient, comfortable, and enjoyable driving experience, while also focusing on the sustainability and value of Tesla‚Äôs products.

THE TEAM

The Chassis Design Engineering team is comprised of engineers from many backgrounds and experience levels. You‚Äôll work alongside experts with many years of experience, high aptitude recent graduates, and people from every stage in between. Collaboration, learning, and growth are core to the team‚Äôs success. We look for anyone with demonstrated exceptional ability to solve problems in both individual and team settings.

The team works in small, dedicated groups to manage tires, wheels, hubs, halfshafts, steering, suspension, subframes, brakes, pedals/controls, and air suspension and damping systems on all of Tesla‚Äôs passenger car and heavy vehicle programs. A Mechanical Design Engineer on the team is responsible for bringing parts or systems from concept to production and beyond with support from other engineering teams at Tesla.

THE ROLE

The engineer‚Äôs responsibilities include design, analysis, sourcing, prototyping, testing, vehicle assembly validation, quality control, engineering documentation, and more. There will be opportunities to learn and improve these skills through experience on the team. The engineer should be able to readily apply mechanical engineering fundamentals to creatively solve problems and learn quickly while managing their projects independently. We are looking for someone who will go beyond the status quo to make the best product in terms of cost, mass, and performance. The engineer should be able to communicate clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical colleagues. Hands-on experience is a major plus for engineering development work and addressing production issues. Experience with electromechanical systems is a plus. Some travel to suppliers may be required, including international travel.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The engineer will work with Tesla teams and component suppliers in order to:
‚Ä¢ Develop and optimize designs in 3D CAD software with associated CAE tools
‚Ä¢ Validate manufacturing, assembly, and service feasibility
‚Ä¢ Complete and release component designs and documentation, including 2D drawings
‚Ä¢ Validate components per defined engineering requirements
‚Ä¢ Resolve issues and concerns with cross-functional teams including engineering, firmware, supply chain, production, and service
‚Ä¢ Participate in the sourcing process and manage engineering relationships with suppliers
‚Ä¢ Deliver to defined schedules

REQUIREMENTS
‚Ä¢ Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in a 3D CAD software (CATIA is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Basic knowledge of GD&T (proficiency is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Experience with component design, analysis, and validation
‚Ä¢ Great technical and interpersonal communication
‚Ä¢ Evidence of being a self-starter and bringing projects to completion
‚Ä¢ Prior experience in a relevant engineering field is valued, but the team has openings from entry level to expert

title: Team Leader-Systems Engineer
description:
This role is with the MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) team which is a part of Global Engineering & Technology. MST is a team of multi-disciplinary engineers who help solve complex engineering and design problems by leveraging and developing state-of-the-art models, simulations, and digital design tools. Our team provides detailed engineering simulation, design engineering, and... analysis services worldwide for Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI), Park Operations Line of Business, Global Engineering & Technology partners, Transportation, Engineering Services, and Entertainment. MST builds Ride and Show Engineering to optimize design and architecture and identify solutions for new attractions and existing assets. The team covers a considerable breadth of modeling, simulation, and analysis work, including dynamic mechanical systems, FEA (Finite Element Analysis, RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis, system simulations, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, digital twins, engineering software tools and process development.

This Team Leader-Systems Engineer role will lead MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) Dynamic Modeling and Analysis team, and support technical development while meeting key business objectives. This leadership role typically requires 25%-50% of the time performing team management duties. Additional duties include providing technical project support and appropriate Subject Matter Expertise on relevant projects.

This role reports to the Manager of MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools)

Position Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Manage and support a team of high functioning multi-disciplinary engineers by helping them meet career goals while maintaining key business objectives such as scope, schedule, and budget.
‚Ä¢ Establish strong relationships with each direct report; listen, give guidance, advocate, and grow professionally.

‚Ä¢ Develop and understand macro-level business opportunities, including roadmaps to integrate new technologies into park operation and new product development.
‚Ä¢ Develop new business opportunities that align with MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) mission and technical advancement. Foster the growth of these new businesses by organizing and communicating.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with customers to set realistic expectations, staffing plans, and schedules.
‚Ä¢ Communicate with peer leads and management to understand resource levels and project priorities across the team.
‚Ä¢ Forecast resource needs by communicating with partners and planning for future scope, tracking budgets and spending, verifying planning assumptions, and gathering support from leadership.
‚Ä¢ Resolve resource priority conflicts between project teams and customers.
‚Ä¢ Manage conflict resolution within the team and with customers or key partners.
‚Ä¢ Manage external vendor scopes of work, including mechanical, systems, or software work.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ 7 or more years of relevant engineering experience
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead complex systems-level efforts while
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead and motivate team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to mentor and guide less experienced team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to manage resources & budgets for department portfolio.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbally, to build lasting relationships with team members, customers, and stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Proven ability to resolve challenges and demonstrate professionalism
‚Ä¢ Ability to confidently employ the Agile methodology

Preferred Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Experience with all facets of simulation involvement in the design of Ride and Show Mechanical and Controls Systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with simulation involvement in the Creative Design Process
‚Ä¢ Experience with the new attraction project cycles and critical milestones for modeling, simulation, or analysis involvement
‚Ä¢ Experience with fieldwork, including authoring test procedures, installation, testing, and communication strategy

‚Ä¢ Experience with CAD and Modeling experience
‚Ä¢ Experience with FEA (Finite Element Analysis), RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis
‚Ä¢ Experience with collaboration tools, including Confluence, Slack, JIRA, Microsoft Teams

‚Ä¢ You are happy to contribute across the stack, learning new skills as needed

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our work has a purpose. Our work requires passion and creates meaningful outcomes. Our work matters. We're sharing our expertise and technological advancements with customers, helping them make the world a better place - whether they're discovering a cure for cancer, protecting the environment, or making sure our food is safe.

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our people... share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation, and Involvement. We work together to accelerate research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics, drive innovation, and increase laboratory productivity. Each one of us contributes to our mission every day ‚Äì to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer.

Location/Division Specific Information

The ImmunoDiagnostics Division (IDD) develops, manufactures, and markets complete blood test systems to support the clinical diagnosis and follow-up of allergy and autoimmune diseases. The allergy and autoimmunity product lines operate on a common automated instrument platform, Phadia Laboratory Systems, which supports both productivity and cost efficiencies in clinical laboratories around the world. This position is remote and located in Ohio.

How will you make an impact?

IDD Field Service Engineers (FSEs) provide exceptional on-site service on highly complex and integrated systems within hospitals and commercial reference laboratories in their assigned service territories. This is accomplished through technical expertise, teamwork, and superior customer service.

Travel: 75%-100%
Territory is all of Ohio

What will you do?
‚Ä¢ Provide onsite service including repairs, preventive maintenance, upgrades, and installation of IDD analyzers.
‚Ä¢ Travel, on short notice, to customer sites to resolve reported issues or support other field service personnel.
‚Ä¢ Observe and follow Good Documentation Practices (GDPs) and internal policies and processes as required for field service reports and job-related submissions pertaining to spare parts: ordering, usage, returns, physical count, etc.
‚Ä¢ Display professionalism, understanding, tact, fairness, and technical knowledge in all customer interactions.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal partners to resolve customer issues and improve processes.
‚Ä¢ Provide remote and onsite service training or assistance to Biomedical Engineering Technicians (BMET) or advanced operators.
‚Ä¢ Increase technical competency level servicing instruments by completing in-person or online training courses.
‚Ä¢ Manage travel expenses and follow Thermo Fisher Scientific travel policies and guidelines.
‚Ä¢ May be required to perform other related duties as required and/or assigned.

How will you get here?

Education

Possess an Associates degree from a Technical or Engineering field in Electronics, Biomedical Engineering, Electrical or similar, or equivalent combination of skills and experience.

Experience
‚Ä¢ Experience in related life sciences, biomedical engineering and/or technical customer-facing roles.
‚Ä¢ Experience with operating, troubleshooting, repairing, and calibrating complex analyzers or systems.
‚Ä¢ Experience in a clinical, diagnostic and/or another regulated environment (CAP, CLIA, FDA) preferred.
‚Ä¢ Strong competency on Windows and other software, network knowledge, electrical/electronics, mechanics, chemistry technology; an analytical thinker with good engineering aptitude.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
‚Ä¢ Exercise judgment in setting work priorities and identifying next steps.
‚Ä¢ Able to quickly adapt to change with positive and constructive feedback.
‚Ä¢ Work in a fast-paced environment and operate remotely from the main office with minimum supervision.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to stand, bend, and/or kneel for up to two hours at a time.
‚Ä¢ Able to lift to 75 pounds, push and pull equipment, and carry up to 50 pounds for at least 100 feet.
‚Ä¢ Some exposure to biohazards is a possibility during instrument service activities, as these instruments are used in biohazard environments and encounter human bodily fluids. Biohazard training, safety equipment and following SOPs will minimize the exposure.
‚Ä¢ Ability to obtain and possess a valid driver's license, with a clean Motor Vehicle report.
‚Ä¢ Able to drive a vehicle for up to 4-5 hours at a time and be comfortable with commercial air travel.
‚Ä¢ Maintain Vendor Credentialing for access to customer locations and instrumentation which may require certain vaccinations and/or medical screening be kept up to date.
‚Ä¢ Overtime and last-minute schedule changes may occur to ensure customer satisfaction.
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel up to 85% (overnight), often in less than 1 days‚Äô notice via automobile or airplane.
‚Ä¢ Adhere to OHS policies and procedures and ensure a safe and healthy workplace environment.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $30 billion. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 100,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission‚Äîenabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

title: Team Leader-Systems Engineer
description:
This role is with the MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) team which is a part of Global Engineering & Technology. MST is a team of multi-disciplinary engineers who help solve complex engineering and design problems by leveraging and developing state-of-the-art models, simulations, and digital design tools. Our team provides detailed engineering simulation, design engineering, and... analysis services worldwide for Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI), Park Operations Line of Business, Global Engineering & Technology partners, Transportation, Engineering Services, and Entertainment. MST builds Ride and Show Engineering to optimize design and architecture and identify solutions for new attractions and existing assets. The team covers a considerable breadth of modeling, simulation, and analysis work, including dynamic mechanical systems, FEA (Finite Element Analysis, RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis, system simulations, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, digital twins, engineering software tools and process development.

This Team Leader-Systems Engineer role will lead MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) Dynamic Modeling and Analysis team, and support technical development while meeting key business objectives. This leadership role typically requires 25%-50% of the time performing team management duties. Additional duties include providing technical project support and appropriate Subject Matter Expertise on relevant projects.

This role reports to the Manager of MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools)

title: Human Factors Engineer
description:
General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.

The Human Factors Validation Engineer will provide technical expertise for the manufacturing and operations organization concentrating on the validation... of complex product design safety, product movement, and automated manufacturing systems to be safe and comfortable for human production. The position will require interfacing with all stakeholders (Information Technology, Quality Assurance, EH&S, Operations, Engineering, and R&D.)

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
‚Ä¢ Create Master Validation plan (MVP) in coordination with different stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Study product characteristics or customer requirements to determine validation objectives and standards.
‚Ä¢ Prepare detailed reports or design statements, based on industry results of validation and qualification tests or reviews of procedures and protocols.
‚Ä¢ Recommend resolution of identified deviations from established tools or process standards.
‚Ä¢ Work on sample size determination, creating sample size for Testing‚Äôs, for Design Verification, Validation, Process Validation and Test Method Validation.
‚Ä¢ Create, populate, or maintain databases for tracking validation activities, test results, or validated systems.
‚Ä¢ Communicates with users to understand and evaluate problems they may encounter with specific equipment or machines.
‚Ä¢ Conduct research to evaluate safety levels for tool designs and transport products.
‚Ä¢ Recommend procedures for detection, prevention, and elimination of product hazards.

‚Ä¢ Develop internal push/pull factors templates for design teams.
‚Ä¢ Performs other related duties as assigned

We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.
Job Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Typically requires a bachelors degree, masters degree or PhD in STEM or a related technical discipline from an accredited institution and progressive engineering experience as follows; nine or more years of experience with a bachelors degree, seven or more years of experience with a masters degree, or four or more years with a PhD. May substitute equivalent engineering experience in lieu of education.
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience in Method Transfer, Process Validation (IQ /OQ /PQ), Validation performance and Reports.
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience working on Validation reports for the Manufacturing site that are moving from one place to another. This includes Facility Validation.
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience on drafting Protocols, Testing, Data Analysis and Test Reports.
‚Ä¢ Good understanding on Requirements analysis (Customer Reqs, Technical Reqs, Functional /Product Reqs), Traceability Matrix, DHF Remediation and Risk Management with FMEA working.
‚Ä¢ Familiar with Engineering Change Orders and Engineering Change Notes
‚Ä¢ Proven track record of problem solving.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in Mechanical Design, Bill of Materials, Product Life Cycle stages
‚Ä¢ Provide Project status updates to the work group, tracking the overall project implementation.
‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate with a design team.
‚Ä¢ Extensive knowledge of ergonomic design and principles.
‚Ä¢ Ability to identify issues that can be resolved to improve safety and comfort.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and communication skills.
‚Ä¢ DoD secret security clearance desired, ability to obtain a security clearance required

title: Transmission and Distribution Engineer Electric Utility
description:
Description

Job Description...
Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Engineer ‚Äì Honolulu, HI

Leidos Engineering is seeking a Transmission & Distribution Engineer who will support the planning and implementation of T&D projects with our Power Delivery Services division at our Honolulu HI office.

PLEASE NOTE: To qualify for this position, you must be willing to relocate to Honolulu, HI.

Our Power Delivery Services division provides engineering consulting services to publicly- and investor-owned electric utilities offering comprehensive planning and engineering of electric transmission and distribution, and substation projects nationwide.

Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Engineer Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Act as lead engineer on electric transmission, sub-transmission and distribution design projects for overhead and underground systems operating from 12kV through 138kV.
‚Ä¢ Apply applicable industry codes and standards in the engineering and design of Electrical T&D systems, voltage conversion projects, underground conversion projects, new capacity projects and infrastructure replacement projects.
‚Ä¢ Perform Engineering analyses, prepare material procurement and construction documents, and work with project planning, environmental, permitting, and construction management.
‚Ä¢ Manage and/or execute various sized transmission, sub-transmission and distribution projects located in the State of Hawaii
‚Ä¢ Supervise engineers and designers responsible for preparation of construction packages
‚Ä¢ Mentor engineers and designers for technical and career development
‚Ä¢ Encourage an inclusive and collaborative work environment
‚Ä¢ Perform quality control of engineering work products and construction packages
‚Ä¢ Support engineers and designers in the development of design solutions for complex and/or non-standard installations
‚Ä¢ Work closely and collaboratively with client engineering and management in the prosecution of job responsibilities and project execution
‚Ä¢ Be a trusted advisor to clients seeking input on various technical matters
‚Ä¢ Support business development and sales responsibilities of Account Manager

Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Engineer General Scope of Assignments:
‚Ä¢ Perform design of overhead and underground transmission, sub-transmission and distribution system improvements in accordance with industry best management practice, and client standards, procedures, and policies, including but not limited to replacements, relocations, maintenance, services, system upgrades and expansions.
‚Ä¢ Conduct field inspections to review the physical condition of transmission, sub-transmission and distribution systems and make engineering recommendations for the replacement and/or enhancement of facilities.
‚Ä¢ Work collaboratively with client engineering, operations and other departments to ensure work products and services meet expectations and commitments.
‚Ä¢ Prepare project cost estimates considering design, materials and construction, as well as outside resources.
‚Ä¢ Prepare project schedules.
‚Ä¢ Prepare design progress submittals and construction drawings for issue to client crews and/or third party contractors.
‚Ä¢ Support client crews and/or third party contractors during construction by promptly responding to RFI.

To be considered for the following levels:
‚Ä¢ Mid Level: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Electrical Engineering with a minimum of four (4) + years of relevant experience as a Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Engineer
‚Ä¢ Senior Level: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Electrical Engineering with a minimum of eight (8) + years of relevant experience as a Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Engineer
‚Ä¢ SME Level: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Electrical Engineering with a minimum of eight (12) + years of relevant experience as a Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Engineer

Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Engineer Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor Science degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited program
‚Ä¢ Minimum 12 years of prior relevant technical and supervisory ex
‚Ä¢ Previous consulting experience preferred
‚Ä¢ Must be licensed as a Professional Engineer (PE) in the State of Hawaii or reciprocity from another State
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of and ability to apply industry codes and standards, including but not limited to NESC, GO6 and NEC
‚Ä¢ Experience with T&D design tools, such as PLS-CADD and O-Calc
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of overhead and underground T&D construction methods
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with T&D system equipment
‚Ä¢ Strong writing, verbal and listening communication skills
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem solving skills
‚Ä¢ Valid driver‚Äôs license and clean driving record; travel required as needed for projects
‚Ä¢ Ability to stand for long periods, walk (and hike) on uneven ground, climb ladders, work in confined spaces, and lift up to 50 pounds.

Leidos Engineering is a trusted and future-focused solutions provider. Utilities consistently come to Leidos for reliable power expertise, as reflected through our work with more than 50 investor-owned utilities and more than 160 municipals/cooperatives across the country as well as a growing number of local utility providers and private developers. Our project portfolio includes large energy projects for electric utilities, power generation owners, and industrial clients. In addition, Leidos works with an established group of industry-leading construction partners delivering meaningful energy delivery solutions. Our recognition as an industry leader is confirmed by the latest national rankings by Engineering News-Record (ENR) ranking Leidos within: the Top 10 T&D Firms, Top 10 Program Management Firms, and Top 20 Power Firms

description:
Our Opportunity:

Chewy is hiring a Staff Software Engineer to work on Chewy‚Äôs Discovery Platform and join our team. The Discovery team is responsible for the consumer journey across Chewy.com. This consumer journey is prominent across all of Chewy, enabling customers to discover products through browsing, search results and more. As a Senior member of the engineering team, you will own be... responsible for the platform design, development and implementation. In this role, you will engage in iterative development, testing, and make contributions to the growth and development of one of Chewy's fastest growing areas. You will be involved in high-impact decisions and initiatives undertaken by the company, giving you a front row seat to shape Chewy‚Äôs growth.

To be successful in the role, you will need a proven track record of being a disruptor, innovator, and forward-looking engineer. Equally as important, you will need to operate at depth, understanding every detail of the organization‚Äôs product goals, as well as being able to ‚Äúzoom out‚Äù to connect the dots across the technology stack. This energetic individual will partner with both technical and business teams on multiple initiatives and collaborate to deliver new features and enhancements. The role will have visibility in the product, technology & business organizations of Chewy.

What You‚Äôll Do:
‚Ä¢ You will have responsibility over major components of Chewy‚Äôs search architecture and platform ‚Äì both development and operational needs. You will be the go-to engineer for your part of the platform
‚Ä¢ Apply vision, strategy, and thought leadership to impact Chewy, at scale
‚Ä¢ Evolve and grow world-class Chewy search experience, serving millions of search queries
‚Ä¢ Immerse yourself in imagining and providing cutting-edge solutions to build high-performance, low-latency web and mobile-web experiences
‚Ä¢ Have a relentless focus on scalability, latency, performance robustness, and cost trade-offs -- especially those present in highly virtualized, elastic, cloud-based environments
‚Ä¢ Apply rigorous analysis to identify issues affecting customer experience and iterative improve features
‚Ä¢ Alongside a dedicated site reliability team to develop and support smooth 24x7 operation of our applications
‚Ä¢ Work with Engineering Leadership to drive best practices in software development, testing, and deployment
‚Ä¢ Hire, train, and mentor more junior engineers on the team

What You‚Äôll Need:
‚Ä¢ 8+ years of experience designing, building, deploying, operating, scaling, and evolving distributed systems and high-volume transaction application in a 24/7 environment
‚Ä¢ 7+ years of industry experience in software development in one or more of Javascript, Typescript, React, Next.js
‚Ä¢ Must possess a bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience
‚Ä¢ Passion for optimizing systems
‚Ä¢ Solid communication skills and ability to work well in a team are critical
‚Ä¢ AWS development experience
‚Ä¢ Experience in Agile/Scrum development process
‚Ä¢ Experience in Web/Product search for Information Retrieval or developing in Open-Source Lucene
‚Ä¢ Position will require travel between Seattle and Boston at least once per calendar year

Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.

If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact HR@chewy.com.

To access Chewy‚Äôs Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here: https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Our Senior Software Engineers lead and mentor engineers, delivering high-impact product and infrastructure projects at a hypergrowth company that has found product-market fit and is scaling quickly.

Vanta provides a security solution at scale for hundreds of companies that trust us with their most important data. We integrate deeply with our customers‚Äô SaaS providers, infrastructure, and... employee laptops to analyze the relationships with that data and surface potential security threats in real time. As a Senior Software Engineer, you‚Äôll be responsible for setting technical direction to enable our product and infrastructure to scale with our business, driving complex projects across our technical stack, and mentoring our talented engineering team.

Today, joining Vanta as an engineer means seeing all parts of the business, growing and developing our team, shaping Vanta's culture from the earliest stages, and building core parts of our product and infrastructure that enable us to continue to grow and scale.

No security experience is required, just a passion for our mission to secure the internet and protect consumer data!

You will:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and own new product functionality and/or infrastructure leveraging modern frameworks and tooling (TypeScript, React, Node.js, Golang)
‚Ä¢ Mentor and elevate other engineers on the team
‚Ä¢ Lead multi-engineer projects, delivering significant impact to our product and/or infrastructure
‚Ä¢ Set direction for important technical surface areas
‚Ä¢ Interact closely with our customers and customer-facing teammates to build and ship meaningful products
‚Ä¢ Play a part in defining Vanta's engineering culture as we grow

You have:
‚Ä¢ Have at least 5 years of professional work experience as a software engineer and an aptitude for technology
‚Ä¢ Have previously mentored engineers, such as either a new-hire buddy, intern or full-time teammate mentor, or technical lead
‚Ä¢ Have prior experience with technologies we use, though this isn‚Äôt a requirement!
‚Ä¢ Be interested in contributing to a growing company beyond your day-to-day responsibilities

Benefits & Perks:
‚Ä¢ Industry-competitive salary and equity, as well as transparent compensation practices
‚Ä¢ Medical, dental, and vision benefits
‚Ä¢ Paid parental leave for all parents
‚Ä¢ 401(k) plan
‚Ä¢ Flexible work hours and location
‚Ä¢ Remote workspace stipend
‚Ä¢ Health and wellness stipend
‚Ä¢ Open paid-time off policy
‚Ä¢ 10 company paid holidays
‚Ä¢ Virtual team building activities, lunch and learns, and other company events

For when we‚Äôre back in office:
‚Ä¢ Generous monthly stipend for Bay Area commute
‚Ä¢ New office in sunny Hayes Valley, San Francisco
‚Ä¢ Full kitchen + snacks and drinks supply

About Us

We started Vanta in 2017 as Equifax had lost every American‚Äôs social security number, Home Depot had leaked its customers‚Äô credit card numbers to hackers, and Facebook admitted that it irresponsibly sent user data to third parties who tried to influence the US election. It was clear that security and privacy had become mainstream issues, and that we all increasingly relied on cloud services to store everything from our personal photos to our communications at work.

Vanta‚Äôs mission is to be the layer of trust on top of these services, and to secure the internet, increase trust in software companies, and keep consumer data safe.

We do this by building an automated head of security for technology companies, and we use that system to both help a company secure itself and to prove their security to others.

If we succeed in our mission, it should feel irresponsible for users to put data into a product that isn‚Äôt certified by Vanta, and irresponsible for companies to collect data without using Vanta to secure and monitor themselves

title: Lead Application Engineer SCBU
description:
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world‚Äôs most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software... developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better.

SUMMARY

The Lead Application Engineer leads the deployment and support of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the Lead Application Engineer will use expertise to develop strategic technical campaigns, negotiate success criteria and provide refined requirements to drive exciting new product features to meet business objectives.

RESPONSIBILITIES
‚Ä¢ Develop competence in a product area and be recognized as a regional expert
‚Ä¢ Lead technical campaigns to successful completion
‚Ä¢ Work independently and as a member of a team and motivate others
‚Ä¢ Develop and deliver training/education to customers
‚Ä¢ Be a mentor for junior levels
‚Ä¢ Negotiate success criteria with customers for critical technical campaigns
‚Ä¢ Provide neat, accurate, and thorough work in a timely manner
‚Ä¢ Complete assignments without specific directions, recognize problems, and apply or suggest viable solutions

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
‚Ä¢ BS in Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 8 years‚Äô experience, MS with 6 years‚Äô experience, or PhD with 3 years‚Äô experience
‚Ä¢ Significant commercial experience with IC design, or support of EDA tools enabling IC design
‚Ä¢ Technical knowledge of circuit behavior, physical design, timing and noise analysis, or power noise analysis
‚Ä¢ Proven track record of crafting robust and efficient code
‚Ä¢ Solid TCL, Python programming skills

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
‚Ä¢ Excellent technical knowledge and commercial experience with semiconductor and systems design, specializing in backend digital and mixed-signal analysis, including power analysis and power noise reliability analysis.
‚Ä¢ Experience leading projects and delivering high-quality support for a large-scale commercial software
‚Ä¢ Ability to translate business needs into development plans
‚Ä¢ Ability to overcome obstacles and drive projects to completion
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to work collaboratively across teams and geographies, and to mentor junior engineers

ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS

At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world‚Äôs most challenging engineering problems. Our ONE Ansys culture has at its core:
‚Ä¢ Customer Focus
‚Ä¢ Results and Accountability
‚Ä¢ Innovation
‚Ä¢ Transparency and Integrity
‚Ä¢ Mastery
‚Ä¢ Inclusiveness
‚Ä¢ Sense of Urgency
‚Ä¢ Collaboration and Teamwork

ENGINEERING YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS

At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high ‚Äì met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. At Ansys, it‚Äôs about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It‚Äôs about the ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs next‚Äù as much as the ‚Äúmission accomplished.‚Äù And it‚Äôs about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. title: Frontend Engineer
description:
WHY WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU:

Retool is both an interface used to build internal tools and the runtime for those apps. It's used simultaneously by technically-demanding engineers and productivity-focused end users. As you can imagine, it's critical that we build a performant, usable, and powerful front end...

As a front-end engineer at Retool, you‚Äôll be building a platform that thousands of customers rely on to run their operations.

We have a small but mighty engineering team. We‚Äôve done a lot with a little, but there‚Äôs much more work to be done to continue our fast-paced growth, we need to hire a world-class engineering team. You‚Äôll help us get there by owning end-to-end projects, talking with customers, and ultimately supporting the growth of Retool (both the product and the business).

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Front-end engineers at Retool collaborate closely with our design team to craft a product that delights our users. You will help extend the core functionality of our application editor, which requires both attention to detail and an understanding of performance implications. To keep Retool blazingly fast we may end up experimenting with Core React functionality, Web Workers and WebAssembly.

New features often start off as customer ideas. You‚Äôll take those ideas and scope, build, test, document and ship them to production . Outside of customer feedback, you‚Äôll also weigh in on our product roadmap which is set collaboratively by design and engineering.

You‚Äôll be working primarily in React and Typescript with a Node.js backend.

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH:

At Retool, we work cross-functionally with designers, customer engineers, and support engineers, as well as the marketing and sales teams. Engineers make a lot of product decisions and you‚Äôll partner frequently with designers as you scope and build your projects. Everyone on our design team is comfortable both in Figma as well as code.

We're a hard-working, passionate bunch who are motivated by collaboration, strong results, and bringing the impact of Retool to our customers. When we‚Äôre in the office, we enjoy eating lunch (and occasionally dinner!) together, and swapping stories. But at the root of it all, we come together to show our customers and not-quite-yet customers how Retool can make them and their companies more efficient and successful.

If this sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

THE SKILLSET YOU'll BRING:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years experience in professional front-end development, ideally some of which you‚Äôve spent in startups
‚Ä¢ Significant experience working with Javascript/Typescript and React
‚Ä¢ Previous experience working closely with designers, building flexible, composable libraries and components
‚Ä¢ You sweat the important details and are passionate about maintainable, scalable CSS.
‚Ä¢ Experience owning technically challenging and demanding cross-functional projects
‚Ä¢ A record of identifying valuable projects, communicating the strategy for them, and executing on them autonomously
‚Ä¢ A customer-first mindset and an interest in talking with customers to make sure what we‚Äôre building is a polished product meets their needs
‚Ä¢ Habit of introspection and understanding what‚Äôs helped you be successful in the past
‚Ä¢ Bonus points if you have experience in mentoring other team members

title: Senior Software Engineer (Greater Boston Area, MA)
description:
At Klaviyo, we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives each Klaviyo (we call ourselves Klaviyos) brings to our workplace each and every day. We believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success and appreciate the experiences each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. If you‚Äôre a close but not exact match with the description, we hope you‚Äôll still consider... applying.

Klaviyo is growing fast and we have openings for all skill levels across all of our teams. Learn more about our engineering culture at https://klaviyo.tech

We love tackling tough engineering problems and look for Senior Full Stack Engineers who specialize in certain areas but are passionate about building, owning & scaling features end to end from scratch and breaking through any obstacle or technical challenge in their way. We push each other to move out of our comfort zone, learn new technologies and work hard to ensure each day is better than the last.

Klaviyo operates a real-time data platform coded in Python built for massive scale on Amazon Web Services (AWS). Engineers come to Klaviyo with experience in a variety of languages and from a number of disciplines.

Technologies we use (not exhaustive):
‚Ä¢ Python, Django, Celery
‚Ä¢ MySQL, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, Redis
‚Ä¢ HTML, JavaScript, LESS, Backbone.js, React
‚Ä¢ Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, Aurora, etc.)Terraform, Ansible, Packer, and other DevOps tools

How you will make a difference:
‚Ä¢ Wholly own features that thousands of our customers rely on daily to reach 100,000,000+ of consumers to drive their business forward
‚Ä¢ Work on crafting our highly scalable real-time data pipeline that processes billions of events monthly across data sets growing to petabyte scale
‚Ä¢ Be empowered to own the mission, technical direction and operations of projects that have immediate impact
‚Ä¢ Advance your technical skills in all facets ranging from front end web development and user experience to machine learning and massively parallelized data pipelines
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the company as a subject matter expert in multiple areas, constantly pushing yourself to be a better engineer and to level up all of your peers within your team and within Klaviyo

Who you are:
‚Ä¢ Have experience building products that matter and pushing yourself and your team to be better engineers and build a product with passionate advocates
‚Ä¢ Enjoy working with new technologies ranging from the frontend to backend, and are particularly passionate and an expert in multiple stack areas. You show this by having strong and opinionated experience with various technologies and know how to pick the right tool for any job
‚Ä¢ Love digging into performance and scalability issues to drive breakthrough solutions-- whether it's a slow loading UI or too many clicks in a workflow, a database query timing out, or a queue that just won‚Äôt drain. You recognize all problems can be solved
‚Ä¢ Enjoy shipping code early & often in an agile fashion, pairing with product management to craft better software by soliciting feedback from thousands of end users
‚Ä¢ Like working on small, autonomous agile teams. At Klaviyo, you will have ownership of features, but you'll collaborate with everyone to make sure we produce the right solution

Get to Know Klaviyo

Klaviyo is a world-leading marketing automation platform dedicated to accelerating revenue and customer connection for online businesses. Klaviyo makes it easy to store, access, analyze and use transactional and behavioral data to power highly-targeted customer and prospect communications. The company's hybrid customer-data and marketing-platform model allows companies to grow by fostering direct relationships with customers, without giving up their valuable data to popular big-tech ad platforms. Over 265,000 innovative companies like Unilever, Custom Ink, Living Proof and Huckberry sell more with Klaviyo. Learn more at www.klaviyo.com.

If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a remote role, you can receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request. Requests can be submitted here. Additional information regarding benefits can be found here.

Klaviyo is committed to diversity and to a policy of equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable law

Job Description

This is an exciting time to be at Intel. Come join Intel 3D NAND Technology and Manufacturing (NAND-DTM) Group as a Product Development Engineer and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world...

As a Non-Volatile Memory Device and Scribe Integration engineers are responsible for:

An ideal candidate would also display the following:
‚Ä¢ Good verbal and written communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Great team player.
‚Ä¢ Excellent problem-solving skills.

The position is associated with the sale of the NAND business to SK Hynix aligning to Phase 2 of the transaction. Employees aligned to Phase 2 will continue to be employed by Intel developing NAND technology and components. Phase 2 of the transaction is expected to close in March 2025 at which time employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition employment to Solidigm, a stand-alone US subsidiary of SK Hynix headquartered in San Jose, California with offices world-wide. Solidigm is a leading global supplier of NAND flash memory solutions, led by Robert (Rob) B. Crooke as CEO, previously senior vice president and general manager of Intel‚Äôs Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group. To read more, see: https://www.intc.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1513/intel-sells-ssd-business-and-dalian-facility-to-sk-hynix

Bachelor's in Computer or Electrical Engineering and 6+ years of experience in relevant semiconductor coursework and/or experience, including the following:
‚Ä¢ ASIC design, layout, memory design, memory layouts, CAD tools, and software, in particular DF2, K2view, and Hercules.

‚Ä¢ Tape-out, OPC, and Mask Generation Flow for High volume manufacturing.

Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering and 4+ years of experience in minimum qualifications.

OR

PH.D in Computer or Electrical Engineering and 2+ years of experience in minimum qualifications.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Automated testers and Python scripting.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Other NVM memory.
Inside this Business GroupEmployees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel.Covid StatementIntel strongly encourages employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Description

SAIC‚Äôs National Intelligence Community (NIC) business unit, USG Mission and Information Technology division provides solutions and services supporting digital modernization programs in areas such as system engineering, multi-cloud computing, cyber security, data science and analytics, artificial intelligence/machine learning, quantum computing, application development, SecDevOps... cloud network operations and secure communications.

We are seeking highly motivated Cloud Engineers to join our multi-million dollar national intelligence program supporting the Cloud Investment Multi-Cloud Management (CIMM) team. As a contributor to the intelligence community‚Äôs first multi-cloud initiative, you will be at the epicenter of emergent cloud computing technologies establishing a foundation that will evolve to include all agencies within the IC. The ideal candidate will advise mission users on utilizing cloud-based IT systems, provide support for development in or transition to the cloud, implementation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of cloud environments, as well as managing system infrastructure and any processes related to these systems.

Responsibilities include:
‚Ä¢ Advising Government stakeholders on multi-cloud, multi-agency collaborative activities that require navigating agency-specific policy requirements.
‚Ä¢ Providing cloud strategy services that cover all security fabrics and are available to the Government to assist with the relocation of an organization‚Äôs business applications, data, and workloads to ensure maximum effectiveness of the multi-cloud environment.
‚Ä¢ Serving as a Cloud‚Äìagnostic evangelist and helps educate the Government customer on cloud Services
‚Ä¢ Defining and documenting best practices and strategies regarding application deployment and infrastructure maintenance.
‚Ä¢ Reviewing mission system requirements and facilitating technical recommendations for CSP Task Order Proposal Requests (TOPRs).
‚Ä¢ Providing advisory services to the Service Provider and IC Element for the discovery, adoption, and understanding of new and existing CSP service offerings operating in the C2E environment.
‚Ä¢ Advising the Government on application performance, uptime, and scale best practices, maintaining high standards of code quality and thoughtful design
‚Ä¢ Ensuring the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into cloud solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints

title: ASSISTANT TOWN ENGINEER
description:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

This position involves the responsible administrative and technical work assisting in the operation of a municipal engineering office and providing technical, staff engineering support...

Work involves assisting the Town Engineer in planning, directing, and supervising civil engineering activities for the Town of North Haven. Duties include performing field reconnaissance and collecting survey data, performing construction inspection tasks, assisting residents, contractors, Land Use Commissions, and other Town Departments in Town related engineering matters, assist in Engineering Office organization and operations, assist in the development and expansion of Town GIS resources, assist in the review of development proposals

SUPERVISION RECEIVED:

Reports to the Town Engineer.

EXAMPLES OF DUTIES:

Assist in the day-to-day operations of the Engineering Office.
Perform construction inspection services related to Town administered projects including drainage improvement projects, roadway and intersection improvements, bridge construction, paving, park improvements, and the like.
Assist in administration of a variety of Engineering programs such as Excavation Permits, F.O.G., MIU-GP, MS4, Industrial Stormwater, and Floodplain Development.
Assist in providing professional engineering staff services to Town Land Use Commissions and attend meetings as may be necessary including night meetings.
Review and refinement of engineering details and standards.
Assist in the oversight and inspection of residential and industrial subdivision roads for conformity with Town specifications.
Assist in the development of technical specifications for engineering projects.
Work closely with federal, state, regional agencies, utilities and other municipalities on civil engineering programs and problems as well as sanitary sewer and water systems.
Maintain a variety of records and prepare reports.
Performs related work as required.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

Thorough knowledge of municipal civil engineering principles and practices.
Considerable knowledge of road building, bridge construction and drainage problems and their solutions.
Considerable ability in oral and written communications.
Thorough civil engineering design ability, especially in drainage and hydraulics.
Considerable knowledge and experience in AutoCAD, Bluebeam, and Microsoft Office Suite of software, as well as a working knowledge of GIS systems
Considerable ability to enforce professional and engineering standards with firmness and tact.

Considerable ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with superiors, associates, subordinates, consultants, contractors, and the general public.
Considerable experience in working with federal, state, and local government agencies on engineering projects involving road, building, bridge and drainage construction.

QUALIFICATIONS:

A bachelor s degree in civil engineering from a recognized college or university plus a minimum of three years of progressively responsible civil engineering experience including some supervisory experience.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess a valid certification under Connecticut s Engineer-In-Training program or secure such certification within six (6) months of employment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $73,715.00 - $86,174.00 per year

Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Health insurance
Health savings account
Paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
masks optional

Work Location: One location

Together, these teams work to set new standards in pet care. And, as a part of Mars Petcare, they work to create a better world for pets. Learn more at www.kinship.co.

OUR TEAM

‚Ä¢ Interact with designers and product manager to determine best ways to implement features

THE PRO WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR

As Kinship people, we have three pillars that set out how we aim to be--in our everyday work, and in how we approach each other. We call these our Cultural Pillars. In all of the roles that we hire for, we look for people who are Optimistic, Purposefully Inquisitive, and Open to All. And for this role, you‚Äôll need these

TECHNICAL SKILLS:
‚Ä¢ Comfortable laying foundational code
‚Ä¢ Experience with relational databases and PostgreSQL with ability to load, navigate and extract data from various data stores like MS SQL Server, MS Access, DB4/Fox Pro (read DBF files for database imports), MySQL and potentially other database systems.
‚Ä¢ Experience parsing data and/or CSV files for mapping and insertion into a relational database
‚Ä¢ Experience with Linux OS, AWS and PHP and command-line PostgreSQL
‚Ä¢ Experience with advanced modern Javascript frameworks(Next, React, Ember, Vue, Angular, etc)

‚Ä¢ Experience evaluating and recommending tools and technologies
‚Ä¢ Comfortable deploying software to major cloud platforms (AWS, Heroku, GCP, etc)
‚Ä¢ Experience mentoring other software engineers

‚Ä¢ Experience with common development tools such as Node, Yarn, NPM, etc.

LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES:
‚Ä¢ You Have Courage: a willingness to bring forth a new idea, engaging others across Kinship to support you, and taking risks and action will full accountability
‚Ä¢ You Learn at Pace: a consistent and fast work ethic to meet growth goals, and the ability to evolve and pivot quickly from what you‚Äôve learned
‚Ä¢ You Value Difference: a genuine belief in inclusion and diversity is in your DNA, and it shows up in your work, and how you work.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US:

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Sr. Software Engineer

Our Platform team continuously delivers reliable and scalable core services that make up the building blocks for most of our products. We also drive the leveraging of new technologies across the company. Are you excited to work on technologies like Go (Golang), Kubernetes, and Cloud Infrastructure? If yes, then come talk to us...

As part of our Platform team, you will help build (ground up) new services that are shared across the Freedom Financial Network companies. An opportunity to participate in the design, architecture, development, and deployment of these new services (end-to-end). You will leverage machine learning and data to deliver intelligent decision-making services which will drive better customer experience. You will find here a highly productive, collaborative, and innovative environment where your voice is heard.
This position is 100% remote!

THE ROLE:
‚Ä¢ Participate in the architecture and development of new micro-services for multiple enterprise-level products. You will be building core common services.
‚Ä¢ Use technology to solve business problems and drive positive outcomes
‚Ä¢ Build a scalable technology platform to support a growing business
‚Ä¢ Ask questions and never stop learning
‚Ä¢ Deliver high-quality code to production
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with DevOps for cloud deployment
‚Ä¢ Work closely in an agile team of product owners, data scientists, business analysts and engineers in a collaborative environment
‚Ä¢ Develop brand new RESTful or Event-Driven services

REQUIREMENTS:
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 6+ years of experience as a Software Engineer
‚Ä¢ Experience coding in Java, C++, or Golang (Go)
‚Ä¢ Microservices on our Platform team are written in Go. However, it is not a requirement to have it. We are looking for candidates that would enjoy the challenge of learning and using Go.
‚Ä¢ You have designed, built, and maintained REST APIs for use in production and you have experience working with Open API standards like Swagger
‚Ä¢ Experience using Events Framework or Architecture (Kafka, Pub/Sub, Kinesis)
‚Ä¢ Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process preferred
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with DevOps, continuous delivery, configuration management, and tools is desired
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Micro-services and respective architecture design principles and scalability best practices
‚Ä¢ Experience working with data: SQL, NoSQL, key-value store, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Google Cloud Platform is highly preferred but not required
‚Ä¢ Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes highly preferred but not required

OUR CORE VALUES:
‚Ä¢ Care (for everyone): We show compassion and contribute to the well-being and growth of those around us. We only pursue products that improve the financial lives of our clients.
‚Ä¢ Act with Integrity (every time): We take the right action even when it is hard and even when no one is watching. We treat our employees, clients, and communities the way they wish to be treated.
‚Ä¢ Get Better (every day): We innovate, iterate, and improve each day. We are creative, take thoughtful risks, and ultimately learn and recover from failures.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate (with everybody): We strive to work together toward a common purpose by proactively sharing information and inviting participation. We recognize the perspective of various groups and embrace a healthy, constructive debate.

ABOUT US:

Freedom Financial Network is a leading digital personal finance company, built to help people. We do what traditional banks don‚Äôt: Put people first. We believe in treating people like humans, not account numbers. We help everyday people get on, and stay on, the path to a brighter financial future, with innovative technology and personalized support at every step. We help people control expenses, manage debt, save money, plan ahead, and make better financial decisions. By leveraging our proprietary data and analytics and artificial intelligence we offer solutions tailored for each step of a consumer's financial journey, including personal loans, home equity loans, help with debt, and even financial tools and education.

With 2,400 employees across California, Arizona and Texas, we have served more than 1 million customers, resolved more than $15 billion in consumer debt and originated $6.5 billion in loans over the course of our 20 years in business.

Driven by our core values, we‚Äôre passionate about supporting our communities and proudly awarded over $500,000 in grants distributed by the Freedom Foundation Fund and the Freedom Family Fund in 2021. We believe in a culture led by diversity, equity, and inclusion, and encourage our employees to bring their full selves to work every day. Our diversity-focused Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) are open to all, whether a member of the ERG community or an ally of the group and we are a member of the Fintech Racial Equity Coalition to address and improve inequality in the financial technology industry.

And finally, we take great pride in our achievements. This year we topped the list of Best Place to Work by the Phoenix Business Journal, were a top 100 Corporate Philanthropist by the San Francisco Business Times, a 2021 Most Admired Company and a Tech Company with the Best Company Culture by BestCompaniesAz, a 2021 Top Work Places winner by AZ central and a BuiltIn Best Places to Work winner, to name a few.
