title: Modelling Tools Engineer - Engineer I
via: via We Are Central PA Jobs
description:
Puget Sound Energy is looking to grow our community with top talented individuals like you! With our rapidly growing, award winning energy efficiency programs, our Pathway to an exciting and innovative future is now.

PSEs Planning team is looking for qualified candidates to fill an open Modelling Tools Engineer - Engineer I position...
Specific details regarding the work arrangements for this position will be discussed in further detail during the interview process.

Job Description

The Modelling Tools Engineer in this position will have an emphasis on improving the use of tools and software to help the study of capacity and operating performance of the distribution system in line with future integration of smart grid devices and systems, including distribution energy resources (DER), volt/var optimization (VVO), advanced metering infrastructure (AMI), distribution automation (DA).

The right candidate is someone who is excited about realizing the future of energy delivery while meeting our customers' needs today and is curious about learning and passionate about improving.

Job Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Provides technical support to others in the Planning department in the maintenance, upgrades, and training of features and data for department software tools such as Synergi, LoadSEER, and other programs.
‚Ä¢ Performs system analysis using a variety of those software tools including Synergi, LoadSEER and other tools modeling and analysis of the Electric Power System.
‚Ä¢ Interprets and/or modifies available guidelines for application to existing problems or processes
‚Ä¢ Coordinates with Planning Teams to ensure all issues are addressed holistically.
‚Ä¢ Applies engineering principles, practices, and theories as well as evaluating new emerging technologies that support grid modernization and clean energy goals.
‚Ä¢ Provides a detailed design review of internal or external technical documents.
‚Ä¢ Ensures compliance with codes, standards, and design, operation, and maintenance requirements.
‚Ä¢ Identifies potential areas of weakness with assigned work, and initiate corrective action.
‚Ä¢ Documents and shares work with others to strengthen the depth and breadth of skills within PSE's engineering workforce.
‚Ä¢ Communicates solutions to personnel possessing a wide variety of educational and employment backgrounds, including in public forums in both verbal and written forms.
‚Ä¢ Ensures that problem solutions are tailored to PSE's business environment.
‚Ä¢ Supports emergency response work as requested including immediate and extended restoration efforts driven by weather and other system failures.
‚Ä¢ May help in coordinating the work of junior engineers, engineering assistants, field technicians, and others who assist on specific projects. (This includes contractor/consultants).
‚Ä¢ Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Bachelor of Science degree in electrical, mechanical, civil or other appropriate engineering discipline.
‚Ä¢ Entry level to 3 years of experience in engineering design, preparation of specifications, technical field work, or system studies. Other prior non-engineering work experience may be considered for individuals at this level.

Desired Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated organization, documentation, prioritization, and project management skills.
‚Ä¢ Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Possession of or ability to acquire an EIT certificate.
‚Ä¢ Experience using an electrical analysis program such as LoadSEER, SynerGi, CYME, or other programs.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of engineering economics, analysis, and utility accounting practices.
‚Ä¢ Work or internship experience in utility engineering or related fields.

Additional Information

Families and businesses depend on PSE to provide the energy they need to pursue their dreams. Our steadfast commitment to serving Washington communities with safe, dependable and efficient energy started in 1873. Today were building the Northwests energy future through efforts like our award winning energy efficiency programs and our leadership in renewable energy.

At PSE we value and respect our employees and provide them opportunities to excel. We offer an expansive pay package that includes competitive compensation, annual goals-based incentive bonuses, comprehensive benefits, 401(K), a company paid retirement pension plan, and an employee assistance and wellness program.

Puget Sound Energy is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, veteran status or presence of a disability that with or without reasonable accommodation does not prevent performance of the essential functions of the job, or any other category prohibited by local, state or federal law

title: Project Engineer
description:
Project Engineer / Data Center Construction Division - Quincy Washington

As one of the nation‚Äôs largest specialty contractors focused on electrical construction projects, what we do is important, but how we do it is what makes us special or unique. For more than 65 years, Cupertino Electric has built the infrastructure that allows forward-looking companies to realize their vision. We deliver... commercial, energy, and data center projects fast and without compromise. Our values of People, Integrity, Excellence, Innovation, and Safety are reflected in how we treat one other, interact with customers, and approach problems. In addition to building great projects, we believe in building great communities as evidenced by our generous giving and volunteer programs.

Every time you log onto a website, access a social media platform, or even follow your phone‚Äôs map function, you are accessing information stored in a data center. When customers need innovative ideas, and cannot afford to fail, they rely on CEI.‚ÄØ‚ÄØWe are at the forefront of data center construction and have designed, installed, and commissioned more than 11.5 million square feet of data center space since the 1990s. Our track record of designing reliable, cost-effective, efficient data centers has made us the preferred contractor among high-profile customers time after time.‚ÄØDo you want to help build these critical facilities?

Position Summary:‚ÄØ
We are offering this exciting opportunity to join our Data Center Division, as a Project Engineer working on complex "mission-critical" construction projects. This could lead to opportunities across the country on other major projects, if appropriate. As a project engineer, you will work closely with the project managers, superintendent, and general foreman, and report directly to the Senior Project Manager.

Essential Functions:
‚Ä¢ Tracking information including material, labor hours, field work tags, and more
‚Ä¢ Estimating change orders
‚Ä¢ Expediting: obtaining and channeling information
‚Ä¢ Ordering: equipment & materials
‚Ä¢ Coordinating work order scheduling and routing
‚Ä¢ Making pre-field visits to work locations to coordinate construction
‚Ä¢ Ensuring all Electricians in the field have the information and materials they need to construct a quality project for the customer
‚Ä¢ Establishing and maintaining good working relationships with the owner, general contractor, subcontractors, vendors, and other constituencies when appropriate

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 4-year degree in Construction Management or Engineering is preferred, relevant experience may substitute
‚Ä¢ 2 or more years of experience in project management specifically in the construction industry (Electrical Construction experience is highly desired)
‚Ä¢ Verifiable experience of safe, reliable, and integrity-driven work habits, including working in an unsupervised field setting when appropriate
‚Ä¢ Must be willing to travel both locally, and on rare occasions overnight
‚Ä¢ Experience with change orders and RFI's
‚Ä¢ Satisfactory driving record
‚Ä¢ Good working knowledge of MS Word and Excel, Accubid Pro experience preferred
‚Ä¢ Scheduling ability with Microsoft Projects and/or Primavera P6 experience is a big plus

title: Manufacturing Engineer, Model Based Digital Thread (Hybrid)
description:
Pratt & Whitney is working to once again transform the future of flight‚Äîdesigning, building and servicing engines unlike any the world has ever seen. And because transformation begins from within, we‚Äôre seeking the people to drive it. So, calling all curious.

In addition to transforming the future of flight, we are also transforming how and where we work. Pratt & Whitney is laser focused on... offering flexibility to our employees. We‚Äôve introduced role types (Onsite, Hybrid, or Remote) and now list them in the job posting title so candidates know where they will operate in our blended work environment.
‚Ä¢ Please consider the following role type definitions as you apply for this role.

Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance workers, as they are essential to the development of our engines.
Hybrid: Employees who are working in Hybrid roles will work regularly both onsite and offsite.
Remote: Employees who are working in Remote roles will work primarily offsite (from home).

Come ready to explore and you‚Äôll find a place where your talent takes flight‚Äîbeyond the borders of title, a country or your comfort zone. Bring your passion and commitment and we‚Äôll welcome you into a tightknit team that takes our mission personally. Channel your drive to make a difference into shaping an organization and an industry that‚Äôs evolving fast to the future.

Where the difference you make is on display every day. Just look up.

Are you ready to go beyond?
‚Ä¢ Note: Hybrid and remote roles at many of our sites are currently working from home because of COVID-19 protocols. Candidates will learn more about role type and current site status throughout the recruiting process.

In this role, you will have responsibility to drive implementation of Model Based Manufacturing and Inspection across Pratt & Whitney‚Äôs internal and external operations. Model Based-Design Manufacturing & Inspection (MB-DMI)is a company-wide initiative to augment 3D models with formats that enable automated consumption in manufacturing business processes such as: NC programming, Tool Design, Work Instruction authoring, Inspection Programming, First Article Inspection, Process Capability Analysis monitoring & reporting, Physics based modeling, Material Review Board (MRB) for discrepant material. This effort is focused on creating the digital thread that supports efficient automated re-use of data across all these processes for internal and external producers.

The successful candidate will have strong leadership, communication skills (both verbal and written), be self-motivated, persistent, and focus on results. They must be able to multi-task and be able to work through roadblocks, raising issues and identifying solutions to ensure tasks are driven to completion. These skills are essential for collaborating with all the organizations that comprise the MB-DMI team (Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality, Digital Technologies (DT), PW MRO, PWC, RTX, software developers, suppliers, etc.) and integrating the requirements for the Operations organization.

Key Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Support definition and implement of Model Based ‚Äì Design, Manufacturing & Inspection (MB-DMI) transformational project as it relates to interoperability, assess impact of digital thread into manufacturing, drive identification and closure of risk mitigation steps where maturity gaps are identified.
‚Ä¢ Generate and execute day to day MB-DMI objectives providing major impact to the organizations
‚Ä¢ Develop a strategy to execute to program milestones consistent with the MB-DMI Strategy.
‚Ä¢ Assure collaboration and alignment across disciplines and functional organizations to ensure technical development of Digital Thread connectivity.
‚Ä¢ Support with providing technical solutions for Engineering Design, Manufacturing Engineering, Suppliers and Quality to align with the MB-DMI Vision and Strategy.
‚Ä¢ Be able to efficiently communicate and influence difficult and complex objectives within and outside of the organization
‚Ä¢ Ability to define, generate and document requirements for part geometry of 3D models.
‚Ä¢ Development of methods/Work Instruction, Bill of Process (BOP) & standard work for in process 3D geometry to support deployment across the enterprise.
‚Ä¢ Provide Training and support to internal/external teams on MB-DMI tools and standard procedures
‚Ä¢ Develop metrics to monitor and report on health of transformation progress at all levels of the process
‚Ä¢ Work/support design to produce in process models
‚Ä¢ Work with internal mod center and external ME to developed process flow maps

Basic Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ BS Engineering (technical degree and relevant experience considered)
‚Ä¢ 7+ years of experience (Manufacturing Engineering, Ops, Engineering Design, Supply Chain, Project Mgmt, Quality or equivalent)
‚Ä¢ US Citizenship required due to government contracts

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ 7+ years Design experience in CAD and/or Production Lifecycle Management (PLM/TeamCenter) software packages
‚Ä¢ Technical proficiency in Complex Manufacturing activities.
‚Ä¢ Excellent priority management skills.
‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of MS office computer software including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
‚Ä¢ Ability to effectively communicate (verbal and written), work and relate with people at all levels of the organization and be self-sufficient.
‚Ä¢ Ability to influence cross functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
‚Ä¢ NC programming experience, PLM, CAM, NX, TeamCenter, Solumina G7, SAP and related systems.

Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class

And we know that success requires head, heart, AND guts ‚Äî all three, every day ‚Äî coming together to work simpler, faster, bolder, and more inclusively... Interested? Your role at Clorox:

Plans and leads small to medium sized projects. Provides thorough and practical solutions to complex problems with minimal assistance. Works under general management and completed work is checked for technical soundness and accuracy. Contacts are usually intra-organizational and more frequently with outside suppliers and consultants

In this role, you will:

What we look for:

‚Ä¢ Analytical & decision-making skills that integrate technical and business factors

We seek out and celebrate diverse backgrounds and experiences, and we know you don‚Äôt need a degree to succeed. We‚Äôre looking for fresh perspectives, a desire to bring your best, and a non-stop drive to keep growing and learning.

title: Sales Engineer
description:
Company Overview:

If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you‚Äôre searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve‚Äôs position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and... industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!

Role Summary:

Flowserve is looking for a hands-on, experienced Sales Engineer to sell centrifugal pumps and mechanical seals and services to existing and new customers in the chemical, refining and petrochemical industries in the Corpus Christi area. Flowserve‚Äôs reputation as a global leader for design, quality, and service will support the Sales Engineer to demonstrate a value proposition and establish long-term business relationships. The Sales Engineer will create a lasting competitive advantage for Flowserve by understanding our products and their applications in our customers‚Äô operations. The Sales Engineer will be forward-thinking by identifying opportunities, developing marketing plans, and achieving increased sales over time. The position has a salary base, with sales incentives. A company car is included in a comprehensive benefits package. The position is located in Corpus Christi Texas .

Flowserve Corporation is a multinational company, and one of the largest suppliers of industrial and environmental machinery such as pumps, valves, end face mechanical seals, automation, and services to the power, oil, gas, chemical and other industries.

Flowserve offers competitive pay, annual bonuses, medical benefits on day 1, generous paid vacation time, paid holidays, pension plan, 401(k) and many other excellent benefits.

Responsibilities & Requirements: Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Maintain regular, planned communication with key customers in the territory. Make direct, in-person sales calls. Respond quickly and thoroughly to customers‚Äô inquiries.
‚Ä¢ Achieve sales objectives, including bookings and growth.
‚Ä¢ Develop and implement marketing plans aligned with regional sales objectives to support larger organizational goals. Prepare quarterly updates on progress to yearly objectives.
‚Ä¢ Stay engaged and informed about customers‚Äô key projects. Demonstrate an understanding of the needs and wants of the customer and Flowserve so as to establish win-win relationships that support negotiations.
‚Ä¢ Provide value to customers with industry intelligence, financial understanding, technical expertise and a deep knowledge our Flowserve‚Äôs products and services. Proactively engage with customers in discussions to resolve their technical challenges.
‚Ä¢ Inform customers about the quality and features of our products, and our Life Cycle Advantage program, through the full use of the company‚Äôs marketing materials. Train customers in the features and uses of our products.
‚Ä¢ Utilize knowledge of competitors‚Äô strengths and weaknesses to leverage the value of Flowserve‚Äôs products and services.
‚Ä¢ Maintain organized records. Prepare regular reports as required regarding customer contacts, quotes, status, actuals, expenses, etc.
‚Ä¢ Have a Customer First attitude that permeates the organization. Be the advocate for the customer within Flowserve, collaborating with application engineers, customer service, and manufacturing to ensure that we are meeting the customers‚Äô needs, resolving corrective actions, and fulfilling our commitments in our Life Cycle Advantage agreements.
‚Ä¢ Convey a sense of contagious passion for Flowserve and our products, and inspire confidence in the vision and strategic direction of the company.

Requirements
‚Ä¢ BS in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent technical degree or extensive experience required.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the design and operational requirements of rotating pumps, mechanical seals, and related equipment required.
‚Ä¢ Must communicate with positive impact. Project a strong customer focus. Must be skilled at product demonstrations, presentations, and business writing.
‚Ä¢ Must be computer savvy by using available technologies to manage daily activities. Strong Microsoft Office skills needed including the ability to manipulate complex Excel spreadsheets, word processing, and presentation softwares
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated financial acumen to discuss business decisions, especially return on investment in support of solution selling
‚Ä¢ Experience solving problems in a group setting, and able to resolve conflict proactively and collaboratively. Able to lead a root cause failure analysis and communicate results.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated skills in leading meetings, including setting agendas, preparing, facilitating discussions, and assigning follow-up activities.
‚Ä¢ Track record of success as a flexible multi-tasker with good follow-through to meet urgent deadlines with little or no supervision.
‚Ä¢ Active driver‚Äôs license with good driving record.
‚Ä¢ Some physical activity required (e.g., walking large customer sites, lifting up to 50 lbs, and ascending/descending ladders and staircases in multi-story facilities).

Preferred Experience / Skills:
‚Ä¢ Industrial sales experience with a track record of self-initiated, sustained sales success highly desired.
‚Ä¢ Training in sales techniques, negotiations, and business finance preferred.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
About Us
All across the world, from the azure pools of Turkey and Oman to the travertine terraces of Yellowstone, our planet quietly pulls carbon dioxide from the air and turns it to stone. For eons, Earth has relied on this process to balance its carbon cycle. What if it could be harnessed? What if we could do it faster, in larger quantities, and at a low enough cost to make it an effective tool in the fight against climate change?

At Heirloom, we are turning that into reality. We use the natural carbon capture properties of abundant minerals to pull CO2 from the air, and store it permanently underground. We come to work every day to slow climate change, and are united behind a single, common goal - to remove 1 billion tons of CO2 from the sky by 2035, and to not stop before we get there.

We bring together the precise recipe of science, technology, know-how, and strategy necessary to make low cost, high quality carbon removal a reality. If we‚Äôre successful, we will directly... mitigate climate change, build a world we can proudly hand over to our children and grandchildren, and catalyze an industry that will rival the largest the world has ever seen. If you want to change the planet, come join us.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
Heirloom is committed to diversity and building an equitable and inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and experiences. We believe wholeheartedly that building a diverse company is critical to Heirloom‚Äôs success. We especially encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women, people of color, LGBTQ+ people, veterans, and people with disabilities.

At Heirloom, we are building out a team of engineers to remove 1 billion tons of carbon dioxide by 2035. In this role, you will work closely with a cross functional team to define and design the manufacturing system that builds the world's most cost-effective direct air capture system using natural processes combined with industrial automation. We are looking for someone who has experience in and is excited about the task of defining our manufacturing process and integrating the equipment needed.

The Role
At Heirloom, we are building out a team of engineers to remove 1 billion tons of carbon dioxide by 2035. In this role, you will work closely with a cross functional team to define and design the manufacturing system that builds the world's most cost-effective direct air capture system using natural processes combined with industrial automation. We are looking for someone who has experience in and is excited about the task of defining our manufacturing process and integrating the equipment needed.

Please note: while we appreciate all applicants, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted by our team

title: Hardware Engineer, Board Design
description:
Job Description

Arista Networks is a fast-growing company and an industry leader in the ethernet switch industry. Our switch systems have touched every corner of the market - from the data centers of the world‚Äôs largest cloud-computing companies, to your local university‚Äôs server room, and every application in between. We design virtually all of the hardware and software that goes into our... products and it‚Äôs a badge we wear proudly. This wouldn‚Äôt be possible without the likes of talented engineers who are given the opportunity to fully lead their own projects and the freedom to think outside the box. Whether you are an intern, a junior engineer or someone who‚Äôs been around the block, one thing is for certain - you will leave your mark. We are looking for experienced, motivated full-time hardware engineers to join us in creating industry-leading Cloud Networking Ethernet switches at our headquarters in Santa Clara, CA.

Responsibilities:

Candidates for this position would be responsible for the entire hardware design process:
‚Ä¢ Authoring Functional Specifications
‚Ä¢ Selecting and Qualifying Components
‚Ä¢ Schematic Capture
‚Ä¢ Working closely with PCB Layout (CAD)
‚Ä¢ Overseeing and specifying PCB fabrication
‚Ä¢ Working closely with Contract Manufacturer (CM) during all builds, from proto through production
‚Ä¢ Lab bring up and debug
‚Ä¢ Qualifying Components
‚Ä¢ Training CM for high yield test and manufacturing

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ BSEE
‚Ä¢ 3 to 10 years of relevant experience
‚Ä¢ Experience designing Networking Hardware, particularly Ethernet switching
‚Ä¢ Embedded x86/ARM system design is highly desirable
‚Ä¢ High layer count boards
‚Ä¢ Gigabit+ signaling experience
‚Ä¢ High speed (>150MHz) parallel buses, SDR and DDR
‚Ä¢ 802.3 IEEE compliance
‚Ä¢ Writing specifications and drawing schematics for high complexity boards
‚Ä¢ Working closely with CAD designers on complicated layout and routing
‚Ä¢ Working closely with Software engineers for bringup and debug
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with signal integrity and power integrity concepts such as impedance, differential routing, insertion loss, board stackups
‚Ä¢ Experience designing for Manufacturability
‚Ä¢ FPGA design using Verilog
‚Ä¢ System simulation using Verilog
‚Ä¢ Working with Contract Manufacturers
‚Ä¢ Successfully taking products from concept to production

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Where legally permitted, Arista requires all candidates for U.S.-based positions to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or have an approved accommodation under applicable law. Candidates anticipating seeking an exemption should contact Arista HR before their start date. Candidates accepting an offer must provide proof of vaccination status on their first day. All offers of employment are contingent upon complying with Arista's vaccination policy

title: Software Engineer
description:
At Donut we are on a mission to create more trusting, collaborative, and successful work relationships. We believe genuine relationships are the key to being engaged, happy, and successful at work.

Donut came together over a shared passion to help people connect, and the insight that strong relationships at work are the bedrock of a successful team. Employees who feel socially connected to their... coworkers express greater individual purpose and fulfillment, less workplace loneliness and isolation, and improved performance and productivity. We are building a company that embodies those ideals while instilling them in others.

How we work:
Currently, our small, but scrappy remote engineering team consists of empathetic and caring individuals dedicated to unlocking the power of human connection. We build new features together in two week sprints. Everyone writes code, reviews pull requests, and participates in our engineering support shift rotation. Our core connection hours are 11am - 5pm ET.

About the role:
We are looking for a Software Engineer to join us during this exciting time of growth and expansion. As part of a small team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to have an outsized impact on the success of our company through helping to shape our culture while building products that touch thousands of companies around the world.
What You‚Äôll Do

‚Ä¢ Develop high impact product features end to end
‚Ä¢ Make significant contributions to every aspect of the product and business
‚Ä¢ Solve technical problems in collaboration with other engineers on the team
‚Ä¢ Contribute to an inclusive culture
‚Ä¢ Inspire learning and continuous improvement

About You

‚Ä¢ Experienced Software Engineer. You have several years of experience building web applications with a strong preference for collaborative, learning environments.
‚Ä¢ Strong Full-stack Skill Set. You are proficient in Ruby and Ruby on Rails (or similar languages like Python or Go), either Vue or React frameworks, and have a familiarity with Heroku, AWS, or other cloud service providers.
‚Ä¢ Self-sufficient. You are capable of leading, managing, and delivering projects with minimal guidance.
‚Ä¢ Highly Organized. You thrive on bringing order to the software development process.
‚Ä¢ User-centered. You take the time to listen to and empathize with users‚Äô needs.
‚Ä¢ Product and Design Oriented. You are passionate about building delightful products and experiences.

Our hiring process:
We‚Äôre a small team so it may take us a little more time to review your application. Thank you for your patience and understanding!

If we like your resume and application, our interview process consists of practical technical interviews relating to day-to-day tasks, a take home code challenge, a product related interview, and finally a conversation with the CEO. Along the way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to ask various team members questions about working at Donut.

The salary range for this role is $110,000-$160,000 annually.

Benefits (full-time US employees)
- Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits
- 401(k) with company match
- Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion program
- Unlimited paid time off and 10 company holidays
- Paid family leave
- Monitor stipend
- Home office stipend
- Mental health benefit

About Donut
Donut has made millions of connections and is used by over 20,000 companies. Donut has raised $12M in venture-funding from investors including Accel, Bloomberg Beta, FirstMark, and Slack Fund: https://techcrunch.com/2020/10/29/donut-watercooler/

Donut is an equal-opportunity employer and we value diversity, equity, and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

title: Lead USV Engineer
description:
Position Description

If you love high profile and challenging projects support the US Navy - Serco has a great opportunity for you! Serco is looking for a highly motivated individual with a technical/engineering background to join our Maritime Engineering, Technology and Sustainment (METS) team as a Lead Engineer supporting Naval Sea Systems Command at Naval Base Ventura County Port Hueneme... CA.

This position is contingent upon your ability to maintain your active Secret level DoD clearance.

The ideal candidate will assist in the development of the Autonomous Maritime System (AMS) schedules and work priorities. Plans, implements, and tracks the progress of Unmanned Surface Vessel (USV) program. Perform with limited supervision/direction and regularly exercise discretionary and decision-making authority.

You will have the opportunity to shape software development pipelines on a Unmanned Surface Vessel (USV) program onsiteNaval Base Ventura County Port Hueneme Ca. The Lead Engineer will be responsible for engineering plans; technology maturation strategies; mission analyses; systems engineering and integration reviews; technical risk mitigation; joint requirements development; and inform acquisition milestones and modernization decisions. You will work with a team of technicians, and engineers supporting RDT&E projects conducting test to including electrical, mechanical and software engineering, for system development, man and machine interface development, test and evaluation, requirements capture, production, maintenance, and system support.

You will be part of a team responsible for highly consequential engagements with stakeholders impacting national security and the defense capabilities of the United States. You will work closely with customers and other Serco teams to deliver quality solutions recognized by DoD and industry as outstanding contributions in engineering program and risk management across the Defense enterprise.

In this role, you will:
‚Ä¢ Developing System Engineering plans for integration and R&D. Provide USV, autonomous systems, and Maritime Subject Matter
‚Ä¢ Expertise for R&D and OT&E.
‚Ä¢ Analyze unmanned vehicle (USV) system designs, specifications, and technical data to determine whether various systems are ready for developmental/operational testing.
‚Ä¢ Analyze results from USV systems and capabilities under test/evaluation to ensure performance successfully meets engineering specifications and operational requirements.
‚Ä¢ Investigate system failures, evaluate corrective alternatives and implement actions to ensure USV systems maintain safe, effective operations and minimize/eliminate potential future system failures.
‚Ä¢ Develop technical/logistics documentation in support of USV operations, training and sustainment, including user manuals, training guides and system maintenance manuals.
‚Ä¢ Develop concept of operations (CONOPS) and standard operating procedures (SOP) documentation for USV operations, tactics, doctrine and vehicle deployment

Qualifications

To be successful in this role, you will have:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree in a relevant Engineering disciplate with a minimum of 5 years of System Engineering experience.
‚Ä¢ An active Secret clearance is required prior to employment.
‚Ä¢ 10+ years of relevant experience supporting DoD/USCG programs
‚Ä¢ Substantial experience providing technical leadership and technical management of engineering personnel
‚Ä¢ Experience with Ship and Ship Systems in-service engineering activities
‚Ä¢ Experience with Control Systems and Autonomy
‚Ä¢ Experience working with DoD/USCG technical communities.

Additional desired experience and skills:
‚Ä¢ Experience working with U. S. Navy Ocean Systems engineering and safety procedures
‚Ä¢ Experience and working knowledge of U. S. Navy Weapon Systems, including compliance standards and applicable regulations
‚Ä¢ Unmanned Systems operational knowledge
‚Ä¢ Knowledge and experience following Systems Engineering standards, procedures, and best practices
‚Ä¢ Ability to work effectively in both independent and team environments
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate, both orally and in writing, and at all levels of sponsor/customer/corporate organizations
‚Ä¢ Knowledge and experience using Microso»Ö Office products, such as MSWord, Excel and PowerPoint.
‚Ä¢ Active TS/SCI clearance or eligibility

Company Overview

Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has over 9,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).

To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco.

If you require an accommodation with the application process please email: careers@serco-na.com or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.

Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email Agencies@serco-na.com.

COVID-19 Regulations: Serco complies with all applicable COVID-19 requirements. This may require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, provide attestations regarding vaccination status and/or COVID-19 testing, or satisfy other conditions of employment that Serco deems appropriate, and employees may be required to show proof of vaccination and/or negative COVID-19 test results as a condition of employment (except in limited circumstances where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation

description:

This posting is for a Nuclear Safety Analysis Engineer...

Seeking a Nuclear Safety Analysis Engineer with capability and expertise in one or more of the following areas: Fluid Flow, Heat Transfer, Radiological Dose Analysis, Thermodynamics, Thermal/hydraulic modeling and analysis, Nuclear Engineering, Physics, High Energy Line Break (HELB) Pressure & Temperature analysis.

Duties include:
‚Ä¢ Interfacing with various other groups to collaborate with cross-discipline teams to resolve identified areas for modification and/or improvement.
‚Ä¢ Cross-training among the other groups within the Nuclear Engineering Department is desirable; such as supporting Reactor Engineering and Operations during fuel unload, shuffle, leak detection, reload and startup physics testing. Also cross-training to support Probabilistic Risk Assessment activities. POSITION SUMMRAY

Responsible to the assigned supervisor for performing intermediate level engineering work activities and projects requiring the application of engineering knowledge in a safe, effective, efficient and economic accomplishment of assigned objectives.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
‚Ä¢ Technical Expertise: Possesses intermediate level knowledge and performs varied assignments with proficiency in the application of theory and analytical techniques to solve diverse problems and complete extensive analysis. Demonstrates competency in analytical techniques necessary to handle assignments of moderate complexity. (e.g., by dividing the problem into component steps, and performing the analysis necessary to complete each step). Exhibits ability to understand interrelationship between systems and component equipment. Demonstrate ability to analyze and recommend enhancements to business processes.
‚Ä¢ Leadership & Guidance: Coordinates work activities of others within the work group, department, or other corporate entity as necessary to complete routine activities. Performs routine engineering activity with minimum direction from higher-level employees. Follows policies, practices, standards and rules of the company and those regulations and procedures required by external agencies. Provides training and guidance to lower-level employees.
‚Ä¢ Planning & Organization Ability: Coordinates the development of input necessary to forecast costs for the routine projects, improvements requisitions, etc. Uses scheduling techniques (CPM, PERT, flow charts, etc.) for budget and planning activities. Initiates corrective action when project objectives are not being met.
‚Ä¢ Problem Solving & Initiative: Resolves and initiates solutions to routine problems which usually require additional definition/clarification before analysis can begin. Demonstrates ability to identify problems that are beyond the normal routine. Demonstrates ability and desire to seek out opportunities and embrace new ideas and approaches.
‚Ä¢ Communication: Develops, reviews, or presents technical reports such as improvement requisitions, studies, and analyses in as clear, concise and effective fashion.
‚Ä¢ Interpersonal Skills: Is an active team member. Networks with peers inside and outside the AEP system. Identifies key stakeholders. Uses informal network to get things done. Resolves conflict, builds consensus.
‚Ä¢ Decision Making: Makes decisions subject to review within established policies and procedures. Makes decisions that affect the work of the team. Aware of risks. Demonstrates the ability to extrapolate beyond known facts to reach logical conclusions.
‚Ä¢ Business Awareness & Characteristics: Understands AEP's organizational structure and the specific role and responsibility of their individual organizational unit. Demonstrates an understanding of the budgeting and approval process. Is proficient in the application and use of economic analysis techniques in problem solving. Develops an understanding of utility regulation and financing#LI-HYBRID

title: Security Automation Engineer -Architect
description:
Overview

Security Automation Engineer / Architect...

Who we are:

The Detection Team at BNY Mellon develops and maintains the signals, tools, and infrastructure required to perform deep analysis of threats on our corporate environment. This role will be responsible for identifying and constantly evolving techniques to detect sophisticated attacks. As part of this team, you will be building advanced and novel detection mechanisms for attacker techniques tactics and procedures, developing systems to automate remediation, conducting threat hunting, and performing network and systems forensics, as well as malware and indicator ae Analysis.

BNY Mellon, cybersecurity is a top priority for both technology and the business. The members of the Information Security Division are on constant alert, using their creativity and knowledge of cybersecurity, technology and business processes to develop and deliver creative solutions. In this fast-paced environment, staff collaborate to respond to current risks, while identifying and anticipating future threats. Our cyber capabilities encompass the full spectrum of services from Cyber Operations (SOC, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Management, Cyber Incident Response, Penetration Testing & Red Teaming, Cyber Analytics & Fraud, and Insider threat) to Cyber Architecture and Engineering (Network, Platform, Cloud, and Applications Security). Together with the CISO and his leadership team, staff provide a robust set of cyber services that provide full scope protection and response capabilities across the BNY Mellon enterprise. We help our businesses, the bank's executive team, and our board of directors understand cybersecurity risk and the steps that must be taken to create and maintain a secure environment that drives innovation.

What you will be doing:

As a security automation engineer / architect, you will be responsible to partner with our DevOps teams to design, test and build detective, responsive and preventative controls to ensure a secure coding platform.
‚Ä¢ Propose, develop, implement and maintain automation of security controls to support DevSecOps methodologies.
‚Ä¢ Provision, deploy and maintain security tools in collaboration with the application development teams.
‚Ä¢ Research current trends in DevOps tools in order to design best in class DevSecOps. Orchestrate multiple Proof of Concept initiatives to insure the AppSec team remains on the cutting edge of vulnerability prevention, detection and remediation.
‚Ä¢ Design, deploy, administer, monitor, and enhance the Application Security DevOps Framework.
‚Ä¢ Act as an authority on your domain expertise; combining expert-level proficiency with the ability to communicate clearly and collaborate to turn broad requirements into deliverable work items
‚Ä¢ Diagnose and resolve issues while identifying recurring problems or processes that can be remediated through automation
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot system functional and operational issues as well as maintain the system operations at all times
‚Ä¢ Produce, maintain and update knowledge base documentation, runbooks, and SOPs
‚Ä¢ Identify and take advantage of opportunities to train and mentor various members of the Application Security team.
‚Ä¢ Perform and provide progress on project deliverables, tasks, and milestones, as well as provide project documentation such as, architecture diagrams, and runbooks
‚Ä¢ Act as a primary point of contact for system outages and escalations
‚Ä¢ Work directly with business stakeholders, technical staff, and project teams to identify, analyze, design, test, and implement new systems or improvements to existing systems and associated procedures
‚Ä¢ Review system and software releases for new functionality and test to optimize existing systems, processes, and integrations accordingly
‚Ä¢ Take initiative to develop unique projects in which you get to research new technology, solve more complex problems, perform POCs
‚Ä¢ Work with leadership to gather ROI and complete whitepapers to justify purchase approval
‚Ä¢ Work with team members to schedule and report upon the execution of testing and validation efforts as part of a formal release ITIL Change Management process
‚Ä¢ Represent team recommendations to leadership, demonstrate influence over governance bodies, and coach on communicating technical issues, impact, and risk mitigation strategies in business terminology that non-technical resources can understand
‚Ä¢ Build strong relationships and influence with vendors, business and technology leaders
‚Ä¢ Keep ahead of emerging trends, understand business area opportunities and challenges, process or system impacts to all related business or systems areas when designing recommended solutions to achieve business objectives
‚Ä¢ Perform other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ A minimum of 8 years' experience in IT
‚Ä¢ 5 years being responsible for application development of DevOps platforms or similar Enterprise wide services utilizing Python and or Java.
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of computing and network concepts and troubleshooting skills.
‚Ä¢ The utmost passion for technology and a thirst for knowledge and growth
‚Ä¢ Ability to work well within a team; good interpersonal relational and collaboration skills
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of downstream integrations to gauge the impact of changes, triage and remedy incidents, and scope level of effort for new initiatives
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of virtualization technologies
‚Ä¢ Have hands-on experience in grooming/mentoring individuals and being the bar raiser in the team
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated attention to detail with the ability to design and develop solutions to meet business needs creatively
‚Ä¢ Customer Service focused approach to interactions with business partners and employee user community
‚Ä¢ Strong organizational and time management skills
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated success in a fast-paced, high-performance, and deadline-driven engineering team
‚Ä¢ Ability to handle escalations and friendly resolution of the most complex hardware and software problems
‚Ä¢ Ability to learn quickly and use new complex technical concepts and resolve issues in a rapidly changing environment
‚Ä¢ Ability to discuss complex technical concepts with technical staff, stakeholders, and business executives in a simple, straightforward manner
‚Ä¢ Familiar with current security protection, encryption, monitoring/auditing, and remediation techniques with the proven ability to oversee solutions for the network, servers, databases, and the desktop
‚Ä¢ Familiar with disaster recovery, business continuity, and high availability concepts
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems and administrative functions (Ops Support)
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of SDLC or CI/CD pipeline tools such as GitHub, Jenkins, Sonarqube, Selenium, Docker, Chef, Puppet, JIRA, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with technologies such as Ansible, Stackstorm, Terraform, GitLab, Docker, VMWare
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of secure code testing tools using static code analysis, dynamic analysis and Interactive Application Security Testing.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently to assess and address system issues
‚Ä¢ Experience managing 3rd party hardware and software vendors and providers
Preferred Skills:
‚Ä¢ Application security experience
‚Ä¢ CCSP and/or CSSLP certification
‚Ä¢ Experience working on an Agile team
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of security frameworks such as NIST and ISO 27000

For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. title: Sr. Full Stack Software Engineer
description:

title: Senior Software Engineer - Advanced Projects
description:
Mission Summary

Motional‚Äôs CORE team is responsible for our vehicle‚Äôs Compute and Onboard Runtime Environment. We are creating a world class AI compute platform for autonomous vehicles. This is the system that executes the software and neural networks that make our vehicles autonomous. If you love the idea of working with software development, machine learning, and running software, data, and... neural networks on the most powerful embedded AI hardware and software systems, we would love to talk with you.

The Advanced Projects team is part of CORE. We work at the intersection of software engineering, machine learning, and compute platforms. Our mission is to guide Motional‚Äôs product and engineering decision-making. If we are successful, we provide a map of the territory that de-risks engineering projects across Motional, contributing to a technology roadmap that helps ensure Motional remains at the forefront of AV development. We influence future platform design choices through developing working prototypes and proofs-of-concept informed by researching the latest advances in software engineering, machine learning, and compute platforms.

The Motional Santa Monica office is located in the heart of 3rd Street Promenade in Santa Monica at 1453 3rd Street. With all the modern amenities for productive work and play, it is steps away from the popular pedestrian outdoor shopping area and Santa Monica beach.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Our engineers play a key role in making the vehicle of the future a reality by developing technologies that deliver a fully autonomous driving system for our customers. As a software engineer in the CORE Advanced Projects team, you will influence what technologies we need to use, and how best to use them, to achieve our goal of creating a fully-autonomous vehicle. You will work with small, cross-functional teams of engineers and researchers to explore and shape the future of autonomous vehicle (AV) development.

Specifically, you will:
‚Ä¢ Design, implement, test, integrate, migrate platform software on a variety of AI compute architectures.
‚Ä¢ Participate in shaping our future frameworks and APIs that provide access to sensors, mapping data, health monitoring, configuration management, and other vehicle platform subsystems.
‚Ä¢ Conduct code and design reviews for work done by peers, and advising peers and management on technical matters.
‚Ä¢ Use your expertise and experience to define the future of our on-vehicle software execution environment.
‚Ä¢ Lead designs and work together with specialized autonomy teams to determine the needs of the system and how to best meet those needs with a robust infrastructure.
‚Ä¢ Work with the team to drive implementation of these designs and incorporate feedback from the teams leveraging your designs.

What We‚Äôre Looking For
‚Ä¢ You are a generalist software engineer, curious and passionate about a wide range of technology topics including, but not limited to, software development, systems, neural networks, microarchitectures, compilers, middleware, operating systems, sensors, and security.
‚Ä¢ You have experience with at least one major programming language, e.g., one or more of C++, C, Python, Rust, Java, Go, Python (or similar languages) and associated software ecosystems. The primary languages we use are C++ and Python in a Unix/Linux environment.
‚Ä¢ You bring a solid foundation in modern software engineering principles and practices including software design, patterns, source control management, build processes, continuous integration, code reviews, testing methods.
‚Ä¢ You are comfortable reading source code from different sources. You are comfortable with exploring and experimenting with different technology stacks.
‚Ä¢ You have a passion for self-driving technology and its potential impact on the world.
‚Ä¢ You are comfortable identifying R&D opportunities, justifying R&D goals, and executing towards those goals.
‚Ä¢ You are comfortable with experimenting and evaluating different options as we work towards finding solutions that work.
‚Ä¢ You have a BS in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical or Electronics Engineering, or similar technical field of study, or you have equivalent knowledge gained through your practical experience.

Bonus Points (not required)
‚Ä¢ A demonstrated ability to develop proofs-of-concept and ship technology products using a variety of technology stacks.
‚Ä¢ Experience with distributed systems development, middleware development, and related technologies and frameworks.
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a MLOps or DevOps environment.
‚Ä¢ Experience with developing software for ARM platforms, including embedded software.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with technologies relevant to Motional‚Äôs industry and business context, e.g., autonomous vehicles, advanced driver-assistance systems, robotics.
‚Ä¢ Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch and/or other Machine Learning frameworks.
‚Ä¢ Experience with developing software for different computing architectures such as FPGAs, GPUs, NPUs, MCUs, SoCs and their associated hardware computing platforms.
‚Ä¢ Experience with a variety of networking and communication technologies and protocols

In today‚Äôs new remote-first, ever-changing regulatory environment, our secure, privacy-first enterprise platform, accessible via web portal or API, provides a highly scalable and configurable solution to manage communications, storage, decisioning, and ongoing monitoring of individual and business credentials.

Evident is a remote-first, VC-backed tech startup, headquartered in Atlanta, GA. Learn more at evidentid.com.

As a customer centric organization our goal is to deliver a world-class customer experience at each stage of the customer journey to increase customer satisfaction, loyalty and retention. Accountability in this role is focused on the successful resolutions with our customers. This position serves as the customers‚Äô technical point of contact for Evident‚Äôs platform and works to address multiple issues simultaneously.

Why Evident?

description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. ‚Ä¢ Experience using Enterprise Modeling Tools and SysML (Cameo, Rhapsody

title: Senior Mining Engineer
description:
Overview

Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS) manages and operates the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS) for the U.S. National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA). Our MISSION is to help ensure the security of the United States and its allies by providing high-hazard experimentation and incident response capabilities through operations, engineering, education, field, and... integration services and by acting as environmental stewards to the Site‚Äôs Cold War legacy. Our VISION is to be the user site of choice for large-scale, high-hazard, national security experimentation, with premier facilities and capabilities below ground, on the ground, and in the air. (See NNSS.gov for our unique capabilities.) Our 2,750+ professional, craft, and support employees are called upon to innovate, collaborate, and deliver on some of the more difficult nuclear security challenges facing the world today. In this environment, the best ideas need to be voiced and every opinion matters. As such, MSTS places great value on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion and is committed to a diverse and equitable workforce, with an inclusive culture that values and celebrates the diversity of our people, talents, ideas, and perspectives.
‚Ä¢ MSTS offers our full-time employees highly competitive salaries and benefits packages including medical, dental, and vision; both a pension and a 401k; paid time off and 96 hours of paid holidays; relocation (if located more than 75 miles from work location); tuition assistance and reimbursement; and more.
‚Ä¢ MSTS is a limited liability company consisting of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs), and HII Nuclear Inc.

NNSS COVID-19 attestation requirements: https://www.nnss.gov/pages/nfo/WorkingForMSTS.html

Responsibilities

Performs duties as a facility/system engineer (Senior Engineer) at the U1a Complex within the MSTS Stockpile Experimentation & Operations Directorate. The U1a Complex is located within the Forward Areas of the Nevada National Security Site and is an underground facility.

Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Responsible for maintaining overall cognizance of assigned facility systems, providing systems engineering support for operations and maintenance, and technical support of line management safety responsibilities for ensuring continued system operational readiness. Systems may include mine structures (tunnels, drifts, shafts and associated ground support), refuge stations, underground ventilation, hoists, mobile equipment (LHDs, roadheaders, drill jumbos, rockbolters), civil and structural systems.
‚Ä¢ Validates physical configuration of assigned systems. Maintains and updates system documents for Configuration Management. Understands the functions and performance criteria for assigned systems per the Safety Basis, and acts as the subject matter expert for assigned systems.
‚Ä¢ Conducts or oversees the In-service-Inspection and Technical Surveillance Requirement execution of assigned systems.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to solutions of assignment-related problems and issues with a moderate scope and of moderate complexity, using a well-defined set of technologies. Solutions use established basic standards, practices and procedures as well as technical knowledge to address problems and complete tasks. Solutions may require evaluation of standards and processes.
‚Ä¢ Participate in developing field programs and designs using pre-determined principles and practices.
‚Ä¢ Select and implement computer applications for their field.
‚Ä¢ Prepare or contribute to designs, strategies, reports and technical proposals.
‚Ä¢ Perform design and technical analysis activities using prescribed codes and standards, computer software (VentSim including underground fire scenarios), and generally accepted best management practices. Includes monitoring and analysis of ground conditions underground.
‚Ä¢ Responsible for ensuring mobile equipment is maintained in a high state of availability for use in mining, construction, and operations activities.
‚Ä¢ Structural and civil experience is preferred including steel structures and grouting, high-pressure grouting, and concrete applications, but not required.
‚Ä¢ Perform frequent coordination of discipline information with other departments within the company and with outside vendors.
‚Ä¢ Work with outside vendors as required, obtaining relevant information.
‚Ä¢ Develop a working knowledge of codes and standards of other disciplines.
‚Ä¢ Coordinate work within their discipline on moderately complex projects.
‚Ä¢ Often serves as a member of work teams.
‚Ä¢ Define specifications for procurements and initiates purchase requests.
‚Ä¢ Monitor work of skilled technicians and other support personnel.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an engineering program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) required for Civil, Mechanical and Electrical engineering degrees
‚Ä¢ Or, Calculus-based STEM bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering
‚Ä¢ Or Professional Engineer license
‚Ä¢ Plus at least 5 years‚Äô relevant experience. Skill building experience must demonstrate either deeper technical specialization or additional cross-disciplinary knowledge; graduate research experience may be recognized.
‚Ä¢ Ability to interpret codes and standards applicable to the position.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated desire to learn and innovate including the ability to learn and use computer modeling software if not already knowledgeable on using the software.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to follow instructions and procedures.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of tunnel/drift/shaft and ground support design, underground ventilation, mining applications, and mobile equipment components.
‚Ä¢ Should be self-motivated and able to complete assigned tasks with minimal supervision.
‚Ä¢ Ideally, the applicant will have strong time-management skills. Be well organized, maintain safe work habits and have a broad range of technical interests and education.
‚Ä¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to write reports and technical documents.
‚Ä¢ The primary work location will be at the Nevada National Security Site (located 65 miles northwest of Las Vegas, Nevada). The U1a Complex is located in the forward areas of the NNSS.
‚Ä¢ Work hours for this position will be 4/10‚Äôs, Monday ‚Äì Thursday (subject to change).
‚Ä¢ Pre-placement physical examination, which includes a drug screen, is required. MSTS maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.
‚Ä¢ Must possess a valid driver's license.

Department of Energy Q Clearance (position will be cleared to this level). title: Principal Optical Engineer
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the... moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman Corporation is offering a challenging and rewarding career as an Optical Engineer/Lens Designer within the Mission Systems Sector located at our Rolling Meadows, IL facility.

This position supports the design, development, build, and test validation of ruggedized optical products for military applications. The candidate will work within the Hardware Engineering organization. It is a high performing organization that values its employees and has a strong sense of purpose tied to the vision of Northrop Grumman: To be the most trusted provider of systems and technologies that ensure the security and the freedom of our nation and its allies. The candidate will be able to grow personally and professionally in an ethical and inclusive environment, while being an important part of a great team.

The engineer will be responsible for solving challenging problems through the development and application of optical technologies including passive and active infrared imaging, Laser illumination and marking/identification, fiber optic systems, and meta-optics. The engineer must have demonstrated expertise in optical design along with optical simulation analysis or opto-mechanical design and analysis. The optical engineer must have proficiency in one of the optical design/analysis tools. The engineer will serve on cross-functional teams, and interface frequently with related disciplines, including mechanical engineers and customers/stakeholders. Strong communication skills are required for success in all phases of the role.

The engineer will also contribute to overall knowledge base and skill level of the organization via coaching, knowledge transfer, and process improvement activities.

Basic Qualifications:
- Bachelor of Science degree in Optical Engineering, Optical Sciences, Opto-Mechanical Engineering, or related Engineering field with a concentration in Optics.
- Minimum of Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of experience, or Master's degree and 3+ years of experience, or Doctorate and 0+ years of experience.
- Demonstrated expertise in at least one of the following subjects: optical design, optical analysis, or opto-mechanical design and analysis.
- Proficiency in one of the optical design/analysis tools such as Zemax (preferred), Code V, OSLO, Trace Pro, FRED or equivalent.
- Demonstrated application of innovative solutions to complex problems.
- Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
- U. S. citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Master's or Doctorate degree in Optical Engineering, Optical Sciences, Opto-Mechanical Engineering, or related Engineering field with a concentration in Optics .
- Expertise in optical design of multi-element imaging systems.
- Familiarity with MWIR/LWIR optical materials.
- Expertise in the optical design/analysis tool, Zemax.
- Familiarity with opto-mechanical engineering.
- Experience presenting at design reviews and customer/stakeholder briefings.
- Experience reviewing technical work products of peers.
- Leadership in process improvement or knowledge transfer (ie publication) activities.
- Experience contributing to development and mentoring of junior engineers.
- Active U.S. Government security clearance.

Salary Range: $106,500 USD - $159,700 USD

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforcegov/contractors/.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions

Fast. Forward.

L3Harris employees are passionate about our customers and their mission. Our work supports civil service, transportation safety, advancing space access and national security. We are dedicated to driving product innovation because we know the critical role our customers have in the protection and defense of our freedoms worldwide. Be part of an innovative team creating tomorrows leading technology.

Job Description:

Experienced software engineer to support the sustainment and modernization of NOAA ground systems on an existing NOAA/NESDIS program. The project requires on-site support at a NOAA facility located in Suitland, MD. The position requires prior experience responding to break fixes to support operations. title: Staff Software Engineer, Platform
description:
Tapcart is the ultimate mobile commerce platform fueling the fastest growing brands. We power mobile apps for over 50 million consumers worldwide; processing over $3 billion in mobile commerce revenue.

A majority of Ecommerce traffic is on a mobile device now; we turn these users into high retention growth for some of the largest brands, including Fashion Nova, Pier 1, Chubbies, Brandy Melville... and many more.

Tapcart is trusted by thousands of brands to power their mobile experience. Check out our buzz on TechCrunch, Shopify UNITE and in The Verge.

This role is perfect for an ambitious Backend subject matter expert who strives to learn both Infrastructure and API Development.

Someone with a strong understanding of API design that spends most of their day organizing data and creating the most efficient schemas.

We are looking for someone who will work to deliver high-quality backend projects. Someone who will earn to work within the Google Cloud Platform and help build the future of the Tapcart platform.

As a Staff Software Engineer, you‚Äôll be an essential part of our product, growth, and management of a product millions of people use every day. You will work closely with our frontend, QA, and operations teams to build products that scale massively, deploy with ease, and engage millions of end-users.

You‚Äôll be researching and building world-class technology using Node.js, Go, GraphQL, Mongo DB, Cassandra and advanced analytics tools.

How you will make an impact
‚Ä¢ Lead efforts to design and implement various microservices and databases schemas for new features or refactoring existing ones
‚Ä¢ Take ownership of designing data models and supporting efficient queries/writes with our various database technologies (MongoDB, PostgresSQL, Cassandra)
‚Ä¢ Design and implement HTTP, gRPC and real-time APIs. Work with our partners webhooks and build queuing/pubsub systems to grow our backends scalability
‚Ä¢ Work with a fantastic team that loves to whiteboard and design for best efficiency and scalability

What skills you will need
‚Ä¢ 7+ years experience working either as backend developer working on HTTP APIs, gRPC or GraphQL APIs
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Node, Golang, Python, or Java
‚Ä¢ Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB) (required)
‚Ä¢ Experience with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgresSQL) (bonus)
‚Ä¢ 4+ years Experience working with Cloud Providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) (GCP preferred)
‚Ä¢ Experience with GraphQL or REST, both is ideal

Tapcart Perks & Benefits

¬∑ 401K and stock options for all full-time employees

¬∑ Medical eligible first of the month

¬∑ Dental and Vision eligible immediately

¬∑ Unlimited PTO and 11 paid company holidays

¬∑ Brand new MacBook Pro and home office setup

¬∑ $250 a month wellness stipend

¬∑ Monthly Happy Hours, Company-Wide Offsite Events

¬∑ A team that has transitioned to remote work impressively and remains highly collaborative, engaged, and connected.

¬∑ We pride ourselves on a team that promotes diversity, inclusion, leadership, mindfulness and passion.

Who is Tapcart!?

We are growing startup located in Santa Monica, CA üèñ. Our team and culture are very important to us ‚Äì we aim to make coming to work fun, challenging and rewarding. We know that doing great work depends on showing up with creative solutions to face our challenges. It all starts with having good people, and helping them grow both personally and professionally. We can't wait to hear how your unique skills and personality will add to our company and culture.

Why join us?

We are on a rocket ship and just raised our Series B for $50M in June 2021: https://tcrn.ch/3dn2RiV

We raised our Series A for $10M in May 2020: builtinla.com/2020/05/19/tapcart-raises-10m-series-a-hiring

Check out what our customers are saying: https://apps.shopify.com/shopify-mobile-apps/reviews

Our current openings: https://tapcart.com/careers

Learn more about who we are and what we offer on our Careers page.

Tapcart focuses on Mobile, E-Commerce, Mobile Commerce, iPhone, and iOS. Their company has offices in Santa Monica. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, Tapcart has raised $65.135M of funding; their latest round was closed on June 2021.

You can view their website at https://tapcart.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Product Hunt

title: Senior Data Engineer, Security Customer Protection - Slack
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category...

Products and Technology

Job Details

About Us

Our Security team supports the unwritten fourth tenet of Slack's mission: make people's working lives more secure. We're serious about protecting our infrastructure, operations, and most importantly, our customers' data. We take a systemic approach to security, and strive to ensure we provide low friction high-impact security across everything we do.

As a member of the Slack Security Customer Protection team, you are the first line of detection of bad actors using Slack in unwanted and unexpected ways. As Slack's data, number of customers, and features grow, protecting customers' data from unwanted behaviors becomes an ever more significant and complicated problem. This team develops tooling to tease out high-quality signals from all the noise and collaborates with analysts to detect unwanted behaviors, such as fraud and abuse, among others. Your work directly impacts the way millions of people, teams and businesses get things done.

Slack's API and web backend is built using PHP/Hack, and our backend services are written in Java and Go. We use Airflow, Presto, Hive and Spark to interact with our data infrastructure.

Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture-we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we seek to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

What you will be doing
‚Ä¢ Implement insightful and forward-looking approaches that go beyond the direct team and tackle larger open-ended problems.
‚Ä¢ Participate in the strategic development of methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for projects and programs.
‚Ä¢ Build and scale data systems that power batch and real-time data processing of hundreds of billions of records daily.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Data and Backend Engineering teams as well as Core platform and Features teams to understand and contribute to product and feature development that may impact our security model.
‚Ä¢ You'll partner with the Detection and Analysis team to collect requirements for new developments and understand their impact to customers.
‚Ä¢ You'll provide implementations to expose useful data to internal and external partners.

What you should have
‚Ä¢ Proficiency working with data technologies that power analytics (e.g. Airflow, Hive, Spark, Presto, Kafka, Pinot, MySQL or similar technologies).
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of data processing (relational, key/value, document, columnar, graph).
‚Ä¢ Expertise in high-level programming languages. We write Python and Go here, but are interested in seeing where you shine. (Java, Scala, Rust or other modern languages should be suitable as well)
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a security function or understanding of and interest in learning more about security engineering
‚Ä¢ Skilled at crafting and building robust backend data services (distributed systems, concurrency models, microservices) that distill practical insights out of large amounts of data.
‚Ä¢ Dedication to code quality, automation and operational excellence: unit/integration/data quality tests, scripts, workflows.
‚Ä¢ You can lead technical architecture discussions and help drive technical decisions within your team.
‚Ä¢ Strong communication. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.
‚Ä¢ Keen Collaboration Skills. Collaborating is core to how we operate and this excites you! To us, this means working with other teams in engineering, security, and customer success/experience to ensure we're not missing a beat as threats from baddies grow.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.
‚Ä¢ At this level, 4-7 years of proven ability is a typical guidepost, but in no way a requirement.

For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $150,200. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

Salesforce welcomes all
