title: Senior Light Rail Vehicle Equipment Engineer - City and County of...
company_name: City and County of San Francisco
description:
Company Description

This is a Class-Based SFMTA Test conducted in accordance with CSC Rule 410.

The SFMTA, a department of the City and County of San Francisco, oversees Muni (the historic Municipal Railway), parking and traffic, bicycling, walking and taxis. Over one million people get around San Francisco and rely on us to ensure safe and reliable travel.

Our Vision: Excellent transportation choices for San Francisco.
Our Mission: We connect San Francisco through a safe, equitable, and sustainable transportation system.

Application Opening: April 26, 2022
Application Closing: This job ad may close at any time, but no sooner than September 30, 2022
Compensation Range: $161,564 ‚Äì $196,378
Recruitment ID: T00019 / REF4851

Job Description

Under general administrative direction, the Senior Light Rail Vehicle Equipment Engineer is responsible for the management and supervision of highly technical aspects of the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency‚Äôs (SFMTA) capital... improvement projects for Light Rail Vehicles (LRV) and Historic Streetcars. The incumbent is responsible for providing specialized rail project engineering and other technical expertise to the Fleet Engineering section.

Nature of work: manages specialized engineering work through the design and implementation of detailed and complex modifications to various rail vehicle subsystems and components located on light rail vehicles (LRV‚Äôs), historic streetcars, and Presidential Conference Cars (PCC‚Äôs); prepares technical specifications and develops procedures for modifications and repairs; oversees the evaluation of new and existing rail vehicles for quality and reliability by testing subsystems such as propulsion, brakes, couplers, air conditioning, etc., with subsequent development of appropriate modifications and adjustments; directs the assessment of the feasibility of using alternative parts and materials; makes recommendations and/or approves alternate parts as appropriate; directs consultants in the preparation of engineering plans and specs; directs the work of subordinate personnel in testing, modifications, adjustments, and maintenance of various rail vehicle subsystems; prepares and presents detailed and complex reports analyzing and describing solutions or recommendations; Investigates safety and reliability problems; performs oral/written presentations; prepares cost estimates and analyzes cost effectiveness of alternative engineering methods related to maintenance and repair problems; directs engineering studies/activities; travels to various facilities and sites; prepares specifications for the procurement of rail vehicle parts and materials; confers with maintenance and purchasing personnel; monitors warranty claims made to manufacturers of equipment; coordinates and meets with members of various City departments and other SFMTA divisions to discuss matters related to the operation of rail vehicles; performs duties of a project manager by planning, developing and overseeing projects, and follows projects through completion adhering to scope, schedule, contract and budgetary constraints. Performs related duties and responsibilities as required.

Qualifications

1. A baccalaureate degree from a recognized university or college with major coursework in mechanical, electrical or electronic engineering.

2. Seven years of experience in engineering related to the design, construction, operations, testing and maintenance of light rail vehicle equipment.

LICENSE AND CERTIFICATION

1. Possession and maintenance of a valid Driver License

2. Possession of a current valid registration as a professional engineer from the state of California. Registration in another state will be accepted on the condition of obtaining a California registration within one (1) year.

Applicants must meet the minimum qualification requirement by the final filing date unless otherwise noted.

Verification: Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency can be found at: How to Verify Education Requirements | Department of Human Resources (sfdhr.org). More information can be found at: https://sfdhr.org/information-about-hiring-process#verification. Falsifying one‚Äôs education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.

All work experience, education, training and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included on your application by the filing deadline. Information submitted after the filing deadline will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of a completed City and County of San Francisco application. Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification or may lead to lower scores.

Additional Information

Exam Process: After application submission, candidates deemed qualified must complete all subsequent steps to advance in this selection process, which includes the following:

Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire (MQSQ) (Weight - Qualifying): Candidates will be required to complete a MQSQ as part of the employment application. This MQSQ is designed to obtain specific information regarding an applicant's experience in relation to the Minimum Qualifications (MQ) for this position. The MQSQ will be used to evaluate if the applicant possesses the required minimum qualifications.

Supplemental Questionnaire (Weight - 100%): Candidates will be sent a Supplemental Questionnaire via email. The Supplemental Questionnaire Evaluation is designed to measure knowledge, skills and/or abilities in job-related areas which may include but not be limited to: knowledge of light rail vehicle equipment engineering, project engineering ability, supervisory ability, knowledge of rail vehicle procurement, written communication ability and human relations ability. All statements made on the application materials are subject to verification. A passing score must be achieved on the Supplemental Questionnaire in order to be ranked on the eligible list.

Eligible List/Score Report: A confidential eligible list of applicant names that have passed the civil service examination process will be created, and used for certification purposes only. An examination score report will be established, so applicants can view the ranks, final scores and number of eligible candidates. Applicant information, including names of applicants on the eligible list, shall not be made public unless required by law. However, an eligible list shall be made available for public inspection, upon request, once the eligible list is exhausted or expired and referrals resolved. The eligible list/score report resulting from this civil service examination process is subject to change after adoption (e.g., as a result of appeals), as directed by the Director of Transportation or the Civil Service Commission.

The duration of the eligible list resulting from this examination process will be 12 months, and may be extended with the approval of the Director of Transportation.

Terms of Announcement and Appeal Rights: Applicants must be guided solely by the provisions of this announcement, including requirements, time periods and other particulars, except when superseded by federal, state or local laws, rules or regulations.‚ÄØ [Note: The correction of clerical errors in an announcement may be posted on the Department of Human Resources website at Careers at City and County of San Francisco (smartrecruiters.com)] The terms of this announcement may be appealed under Civil Service Rule 410.4.‚ÄØ Such appeals must be submitted in writing to the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency ATTN: Human Resources Exams Unit, 1 S Van Ness Avenue, 6th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94103-5413 by close of business on the 5th business day following the issuance date of this examination announcement.‚ÄØ Information concerning other Civil Service Commission Rules involving announcements, applications and examination policies, including applicant appeal rights, can be found on the Civil Service Commission website at http://sfgov.org/civilservice/rules

title: Senior Software Engineer (Web)
description:
About Us

Dark green spinach, Italian basil and arugula, deep purple carrots, fields of lavender, and more grow 24 hours a day, all year round, in our high-tech vertical farms. At Beanstalk, we are on a mission to grow the consumption of fresh produce. To do that we build robotics, software, and infrastructure to grow plants from around the world in carbon-neutral farms around the corner. At... Beanstalk, your work is at the nexus of engineering, plant science, and the culinary arts. You‚Äôll collaborate with a diverse team, eat world-class food, and engage with the local community.

About you

You like plants and think of technology as a superpower. You've built software systems and are ready to build something tangible and physical. You're interested in both creating new systems and optimizing existing ones. You are known for being inventive, curious, and staying up to date with the latest tools.

About the role

We engineer our farms to operate as advanced manufacturing lines. Your priority is to work with an interdisciplinary team to build the brains of a modern vertical farm. You will be creating user-facing applications to guide operators in the farm and cloud-based logistical systems that will control custom-built machines to seed, harvest, and process millions of pounds of produce. Software touches every part of our operation so this is a high-leverage role! Our web stack is Typescript, React, GraphQL with Postgraphile and Apollo, GCP Postgres, and Kubernetes.

What you'll do
‚Ä¢ Empower engineers to quickly build industrial robotics
‚Ä¢ Design and build next-generation farming technology alongside a team of mechanical, electrical, chemical, and systems engineers.
‚Ä¢ Use software to discover and solve process bottlenecks as we scale
‚Ä¢ Build multimodal user interfaces for employees and consumers
‚Ä¢ Build, document, and maintain tests, features, and infrastructure
‚Ä¢ Communicate and simplify complex problems in order to foster understanding across multidisciplinary teams

Some projects you could work on
‚Ä¢ Drive farm observability by implementing telemetry systems in partnership with our robotics team
‚Ä¢ Extend our internal farm operations application for automated food safety compliance
‚Ä¢ Build our farm logistical system to plant, grow, and harvest optimally
‚Ä¢ Own our networking layer for reliable inter-machine communication
‚Ä¢ Work with our operations team to roll out and streamline effective HMI systems

We'd love to talk if you
‚Ä¢ Have 5 (or more!) years of full-time experience shipping production software
‚Ä¢ Find long-term ownership of applications exciting
‚Ä¢ Have shipped React applications to production
‚Ä¢ Care about making software that works well for users
‚Ä¢ Are proficient building database-driven apps with Postgres or equivalent
‚Ä¢ Are experienced writing automated unit and integration tests to accelerate development
‚Ä¢ Love to think about systems

description:
LevaData‚Äôs integrated, AI-powered supply management software platform transforms direct material sourcing, mitigates risks, and accelerates new product development. We power the smartest supply chains in the world by constantly analyzing business objectives against real-time market activity and community intelligence. We are trusted to deliver improved margins, control risks, generate new product... velocity, and achieve multi-tier supplier engagement with purpose-built tools for quick collaboration and decisive actions. LevaData creates a competitive advantage with transformational and predictive insights. Customers include large and complex enterprise companies, as well as small- and medium-sized OEMs seeking to achieve best-in-class supply management practices.

Java Developers are responsible for designing and developing innovative customer experiences for our clients. Create large scale distributed systems using microservices architecture. and more‚Ä¶

title: Windows Kernel Engineer
description:
The Role:

We are looking for an experienced hands-on Windows Kernel Engineer to move our endpoint component to the next level. You will be working within a distributed team of fellow engineers delivering thoroughly tested and benchmarked code...

What you will be doing:
‚Ä¢ Design and implement kernel-mode components to interact with our user-mode agent.
‚Ä¢ Implement security measures to protect the driver and related processes.
‚Ä¢ Implement performant communication channels to transmit information from the kernel to user-mode applications.
‚Ä¢ Implement tools to ensure the quality and security of the kernel component.
‚Ä¢ Keep the Kernel Driver up to date to support the latest Microsoft Windows Releases and Patches.
‚Ä¢ Implement and maintain integration components between Kernel Drivers and Windows Services.

What you have done:
‚Ä¢ Implementing and delivering Windows mini-filter drivers for endpoint products.
‚Ä¢ Debugging memory corruption issues, process contentions and system performance.
‚Ä¢ Developing full-fledge C++ applications that can use the Windows API adequately.
‚Ä¢ Developing light-weight and highly performing components.
‚Ä¢ Developing with Object Oriented Programming principles

title: Product Launch Test Engineer
description:
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what‚Äôs possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our... backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
Role Summary:

In this position, you'll help drive successful launch and sustainment of production test equipment for Rivian in house designed control units.

Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ A blend of Test Engineering and Manufacturing, you‚Äôll be at the heart of the production launch process.
‚Ä¢ Establish production testing specifications for feasibility and scalability.
‚Ä¢ Work with main stake holders in the completion of PFMEA, PPAP; and optimize testing processes for volume manufacturing.
‚Ä¢ Push electronic modules through from LRIP to High Volume with the contract manufacturer and at the Rivian vehicle assembly plant.
‚Ä¢ Proactively Identify high risk areas in production and engineering design cycle.
‚Ä¢ Work with contract manufacturers to perform DFT analysis and optimize at all levels.
‚Ä¢ Identify, root cause and track issues and work with Design Engineers on necessary design changes through the production and vehicle launch process.

Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of knowledge, skill and/or ability.

‚Ä¢ 5+ years experience in the development, build and commissioning of test equipment for electronic modules; including development of ICT and EOL testers and programming stations.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years experience in HW cloud data products and storage data array for cloud companies such as aws or others.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Controller Area Network (CAN) and TCP/IP communications.
‚Ä¢ Experience in the development, implementation and sustainment of test procedures.
‚Ä¢ Experience supporting automated test equipment in manufacturing environments
‚Ä¢ Experience with production testing capacity analysis (installed vs planned capacity, OEE, etc)
‚Ä¢ Experience in the Failure Analysis of Electronic Modules.
‚Ä¢ Forward Thinking ‚Äì Providing inputs on new or alternative and improved manufacturing test methods.
‚Ä¢ Ability to lead and sustain supplier manufacturing test process to the higher standards.
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel as needed to CM locations.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work and communicate with cross functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Strong team player, drive to exceed expectations and meet deadlines.
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage ambiguity and create clarity, oversee multiple projects and make them better.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal skills.
‚Ä¢ Minimum 50% of travel to CMs

Equal OpportunityRivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.

Candidate Data PrivacyRivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (‚ÄúCandidate Personal Data‚Äù). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian‚Äôs service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.

title: Project Engineer
description:
Overview

Performs tasks related to the collection of cost data required to monitor project budget and estimates. Requires the selection and application of resource monitoring and control principles, techniques and technical knowledge of construction project...

What You Will Be Doing
‚Ä¢ Meets with engineering and field crews to review production schedule and confirm all materials, equipment and resources are readily available for production to continue on schedule and within budget.
‚Ä¢ Reviews all shop drawings, design specifications, material requirements and project data through the duration of the project to ensure quality and contract specification compliance.
‚Ä¢ Provides technical input for project work plan and scheduling. Identifying risk elements of production, materials, equipment or process that could negatively impact the budget or schedule.
‚Ä¢ Evaluates daily production, schedule and budget projections to accurately track project performance. Documents daily activities in Company approved methods and technologies.
‚Ä¢ Updates project schedule weekly for owner and management reporting. Attends weekly owner meetings; presents on project production status as needed.
‚Ä¢ Perform additional assignments per management‚Äôs direction.
‚Ä¢ Prepares and manages a three-week work plan. Notifies engineering and project management of any significant schedule changes and develops solutions to mitigate delays and cost.
‚Ä¢ Initiates and manages all Requests for Information (RFIs), as needed by project.
‚Ä¢ Remits accurate project quantities using assigned project cost coding to ensure project financials are accurately reported. Manages invoicing with Company accounting team regarding materials, equipment and subcontractor needs.
‚Ä¢ Supports engineering team with quality assurance as needed. Reviews certificates and permits needed to perform work. Participates in all worksite tours with leadership or external parties.
‚Ä¢ Reviews required Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs) to ensure a safe and compliance work environment for all construction personnel. Participates in all weekly safety meetings with field team and project leadership; presents field analysis as needed.
‚Ä¢ Assists the estimating team with project schedule, budget and cost parameters by providing technical input as needed.
‚Ä¢ Assists the development of design drawings and provides technical input, as needed.
‚Ä¢ Coordinates subcontractor work methods, schedule and crews as needed.
‚Ä¢ Reconciles job close-out checklist with owner representative and field crews at the end of the project.
‚Ä¢ Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan.

What We Are Looking For
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree in a related field required.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years construction engineering experience required.
‚Ä¢ Experience in resource monitoring techniques (i.e. cost accounting, basic estimating) and construction technology, process systems and/or structures preferred.
‚Ä¢ Specialized, technical knowledge of design build or other alternative build techniques.
‚Ä¢ Able to set clear expectations for direct reports regarding role and responsibilities.
‚Ä¢ Able to delegate and assign work to engineering team to progress the project production forward.
‚Ä¢ Able to manage multiple engineering tasks and progress them all towards a common goal.
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of contract specifications and quality assurance practices.
‚Ä¢ Able to identify budget and project costs and recommend options to mitigate project delays.
‚Ä¢ Possess verbal, written and presentation skills.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of design build and other alternative build techniques.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of financial reporting methods, quantity tracking methods and cost coding.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of construction scheduling and production time management preferred.
‚Ä¢ Ability to assume responsibility, interface and communicate effectively with others.
‚Ä¢ Valid Driver‚Äôs License required.

Why work for us

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
‚Ä¢ Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
‚Ä¢ Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
‚Ä¢ Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
‚Ä¢ Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
PURPOSE OF THE JOB

The Manufacturing Engineer is accountable to establish and maintain processes and procedures to safely operate the batch house and furnaces to meet codes, specifications, and to continuously improve the glass making process by eliminating waste, improving safety, reducing cost, increasing capacity and productivity, and improving the product per customer requirements...

The position reports to: Technical Leader

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Live the Safety stand, adhere to the safety responsibilities. The Batch, and Furnace Engineer will have responsibility for:
‚Ä¢ Ensuring a safe, clean, and environmentally compliant work environment and building a culture where safety is first priority
‚Ä¢ Ensuring that all controls plans, work instructions, standard work, and other procedures related to the technical operation of the batch house and furnaces ensure the safety of employees
‚Ä¢ Developing risk assessments for critical tasks including emergency response
Metrics
‚Ä¢ Safety Metrics - RIR, Risk Reduction

2. Knowing our Customers. The Batch and Furnace Engineer will have responsibility for:
‚Ä¢ Identifying, understanding, and teaching others the Critical Process Characteristics require to provide our customers with a quality product, beginning with the base glass
‚Ä¢ Developing and implementing procedures and systems to ensure glass/products consistently meet or exceed customer expectations, include supporting experiments or trials for new and existing products
Metrics
‚Ä¢ Key Glass Related Product Characteristics

3. Process Performance. The Batch and Furnace Engineer will have responsibility for:
‚Ä¢ Conducting process audits to review Critical Process Variables and implementing sustainable corrective actions for process shifts or upsets
‚Ä¢ Determining process and product capability (Cpk)
‚Ä¢ Implementing control charting schemes for Critical product and process variables
‚Ä¢ Developing and implementing control plans and standard work to ensure that all processes and products meet specifications at the lowest cost
‚Ä¢ Identifying and eliminating special causes of process variation (troubleshooting)
‚Ä¢ Analyzing process data, providing feedback and making recommendations to optimize performance
‚Ä¢ Working with glass insulation melter network, identify and implement process best practices
‚Ä¢ Coaching, counseling, and training operators in the binder, batch, and melter areas
‚Ä¢ Establishing safe, efficient and effective methods for all critical tasks and audit performance
‚Ä¢ Partner with maintenance, operations and other members of the technical team to resolve equipment issues and improve equipment reliability
‚Ä¢ Identifying and requesting capital funding for equipment, modifications, etc.
Metrics
‚Ä¢ Operational Efficiencies - Production Line Uptime and Bushing Availability
‚Ä¢ Batch System Performance Metrics
‚Ä¢ Critical Glass Product and Process Variables
‚Ä¢ Unit Cost
‚Ä¢ Environmental Compliance

4. Leading and Developing Talent. The Batch and Furnace Engineer will have responsibility for:
‚Ä¢ Educating primary employees in the glass melting process, process control procedures, autonomous maintenance requirements and emergency response procedures
‚Ä¢ Coaching, counseling, and training of new engineers as part of their development plans
‚Ä¢ Partnering with employees to develop and implement standardized work for critical tasks
Metrics
‚Ä¢ Individual Goals and Objectives
‚Ä¢ Employee Training Plans

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Experience:
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 3 years experience within a manufacturing or technical environment or leadership development program. Glass batch/melting experience preferred.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor s Degree required. Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Science preferred.
Knowledge and Abilities:
‚Ä¢ Understands customer needs, environmental requirements, product specifications, basic cost drivers, Critical Product Characteristics, and the Critical Process Variables that impact these elements
‚Ä¢ Understands and works with basic principles of engineering
‚Ä¢ Understands statistical concepts including data analysis, control charts, process capability and design of experiments to drive continuous improvements
‚Ä¢ Understands basic elements of producing fiberglass including raw materials, glass melting, processes and control systems
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate with and engage employees at all levels of the organization
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage multiple priorities or projects at one time
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel 5-10%
Personal Leadership Capabilities:
‚Ä¢ Ideation: Encourages ideas and future possibilities through candor, open discussion, and constructive debate.
‚Ä¢ Evaluation: Understands and frames opportunities that are customer inspired, identifies alternative solutions to address these opportunities, and determines criteria necessary for execution. Uses this evaluative process to build markets and accelerate company success.
‚Ä¢ Action: Gets results by testing and experimentation, fast pursuit, reflection, and adjustment. Creates the systems, structures, and environment to execute with speed.
‚Ä¢ Connection: Collaborates across groups. Influences, inspires, and energizes others to engage in learning and achieve shared goals.

About Owens Corning

Owens Corning is a global building and industrial materials leader. The company's three integrated businesses are dedicated to the manufacture and advancement of a broad range of insulation, roofing and fiberglass composite materials. Leveraging the talents of 19,000 employees in 33 countries, Owens Corning provides innovative products and sustainable solutions that address energy efficiency, product safety, renewable energy, durable infrastructure, and labor productivity. These solutions provide a material difference to the company's customers and make the world a better place. Based in Toledo, Ohio, USA, the company posted 2020 sales of $7.1 billion. Founded in 1938, it has been a Fortune 500 company for 66 consecutive years. For more information, please visit .

Owens Corning is an equal opportunity employer

title: Audio Systems Validation Engineer, Reality Labs
description:
The Meta Reality Labs (RL) Audio Team is looking for an enthusiastic, hands-on Audio Electrical Engineer. The successful candidate will be an instinctive engineer who involves their head, heart, hands, and ears in the design process. We are looking for meaningful experience in all aspects of consumer product audio system design - from building up early proof-of-concept technologies, product... development and testing, through to production readiness. The ideal engineer employs data driven design, objective and subjective audio evaluation, and a common sense mindset to complex engineering challenges. The best fit for the role will be a gregarious communicator who is able to describe audio activities in a clear and concise manner, relating qualitative experience to quantitative data. The points below describe an example of a strong candidate, however we highly value motivation, work-ethic and enthusiasm. If you don't fit this profile but believe are right for this position, we still want to hear from you.

Audio Systems Validation Engineer, Reality Labs Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Holistic audio system design, definition and ownership (i.e. render/capture/amplifier/power delivery/audio chain)
‚Ä¢ Debug all circuits for audio chain (including codecs, embedded DSPs, headphone amps, speaker amps and microphones)
‚Ä¢ Validate electrical performance targets, system KPIs, and coexistence performance in the end system
‚Ä¢ Debug and validate SW/FW bugs to ensure proper HW audio functionality
‚Ä¢ Primary cross-functional interface with PD/PM/ID/EE/HWTE/SWE/etc.
‚Ä¢ Collaboration with internal/external specialized teams
‚Ä¢ Work with factory to debug and drive to resolution audio HW/SW issues for production
‚Ä¢ Provide demos to establish performance, gaining cross-functional and leadership buy-in
Minimum Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Experience with PCBA and product level failure modes
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of industry experience focused around audio system design, influencing cross-functional teams and leadership for the improvement of audio
‚Ä¢ Audio product development utilizing: ADB, QACT, QXDM, Audio Precision, OrCAD or Cadence or similar schematic capture and PCB layout tool experience
‚Ä¢ Proficient in debugging Analog and Digital circuits
Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Personal project experience with: Speaker enthusiast, audio hobbyist, musician/production/recording, electronics/SW tinkering projects, or something completely unexpected (flying go-kart, homemade CNC, laundry folding machine, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Experience in transducer design (speakers, microphone, MEM's, etc.) and acoustic test development (lab, factory)
‚Ä¢ BS in EE or Physics or related field (or equivalent industry experience)
‚Ä¢ Understanding of design, testing, algorithm prototyping as well as algorithm and audio chain prototyping and demo's
‚Ä¢ Experience in audio speech quality testing, optimization and tuning (using B&K or ACQUA)
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com

title: System Engineer - PHY & MAC, Wireless Protocols
description:
Company:

Qualcomm Technologies, Inc...

Job Area:

Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Cellular Technologies

General Summary:

Researches, designs, standardizes, implements, optimizes, verifies, validates, and commercializes Wireless WAN (or cellular) air interfaces, modem technologies, and related core network, as a prototype, standard, specification, product, or component within a product. Has expertise in the WWAN specifications and can design, optimize, and implement advanced wireless systems and modems. Works closely with the other functional groups to develop a cost effective, high quality and high capability air interface and modem meeting industry and customer requirements with high performance (e.g., capacity, coverage, throughput, latency, power consumption) and acceptable cost (e.g., silicon area, calibration complexity, code size).

Minimum Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 4+ years of Electrical Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience.

OR

Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 3+ years of Electrical Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience.

OR

PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 2+ years of Electrical Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer, or related field.
‚Ä¢ 1+ years of applicable wireless, semiconductor and/or embedded software industry experience.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience with programming (e.g., C, C++, Python), computer architecture, or embedded systems.
‚Ä¢ 1+ years in a technical leadership role with or without direct reports (only applies to positions with direct reports).

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Applies expert wireless communications knowledge and develops or modifies methodology to execute assignments; applies understanding and leads technical conversation to include the domain of wireless WAN (cellular) subject matter expertise with a specific focus in design reviews and project meetings to meet design requirements; owns complex component design and implementation.
‚Ä¢ Develops, reviews, and/or verifies models, code, tests and/or simulations developed by others; identifies issues related to accuracy or reliability of design; weighs tradeoff against loosely defined requirements and identifies solutions. Provides guidance to less experienced engineers; collaborates with cross-functional teams to design solutions that meet industry and customer requirements with high performance and acceptable cost.
‚Ä¢ Executes the integration of architecture and systems into a chipset, platform, or product. Provides technical expertise to resolve moderately complex issues during implementation and/or commercialization independently across functional areas; supports cross-functional teams in product bring-up and resolution of customer/field issues.
‚Ä¢ Displays deep knowledge in a specific area; acquires advanced knowledge of industry trends, competitors' products, and/or advances in various engineering fields related to wireless WAN (or cellular) air interface and modem technologies; shares knowledge with others on team and helps less experienced engineers understand and apply advanced concepts.
‚Ä¢ Stays abreast of current and future trends to make suggestions in strategic discussions within a domain about the product/technology roadmap.
‚Ä¢ Writes clear and detailed technical documentation (e.g., feature, component, and design descriptions) for complex projects.

Level of Responsibility:
‚Ä¢ Works independently with little supervision.
‚Ä¢ Provides some supervision/guidance to other members; does not have direct reports.
‚Ä¢ Decisions are moderate in nature. Errors are detected and corrected with relatively minor financial impact or effect on projects, operations, or customer relationships. May require involvement beyond immediate work group to correct.
‚Ä¢ Requires verbal and written communication skills to convey information that may be somewhat complex to others who may have limited knowledge of the subject in question. Role may require basic negotiation and influence, cooperation, tact, and diplomacy, etc.
‚Ä¢ Has a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to make key decisions).
‚Ä¢ Most tasks do not have defined steps; simultaneous use of multiple mental abilities is generally required to determine the best approach. Mistakes may result in significant rework.
‚Ä¢ Substantial creativity is needed to innovate new processes, procedures, or work products within guidelines or to achieve established objectives.
‚Ä¢ Deductive and inductive problem solving is required; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem. Often information is missing or conflicting; advanced data analysis and interpretation skills are required.
‚Ä¢ Occasionally participates in strategic planning within own area affecting immediate operations.

The responsibilities of this role do not include:
‚Ä¢ Does not have financial accountability.

title: Mid Backend Software Engineer
description:
Mid Backend Software Engineer

The Mid Backend Software Engineer position is part of an application development team within BrainGu tasked with building and maintaining mission critical apps for our customers as part of the Mission-Apps-as-a-Service offering. Mission Apps-as-a-Service puts operators side by side with world-class BrainGu software engineering teams. This ensures modern and secure... development at the fastest optempo possible and aligned directly to mission needs. This role is also expected to be able to support and switch between various projects, so organization is a key skill required. The ideal candidate will be a battle-hardened web developer that has significant experience architecting and building production-grade backends in Python & Django within small, high-paced teams.

Job Duties
‚Ä¢ Responsible for delivering work under tight deadlines, and is committed to work as needed to complete time-sensitive tasks
‚Ä¢ Experienced in communicating complex topics to customers, peers, and leadership verbally and in writing, along with understanding and executing functional and technical specifications.
‚Ä¢ Design and deployment of our database
‚Ä¢ Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability
‚Ä¢ Design and construction of REST APIs

Required Competencies and Certifications
‚Ä¢ This position may require a US Government Clearance, which requires US Citizenship

title: Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
WHO WE ARE

Tread is a construction software company that is venture-backed, building the future of 4+ year technology that uses data and analytics to keep construction moving.

The team at Tread care about what we build, and about each other. We value open communication and respect each other's diverse opinions and ideas regardless of their title. As part of the team, you'll have full visibility and be encouraged to make a positive impact every day on our customer's pain points and enjoy seeing the results of your work. We work hard to create an environment where everyone can share their ideas because we know innovation happens with diverse perspectives.

You will have the opportunity to provide certainty and precision to the trillion dollar construction industry: a market that is currently underserved by technology. We‚Äôre building systems that can support entire cities across North America and the hundreds of thousands of contractors and subcontractors that work within... them.

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. title: Senior Software Engineer ‚Äì Full Stack
description:
Background:

Dorsal Health is reshaping healthcare to free 50 million Americans from chronic pain and musculoskeletal conditions such as spine pain, arthritis, workplace injuries, and opioid addiction. Our end-to-end clinical care model combines technology with a human touch to provide members with on-demand access to elite specialists, empathetic care teams, and personalized treatment programs... We‚Äôre backed by top Silicon Valley venture capitalists and founders of the fastest-growing digital health startups.

About the role:

As an early member of our engineering team, you‚Äôll partner closely with a world-class group of doctors, designers, operators, and founders to build products that deliver radically better clinical outcomes at significantly lower costs. You‚Äôll use your experience and expertise to raise the bar on code quality and take a lead role in setting technical direction. You‚Äôre autonomous and self-driven but can work effectively in a highly collaborative setting. In your first few months, you may find yourself working on:
‚Ä¢ Intuitive and engaging virtual care experiences such as video visits, 24/7 live messaging, provider matching, and appointment scheduling
‚Ä¢ Intelligent tooling and electronic health record systems to improve the efficacy of our in-house clinical staff
‚Ä¢ Connected wearable devices that monitor and reduce workplace injury risk

What you‚Äôll do:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with designers, clinicians, and other engineers to build new features from start to finish through conception, research, implementation, and maintenance
‚Ä¢ Drive full-stack product development for care delivery platforms used by both internal providers and external consumers
‚Ä¢ Help set up and iterate on foundational engineering processes including version control, continuous integration, deployment infrastructure, and internal documentation
‚Ä¢ Uphold standards for quality by performing code reviews, fixing bugs, creating automated tests, and monitoring performance
‚Ä¢ Grow the team by onboarding and helping to recruit highly capable engineers

What you have:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of professional experience developing software for production environments
‚Ä¢ Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complicated systems to both technical and non-technical audiences
‚Ä¢ Experience working across the stack on frontend, backend, and infrastructure (you don‚Äôt need to be an expert in all of these but it helps to be interested in learning about them)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with tools and frameworks for modern web / mobile application development. Our current favorites are TypeScript, React, React Native, Next.js, Apollo GraphQL, Hasura, PostgreSQL, and Terraform.
‚Ä¢ Excellent problem solving and debugging skills with the right balance between development velocity and designing for long-term scalability
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a similar technical field

Bonus points if you have:
‚Ä¢ Experience designing, deploying, and managing cloud infrastructure
‚Ä¢ A passion for solving meaningful problems in healthcare through technology
‚Ä¢ Past entrepreneurial proof points (such as early-stage startup experience, building new products or teams at larger companies, exploring ideas or side projects, etc.)

What you‚Äôll gain:
‚Ä¢ Highly competitive salary and equity in a fast-growing startup
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive healthcare, dental, vision, and 401(k) plans
‚Ä¢ Generous PTO policy and 10 paid national holidays
‚Ä¢ Remote-friendly culture with local in-person office hubs and coworking
‚Ä¢ Exciting career growth opportunities (including mentorship from leading technical advisors and entrepreneurs)

Dorsal Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Employer. We don‚Äôt discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Dorsal Health focuses on Enterprise Software, Healthcare, Corporate Wellness, Health and Wellness, and Employer Benefits Programs. Their company has offices in New York City. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.dorsalhealth.com

title: Associate Network Engineer/Network Engineer
description:
US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED FOR THIS POSITION: Yes

RELOCATION ASSISTANCE: Relocation assistance may be available...

CLEARANCE TYPE: Secret

TRAVEL: No

Description

Join Northrop Grumman on our continued mission to push the boundaries of possible across land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace. Enjoy a culture where your voice is valued and start contributing to our team of passionate professionals providing real-life solutions to our worlds biggest challenges. We take pride in creating purposeful work and allowing our employees to grow and achieve their goals every day by Defining Possible. With our competitive pay and comprehensive benefits, we have the right opportunities to fit your life and launch your career today.

Job Description

Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for a Associate Network Engineer/Network Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Melbourne, FL .

This position may be filled by either an Associate Network Engineer level or a Network Engineer level based on the qualifications listed.

Essential Functions:
‚Ä¢ COTS hardware design and estimate performance within the constructs of the hardware
‚Ä¢ Design and develop computer and network architectures, perform hardware integration and testing, and requirements analysis
‚Ä¢ Trade studies, documenting subsystem architectures, analyzing performance, and evaluating Technology Readiness Level (TRL) with regard to supplier current and future products offerings
‚Ä¢ Developing supplier documentation, performance based specifications, and statements of work
‚Ä¢ Building supplier evaluation criteria and experience in conducting technical evaluations, documenting results and selection
‚Ä¢ Ability to review documents from the suppliers development effort and support supplier technical interchange meetings and design reviews
‚Ä¢ Ability and willingness to perform this work in various locations which include on site, locally within a laboratory setting or within a manufacturing setting of military vehicles of different types. The candidate must be willing to travel to CONUS locations to support company manufacturing facilities and programs.
‚Ä¢ The candidate must also be capable of working directly with a suppliers technical staff to develop a technically correct solution for many of the network LRU integration issues that may arise. They must be able to interact directly with senior staff engineers on the supplier side, under senior engineer guidance, and be technically capable in every respect.
The selected candidate should thrive in a fast-paced work environment with high expectations, significantly diverse assignments, collaborative/team settings across all levels.

Basic Qualifications:

For Associate Network Engineer: (T01)
‚Ä¢ Bachelors Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university
‚Ä¢ Must have demonstrated experience in Ethernet-based networking design, to include IP address planning, switching, and routing
‚Ä¢ Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a DOD Secret Security Clearance or higher
‚Ä¢ Must be able to obtain and maintain program access prior to start
For Network Engineer: (T02)
‚Ä¢ Bachelors Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university and 2 years of engineering experience OR Masters Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university and 1 year of experience
‚Ä¢ Must have demonstrated experience in Ethernet-based networking design, to include IP address planning, switching, and routing
‚Ä¢ Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a DOD Secret Security Clearance or higher
‚Ä¢ Must be able to obtain and maintain program access prior to start
Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ DOD Secret or Top Secret/SCI level Security Clearance, to include a Single Scope Background Investigation, a periodic reinvestigation, or an original adjudication date completed within the last 6 years
‚Ä¢ Bachelors, Masters, or PhD Degree in Electronics, Computer or Electrical Engineering
‚Ä¢ Experience with working on a multidisciplinary team and writing technical proposals
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface with all levels of employees and management
‚Ä¢ Possess a Cisco CCNA, Network+, or equivalent certification
‚Ä¢ Possess a DODD 8570 certifications, such as CompTIA Security+, CISSP
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of cyber security, STIGs and associated elements
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated knowledge in the areas of Ethernet based avionics bus interfaces, integrated avionics systems, and operational ground systems
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated understanding of IP address planning, VLANs, ACLs, encapsulation, switching, routing, QoS, service and/or application protocols
‚Ä¢ Experience with Cross Domain Solution (CDS)
‚Ä¢ Experience with authentication and data encryption methods, to include securing communications at either the data-link or network layer
‚Ä¢ Experience with embedded systems, Unix and Linux operating systems, non-Cisco routing environments, single board computers, servers and Network Attached Storage (NAS) solutions
‚Ä¢ Experience with integration of COTS electronics into military systems
Salary Range: $58,800.00 - $88,200.00Salary Range 2: $71,100.00 - $106,700.00

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority . The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 .

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions

title: Manufacturing Quality Engineer
description:
Position Overview

As the the Manufacturing Quality Engineer for Zelis, you will steward the production facility to ISO 9000 certification and implement a best-in-class operating environment that meets Zelis Payments quality standards. Using ISO 9000 standards as a foundation, you will identify, prioritize and lead process/operating improvements to improve productivity, increase output capacity... reduce errors and waste, and ensure stability. In addition, you will also be responsible for developing systems that balance materials, assets, and production resources.

The Zelis Payments production facility is responsible for over 500M payments communications each year. Our Manufacturing Quality Engineer will provide strong leadership and train the organization on new processes and procedures, offering coaching to teams and on an individual basis. This person will evaluate improvements with quantifiable metrics (e.g., throughput, backlog, yield, cost reduction). As needed, the engineer will support the Plant leadership team with machine/materials procurement, vendor selection, and department expense/capital planning.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Map production processes, including relevant time studies, and diagnose improvement areas with Root Cause Analysis/Lean Methodology/ISO 9000 standards
‚Ä¢ Analyze resource requirements and identify constraints of equipment, staffing, and infrastructure which may impact delivery and quality
‚Ä¢ Prioritize corrective actions based on financial impact and develop short/long-term strategy for facility, including path to ISO 9000 certification. Corrective actions may include (1) machinery, tools, materials modifications (2) processes (3) plant layout and workflows (4) personnel allocation and training (5) vendor management (6) technology
‚Ä¢ Design tests for process and operating improvements; measure results and communicate impact to stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Plan implementation strategy for full process and standard operating procedure changes, including Change Management planning and documentation of Standard Operating Procedures
‚Ä¢ Train engineers, technicians, and machine operators on new processes; track effectiveness of new implementations for continuous improvement
‚Ä¢ Audit operations adherence with Quality Assurance standards
‚Ä¢ Support any capital projects, including evaluation of proposed equipment and materials and overseeing any resulting installations and training

Experience/Background
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in an Engineering discipline or equivalent work experience
‚Ä¢ 1-3 years experience in process / industrial engineering within a manufacturing environment
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of Engineering practices (e.g., Six Sigma, ISO 9000)
‚Ä¢ Comfortable with data collection and analytics to drive decisions and evaluate results
‚Ä¢ Experience with Change Management and people development with comfort working on the production floor
‚Ä¢ Experienced in reporting and documentation

As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We‚Äôre Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care. Zelis brings adaptive technology, a deeply ingrained service culture, and a comprehensive navigation through adjudication and payment platform to manage the complete payment process

title: Team Leader-Systems Engineer
description:
This role is with the MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) team which is a part of Global Engineering & Technology. MST is a team of multi-disciplinary engineers who help solve complex engineering and design problems by leveraging and developing state-of-the-art models, simulations, and digital design tools. Our team provides detailed engineering simulation, design engineering, and... analysis services worldwide for Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI), Park Operations Line of Business, Global Engineering & Technology partners, Transportation, Engineering Services, and Entertainment. MST builds Ride and Show Engineering to optimize design and architecture and identify solutions for new attractions and existing assets. The team covers a considerable breadth of modeling, simulation, and analysis work, including dynamic mechanical systems, FEA (Finite Element Analysis, RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis, system simulations, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, digital twins, engineering software tools and process development.

This Team Leader-Systems Engineer role will lead MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) Dynamic Modeling and Analysis team, and support technical development while meeting key business objectives. This leadership role typically requires 25%-50% of the time performing team management duties. Additional duties include providing technical project support and appropriate Subject Matter Expertise on relevant projects.

This role reports to the Manager of MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools)

Position Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Manage and support a team of high functioning multi-disciplinary engineers by helping them meet career goals while maintaining key business objectives such as scope, schedule, and budget.
‚Ä¢ Establish strong relationships with each direct report; listen, give guidance, advocate, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ Foster a culture of growth, innovation, and management through change.
‚Ä¢ Track and monitor technical and project performance by facilitating code, analysis, or design reviews.
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain good relationships with partners throughout the Disney Company, such as Walt Disney Imagineering, Walt Disney World & Disneyland Ride & Show Studios, GE&T Mechanical, and Sustaining Engineering Teams, Scientific Systems, Entertainment, Character Programs & Development, Reedy Creek Improvement District (RCID), Operations, Disney Cruise Lines, and Transportation Systems.
‚Ä¢ Develop and understand macro-level business opportunities, including roadmaps to integrate new technologies into park operation and new product development.
‚Ä¢ Develop new business opportunities that align with MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) mission and technical advancement. Foster the growth of these new businesses by organizing and communicating.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with customers to set realistic expectations, staffing plans, and schedules.
‚Ä¢ Communicate with peer leads and management to understand resource levels and project priorities across the team.
‚Ä¢ Forecast resource needs by communicating with partners and planning for future scope, tracking budgets and spending, verifying planning assumptions, and gathering support from leadership.
‚Ä¢ Resolve resource priority conflicts between project teams and customers.
‚Ä¢ Manage conflict resolution within the team and with customers or key partners.
‚Ä¢ Manage external vendor scopes of work, including mechanical, systems, or software work.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ 7 or more years of relevant engineering experience
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead complex systems-level efforts while
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to lead and motivate team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to mentor and guide less experienced team members.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to manage resources & budgets for department portfolio.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbally, to build lasting relationships with team members, customers, and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to manage priorities and time allocation for oneself
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to resolve challenges and demonstrate professionalism
‚Ä¢ Ability to confidently employ the Agile methodology
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Disney engineering software design and requirements standards & practices

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Experience with analytical tools such as MathWorks or ANSYS
‚Ä¢ Experience with all facets of simulation involvement in the design of Ride and Show Mechanical and Controls Systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with simulation involvement in the Creative Design Process
‚Ä¢ Experience with the new attraction project cycles and critical milestones for modeling, simulation, or analysis involvement
‚Ä¢ Experience with fieldwork, including authoring test procedures, installation, testing, and communication strategy
‚Ä¢ Experience with solving mathematical models of electro-mechanical and control systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with CAD and Modeling experience
‚Ä¢ Experience with FEA (Finite Element Analysis), RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis
‚Ä¢ Experience with collaboration tools, including Confluence, Slack, JIRA, Microsoft Teams
‚Ä¢ Experience with defining engineering requirements and using system architecture tools
‚Ä¢ Experience with version control repository managers, such as Gitlab, SVN, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with coding or scripting using C++, C#, JavaScript, Python, or Matlab
‚Ä¢ Experience with software development environments, including MS Visual studio

Required Education
‚Ä¢ ABET-accredited Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Systems Engineering or equivalent

title: Civil Graduate Engineer
description:
Graduate Engineer

Henderson Professional Engineers is a new civil engineering firm, formed at the end of 2020, with a team that has over 40 years of collective experience in land development and civil engineering. We are passionate about our work and have the drive to be and do better with every project we take in. We want to build the community where we live, work, play, and volunteer...

Our culture at HPE is founded on one thing - relationships. To us, the people we work with and the bonds we form are what allows us to succeed. Our core values are defined as uncompromising honesty, teamwork, efficiency, communication, and continual improvement. We do our best to live up to those values every day and expect the same from every employee.

Our office is located in Round Rock, Texas and most of our staff lives in the same region. We love having everyone in the office to build and maintain the personal relationships with each other, but we are very open to having remote employees.

About the Graduate Engineer role

The Graduate Engineer role is a key role in the production of each land development project. The Graduate Engineer is responsible for developing engineering models for hydraulic analysis, water and wastewater analysis, aid in overall site design and planning, and document tasks for reporting and permitting. The Graduate Engineer will frequently be required to perform the following activities:
Prepare hydraulic models using HEC HMS and/or HEC RAS
Prepare analysis models in AutoCAD Civil 3D for plan production and documentation
Aid in the design and documentation of grading models for detention or site design
Utilize customized spreadsheets and tools
Prepare reports documenting analysis models
Make changes to models and reports under the direction of the Engineer

title: Team Leader-Systems Engineer
description:
This role is with the MST (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) team which is a part of Global Engineering & Technology. MST builds Ride and Show Engineering to optimize design and architecture and identify solutions for new attractions and existing assets. The team covers a considerable breadth of modeling, simulation, and analysis work, including dynamic mechanical systems, FEA (Finite Element Analysis, RBD (Rigid Body Dynamics), CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis, system simulations, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, digital twins, engineering software tools and process development.

This Team Leader-Systems Engineer role will lead MST's (Modeling, Simulation, and Training Tools) Dynamic Modeling and Analysis team, and support technical development while meeting key business objectives. title: Cellular Engineer ‚Äì 5G/4G Field Log Analysis
description:
Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI) is advancing the world‚Äôs technology. As a leader in Memory, System, LSI and LCD technologies, our US teams contribute to breakthroughs in 5G, SOC, memory and display. With our global perspective and diversity of thought, we proudly serve our customers around the world. We are looking for team members who share our commitment to learning and growth and excel when... collaborating within and across teams.

SSI is headquartered in the heart of Silicon Valley and is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. - the #1 employer in the world (Forbes, 2020 & 2021) and top patent-holder in the U.S. Want to advance the world‚Äôs technology with us?

Job Title

Cellular Engineer ‚Äì 5G/4G Field Log Analysis

Location

San Diego, CA or Bellevue, WA or San Jose, CA or New Jersey

Job #

40805

OVERVIEW & IMPACT:

Samsung SOC R&D Lab in San Diego is looking for cellular engineer ‚Äì 5G/4G Field log analysis to join the team of passionate engineers with start-up spirit to debug and test Samsung‚Äôs world-class cellular modem solution. The candidate is expected to bring innovation and strong execution skills to the cellular group for Field/IOT Certification and Performance test. Open to hiring for this position in San Diego or Seattle.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
‚Ä¢ Support log analysis for field certification, performance test and lab IOT activities for US carriers (AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile).
‚Ä¢ Take responsibility of field/IOT test execution, analyze failure logs and track issues until they are resolved. Strong communications skills and cross-functional collaboration needed.
‚Ä¢ Plan innovative test scenarios to uncover critical modem issues. Identify KPIs to improve modem performance especially for LTE and 5G technologies.
‚Ä¢ Send reports to executive level to outline current status and to communicate any critical issues.

QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIRED SKILLS:
‚Ä¢ M.S. with 3+ years of industry experience.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of various modem protocol layer stack ‚Äì L1, MAC, RRC, PDCP for LTE/5G.
‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of LTE/5G NR NSA/SA features
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of IMS protocol and VoWifi call flow.
‚Ä¢ Ability to drive and resolve end to end system performance and functional issues by collaborating with software team.
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience in mobile device testing/failure analysis with system simulators or in field for at least 2-3 years.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a team environment with cross-team coordination and challenging schedules.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem solving skills. Ability to take ownership and bring innovations in test methodology.
‚Ä¢ Strong verbal and written communication skills.
‚Ä¢ About 5-10% travel as needed to support Field/IOT log analysis.

Additionally, we look for the following universal qualities in all candidates:
‚Ä¢ Resourceful Achiever: self-motivated and proactive, you flex to try new approaches and creatively solve problems
‚Ä¢ Avid Learner: you thrive with challenges, seek continuous growth and improvement, and seek data to prove your hypotheses
‚Ä¢ Devoted Professional: you are diligent and deliberate in your work, leveraging your expertise to deliver results without ego
‚Ä¢ Thoughtful Collaborator: you build relationships across teams, offering help and welcoming ideas from others to drive work forward in an inclusive manner

PREFERED SKILLS
‚Ä¢ Previous experience of 5G NR technology is preferred.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with US carrier certification procedure is a plus.

COVID-19 POLICIES
‚Ä¢ Successful applicants must comply with company COVID-19 policies, which are subject to change in response to public health, regulatory and business circumstances
‚Ä¢ Current policies are subject only to emergency or legally-required exceptions and include: mandatory reporting of vaccination status; vaccination requirement for office access, external meetings and business travel; mask usage in office; and daily screening procedures at offices

title: Associate Network Engineer/Network Engineer
description:
US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED FOR THIS POSITION: Yes

RELOCATION ASSISTANCE: Relocation assistance may be available...

CLEARANCE TYPE: Secret

TRAVEL: No

Description

Join Northrop Grumman on our continued mission to push the boundaries of possible across land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace. Enjoy a culture where your voice is valued and start contributing to our team of passionate professionals providing real-life solutions to our worlds biggest challenges. We take pride in creating purposeful work and allowing our employees to grow and achieve their goals every day by Defining Possible. With our competitive pay and comprehensive benefits, we have the right opportunities to fit your life and launch your career today.

Job Description

Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for a Associate Network Engineer/Network Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Melbourne, FL .

This position may be filled by either an Associate Network Engineer level or a Network Engineer level based on the qualifications listed.

Essential Functions:
‚Ä¢ COTS hardware design and estimate performance within the constructs of the hardware
‚Ä¢ Design and develop computer and network architectures, perform hardware integration and testing, and requirements analysis
‚Ä¢ Trade studies, documenting subsystem architectures, analyzing performance, and evaluating Technology Readiness Level (TRL) with regard to supplier current and future products offerings
‚Ä¢ Developing supplier documentation, performance based specifications, and statements of work
‚Ä¢ Building supplier evaluation criteria and experience in conducting technical evaluations, documenting results and selection
‚Ä¢ Ability to review documents from the suppliers development effort and support supplier technical interchange meetings and design reviews
‚Ä¢ Ability and willingness to perform this work in various locations which include on site, locally within a laboratory setting or within a manufacturing setting of military vehicles of different types. The candidate must be willing to travel to CONUS locations to support company manufacturing facilities and programs.
‚Ä¢ The candidate must also be capable of working directly with a suppliers technical staff to develop a technically correct solution for many of the network LRU integration issues that may arise. They must be able to interact directly with senior staff engineers on the supplier side, under senior engineer guidance, and be technically capable in every respect.
The selected candidate should thrive in a fast-paced work environment with high expectations, significantly diverse assignments, collaborative/team settings across all levels.

Basic Qualifications:

For Associate Network Engineer: (T01)
‚Ä¢ Bachelors Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university
‚Ä¢ Must have demonstrated experience in Ethernet-based networking design, to include IP address planning, switching, and routing
‚Ä¢ Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a DOD Secret Security Clearance or higher
‚Ä¢ Must be able to obtain and maintain program access prior to start
For Network Engineer: (T02)
‚Ä¢ Bachelors Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university and 2 years of engineering experience OR Masters Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university and 1 year of experience
‚Ä¢ Must have demonstrated experience in Ethernet-based networking design, to include IP address planning, switching, and routing
‚Ä¢ Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a DOD Secret Security Clearance or higher
‚Ä¢ Must be able to obtain and maintain program access prior to start
Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ DOD Secret or Top Secret/SCI level Security Clearance, to include a Single Scope Background Investigation, a periodic reinvestigation, or an original adjudication date completed within the last 6 years
‚Ä¢ Bachelors, Masters, or PhD Degree in Electronics, Computer or Electrical Engineering
‚Ä¢ Experience with working on a multidisciplinary team and writing technical proposals
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface with all levels of employees and management
‚Ä¢ Possess a Cisco CCNA, Network+, or equivalent certification
‚Ä¢ Possess a DODD 8570 certifications, such as CompTIA Security+, CISSP
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of cyber security, STIGs and associated elements
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated knowledge in the areas of Ethernet based avionics bus interfaces, integrated avionics systems, and operational ground systems
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated understanding of IP address planning, VLANs, ACLs, encapsulation, switching, routing, QoS, service and/or application protocols
‚Ä¢ Experience with Cross Domain Solution (CDS)
‚Ä¢ Experience with authentication and data encryption methods, to include securing communications at either the data-link or network layer
‚Ä¢ Experience with embedded systems, Unix and Linux operating systems, non-Cisco routing environments, single board computers, servers and Network Attached Storage (NAS) solutions
‚Ä¢ Experience with integration of COTS electronics into military systems
Salary Range: $58,800.00 - $88,200.00Salary Range 2: $71,100.00 - $106,700.00

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority . The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 .

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions

title: Data Engineer - Mid Level
description:
Top Benefits:

ISSAC offers competitive salaries, Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance. We also have generous PTO, federal holidays off, education assistance, 401K program and profit sharing...

Job Description: Seeking a mid-level Data Engineer as a key member of the Missile Defense Agency (MDA), Engineering team, providing data engineering expertise, while conducting research and development for artificial Intelligence and data science projects. Our team is sought after by leadership and peers to work their most ambiguous ideas and challenges due to our high degree of out of the box thinking, willingness to try something new, and no fear of failure. Our success is driven by every member of the team government and contractors alike striving to do the best they can. We work across the entire MDA Engineering Enterprise working to strengthen and enable every element and component.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ This position provides data engineering support to enhance the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) Engineering Enterprise program office looking to employ modern digital engineering and data science approaches across the lifecycle and connecting engineering, test, business, contract, and finance data of different types together. The Data Engineer works with MDA engineers to capture and understand both authoritative data and non authoritative data, its meaning, and relation to other data and how to meaningfully use it to develop data stories that can be automated. This position will identify potential improvements to data sources themselves, collection methods, processes and supporting systems. The position participates in the development of an enterprise wide system-of-systems engineering effort between the element weapon system program offices and the MDS system offices ensuring that the program offices are integrated and aligned working with weapon system prime contractors to deliver capability.
‚Ä¢ Analysis of engineering and program office activities to help identify ways to apply digital transformation practices.

‚Ä¢ In addition, the data engineer will assist Product and Data Owners to refine their data usage and provide organizational implementation strategy, training, and metrics.
