title: Reliability & Test Engineer, Robotics
description:
As a reliability and test engineer on our robotics team, you'll be responsible for transforming our surgical robot from an experimental medical device to a robust system capable of doing tens of thousands of surgeries. In addition to root-causing persistent issues, you'll be designing and implementing tests to ensure that the robots and associated surgical tools are highly reliable. Due to the... wide array of challenges to solve, we're looking for engineers with mechanical, electrical, or software experience (or all three!).

For a glimpse of one reliability issue, here's a video of a UV fluorescent solution used to visualize the splash pattern of a saline nozzle. Determining that the splashing was causing a robot performance issue, figuring out how to record the splash pattern, and redesigning the nozzle to eliminate splashing made the robot much more reliable:

In addition to solving key reliability issues, you'll have the opportunity to develop test infrastructure that will accelerate the pace of engineering development and validation for the robot. If you're excited about solving new problems every day, or if you are passionate about test and fixture design, we would love to hear from you!

About you:
‚Ä¢ You find large challenges exciting and enjoy discovering and defining problems as much as solving them.
‚Ä¢ You deliver. You may enjoy thoughtful conversations about problems and perfecting designs, but in the end, you know that what matters is delivering a manufacturable solution that works every time.
‚Ä¢ You are a cross-disciplinary team member. You are excited to work with and learn from software, mechanical, electrical, materials, biological engineers, and neuroscientists. You are comfortable communicating across teams.
‚Ä¢ Resourceful, flexible and adaptable; no task is too big or too small.

Key qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree in mechanical, electrical, software engineering, or equivalent in experience and ability.
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of engineering experience in making systems reliable (whether that's in school clubs or industry)
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of engineering first principles.

Preferred qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Experience designing hardware in the loop test systems.
‚Ä¢ Experience interfacing with sensors, motors, etc.
‚Ä¢ Python experience

What we offer:
‚Ä¢ An opportunity to change the world and work with some of the smartest and the most talented experts from different fields.
‚Ä¢ Growth potential. We rapidly advance team members who have an outsized impact.
‚Ä¢ Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance through a PPO plan; parental leave.
‚Ä¢ Flexible time off + paid holidays.
‚Ä¢ Equity + 401(k) plan.
‚Ä¢ Commuter Benefits.
‚Ä¢ Meals provided.

Neuralink provides equal opportunity in all of our employment practices to all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military status, genetic information or any other category protected by federal, state and local laws. This policy applies to all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, compensation, promotion, transfer, disciplinary action, layoff, return from layoff, training and social, and recreational programs. All such employment decisions will be made without unlawfully discriminating on any prohibited basis.

Multiple studies have found that a higher percentage of women and BIPOC candidates won't apply if they don't meet every listed qualification. Neuralink values candidates of all backgrounds. If you find yourself excited by our mission but you don't check every box in the description, we encourage you to apply anyway

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
The Senior Mechanical Engineer will make design improvements to mechanical ride and show and facility systems that improve life-cycle costs by using emerging technologies. You will perform mechanical engineering tasks including engineering analysis, testing, assembly/detail/part fabrication drawings, system, and functional requirements, hazard analysis and Failure Mode and Effects Analysis... (FMEA), vendor performance specifications, maintenance and inspection procedures, and acceptance test plans. You will be asked to work with multiple partners from all levels of the organization to determine data and requirement-inspired technical solutions.

You will report to the Manager, Global Applied Technology.

title: Civil Graduate Engineer
description:
Graduate Engineer

Henderson Professional Engineers is a new civil engineering firm, formed at the end of 2020, with a team that has over 40 years of collective experience in land development and civil engineering. We are passionate about our work and have the drive to be and do better with every project we take in. We want to build the community where we live, work, play, and volunteer...

Our culture at HPE is founded on one thing - relationships. To us, the people we work with and the bonds we form are what allows us to succeed. Our core values are defined as uncompromising honesty, teamwork, efficiency, communication, and continual improvement. We do our best to live up to those values every day and expect the same from every employee.

Our office is located in Round Rock, Texas and most of our staff lives in the same region. We love having everyone in the office to build and maintain the personal relationships with each other, but we are very open to having remote employees.

About the Graduate Engineer role

The Graduate Engineer role is a key role in the production of each land development project. The Graduate Engineer is responsible for developing engineering models for hydraulic analysis, water and wastewater analysis, aid in overall site design and planning, and document tasks for reporting and permitting. The Graduate Engineer will frequently be required to perform the following activities:
Prepare hydraulic models using HEC HMS and/or HEC RAS
Prepare analysis models in AutoCAD Civil 3D for plan production and documentation
Aid in the design and documentation of grading models for detention or site design
Utilize customized spreadsheets and tools
Prepare reports documenting analysis models
Make changes to models and reports under the direction of the Engineer
Provide permitting support by preparing applications and submittals, and addressing comments

Graduate Engineer Experience and Education

A Graduate Engineer must have a basic understanding of engineering principles. A Graduate Engineer should have a bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited four-year college or university and have passed the Fundamentals in Engineering exam. Some of the most important skills and qualifications include:
Good communication, organization and teamworking skills
Effective time management and logical decision-making ability
Capacity to handle pressure and quick turn-around of projects

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Current staff has been vaccinated and masks are optional to staff and clients.

Education:
Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:
AutoCAD Civil 3D: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
Tia was born from the realization that the healthcare system is missing just that: a system enabling health & wellbeing. Tia is the answer to the dehumanizing experiences that women of all backgrounds face navigating the healthcare system. We are rethinking the model of healthcare from the ground up ‚Äì really asking: what does it mean to have a relationship with your care provider? What does it... mean to think about your health every day? How can we get back to the basics and also leverage the cutting edge research in women‚Äôs preventive care? Tia is on a mission to define answers to these questions through building a whole new, distinctly female model of care.

We are on a mission to enable every female to achieve their own definition of optimal health through science-backed information, access to high-quality care, and community.

We opened our first clinic in 2019 in NYC, with more to follow in New York, Los Angeles, and San Francisco this year. Combining virtual and in-person visits, an unwavering commitment to care and accessibility, substantial growth capital and an incredible mission, Tia is poised for rapid growth over the coming years and is building out a world class team to support this expansion.

Tia is building a culture of excellence ‚Äî in people, process and product. This is our northstar value;

What is excellence, exactly?

Excellence about constantly elevating yourself, it is the process of constantly striving to perform to the best of your abilities, and identifying your top potential through constant learning, experimentation and evolution. Excellence is not about achieving perfection, as that insinuates a pinnacle. Instead, in our terms, excellence is about the pursuit of constant improvement. We‚Äôre looking for people who want to go on that hard journey of constantly setting new personal records, and organizational records.

We practice excellence at Tia by demonstrating the following types of behaviors: We chose (and actively choose) excellence as Tia‚Äôs highest order value because it crystalizes into one word several behaviors that we hold dear, specifically:
‚Ä¢ A drive to constantly improve through experimentation, reflection. and an insatiable growth mindset ‚Äî said another way, we‚Äôre energized by the possibility of invention, innovation, and iteration
‚Ä¢ Being present in and grateful for the journey ‚Äî not just the goal line. Perfection is static. Excellence is a process (more on this important distinction below)
‚Ä¢ Asking why, then why again ‚Äî because accepting ‚Äúthis is just the way it is‚Äù is not good enough
‚Ä¢ Grit & perseverance ‚Äî a maker mentality that involves ‚Äúrolling up your sleeves‚Äù, but also deep care for oneself and for others
‚Ä¢ A commitment to uncovering talents to unlock ‚Äúrock star‚Äù potential across every individual

Furthermore, excellence reflects the ‚Äúbigness‚Äù and the ‚Äúboldness‚Äù of Tia‚Äôs mission and vision ‚Äî a world in which every woman can achieve optimal health, as defined by herself.

Said another way, Tia‚Äôs mission is NOT to make healthcare incrementally better for women. Instead, we‚Äôve intentionally set out to create a fundamentally new paradigm for modern women‚Äôs healthcare that‚Äôs truly excellent. We believe that creating a company that operates in a culture of excellence will manifest in our product. Reaching this goal is not an overnight pursuit or a ‚Äúone and done.‚Äù We have not and will not ‚Äúget it right‚Äù with the first swing. Rather, this higher order goal is a moving target ‚Äî one we have not and will not ever fully ‚Äúachieve.‚Äù By design, we will never be ‚Äúdone‚Äù with this work, but instead, we will be continuously in pursuit of our mission. It is this continuous pursuit ‚Äî the journey, not the finish line ‚Äî that truly embodies excellence.

Job Description

We are looking for a highly driven, product-oriented engineer eager to join an early stage team. Your primary responsibilities will include architecting, implementing, releasing and supporting features that enable our collaborative care model. You‚Äôll work side by side with product owners, designers, and engineers to synthesize technical solutions from product requirements that deliver high impact for our customers and business. A commitment to collaborative problem solving, user-centric design, and creating high-quality products is essential.

Location: Remote (US or Canada)

About You:
‚Ä¢ You have 5-7+ years of professional software engineering experience, at least 2 of which were developing full-stack commercial web applications
‚Ä¢ You excel at creating modular software that elegantly separates concerns
‚Ä¢ You design uniform, stateless RESTful APIs that are pragmatic and intuitive
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre fluent with SQL, designing schemas and executing intermediate level queries
‚Ä¢ You have proficiency with a dynamically typed language such as Javascript, Ruby, or Python
‚Ä¢ You understand that communication and collaboration are your biggest responsibilities as an engineer and actively focus on achieving shared context
‚Ä¢ You thrive in a fast-paced, product-oriented agile development environment where your sole focus is shipping software that delivers the most impact to your users and your business
‚Ä¢ You don‚Äôt dwell on mistakes, you own them and use them as opportunities to to learn and grow from
‚Ä¢ You demonstrate strong debugging skills because you‚Äôre curious and seek to develop mastery of your tools and the system in which you‚Äôre building
‚Ä¢ No matter how large, small, complex, or mundane the task, you follow through to the best of your ability and persevere through challenges
‚Ä¢ Your team enjoys collaborating with you. You love to teach and learn from your teammates and celebrate team successes

Why You'll Love Working at Tia:
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll work with a small team of supportive, brilliant engineers like yourself, delivering new products continuously
‚Ä¢ Your success will be visible and your work will impact the lives of our internal care team and patients
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll use creativity to solve novel problems and be encouraged to learn new technologies to meet our business goals
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll have a key role in shaping our engineering culture - from your team‚Äôs technology choices to how we celebrate team wins
‚Ä¢ You will have dedicated career growth support from your manager who has both strong technical and people management experience

Benefits
‚Ä¢ Unlimited vacation
‚Ä¢ Free Tia membership
‚Ä¢ Competitive stock option package
‚Ä¢ $300 one-time WFH stipend
‚Ä¢ $50/month phone and internet reimbursement
‚Ä¢ Medical, dental, and vision benefits
‚Ä¢ 401k program (no matching at this time)
‚Ä¢ Top of the line 15‚Äù Macbook Pro
‚Ä¢ Travel stipend for team off-sites

Tech Stack

NodeJS ‚Ä¢ Typescript ‚Ä¢ React‚Ä¢ Express ‚Ä¢ ES6 ‚Ä¢ PostgreSQL ‚Ä¢ Redis ‚Ä¢ AWS ‚Ä¢ ECS ‚Ä¢ Lambda ‚Ä¢ Docker ‚Ä¢ Cloudformation ‚Ä¢ Git

This position may require attendance at company and team off-sites and is subject the Company‚Äôs vaccine requirement, as permitted by law and subject to reasonable accommodation.

Tia is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and patients. We strongly encourage people of color and members of the LGBTQ+ community to apply.

If you are committed to collaborative problem solving, creating high-quality and user-centric products, and want to make waves in women's healthcare, join us
